loans.name: Claudia Elena

texts.es:
Claudia, de 44 años de edad, es una humilde comerciante de la ciudad de Granada, casada, madre de tres hijos. Se dedica a vender bisutería y gaseosas. Ella dice que su familia le enseño a trabajar desde pequeña vendiendo de manera ambulante, limpiando, cocinando. Al  casarse su esposo la motivo a que pusiera su propio negocio. Fue cuando inicio con un capital muy pequeño a comprar bisuterías luego agrego la venta de gaseosas la ganancia la invierte en comprar mercadería nueva para ofrecer. 
Hoy está necesitando crédito para comprar blusas, aretes,  brazier, calcetas, camisetas, calzones, pantalones. Este crédito le permitirá comprar mercadería variada y ofrecer artículos nuevos a su clientela. Pues su meta es agregar nuevos productos y lograr tener su tienda de mercadería variada.
texts.en:
Forty-four year old Claudia is a humble businesswoman in the city of Granada.  She is married and a mother to three children.  Claudia makes a living selling costume jewellery and fizzy drinks.  She tells us that her family taught her to work from a young age when she did cleaning and cooking work.  When she married, her husband encouraged her to start her own business.  So, with just a little capital she bought costume jewellery and later also started to sell fizzy drinks.  She used her profits to buy more merchandise.

Today Claudia needs a loan in order to buy blouses, earrings, socks, bras, shirts, footwear and trousers.  This loan will allow Claudia to buy a variety of merchandise and offer new items to her customers.  Claudia's goal is to add more products and to have a shop with a variety of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy blouses, earrings, socks, bras, shirts, footwear and trousers.

loans.name: Abdo

texts.en: Abdo is a 53-year-old Lebanese man. He’s married,and lives with his wife and five children, who attend school. Together with his wife, he is trying his best to bring added income to the family and enhance their way of living. He began working as a car blacksmith a few years ago. He has twenty-five years of experience in this domain and has done his best to improve and develop himself. He opened his own garage two years ago. As he wants to enlarge his business and grow his work as well, he decided to take a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase the metal supplies necessary to carry on his work in a proper way. Abdo wishes to offer his family a great life; this is the reason why he needs to amplify his income in order to be able to make the savings necessary to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to purchase the metal supplies needed to carry on his work in the proper way.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is 52 years old. She is from Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is separated and has 13 children. Her transport business is successful, and she's now taking a new loan for her garden as well as her business, to purchase fertilizer such as manure and additional capital for her business. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her transport business to have a better future for the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure and additional capital for her business.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham, 36, is from Ramallah.

She is married and has three children who attend primary schools.

She has owned a beauty salon since 2003, and she has one employee.

She asked Ryada for this loan to buy a steam machine to do facial cleansings at her beauty salon.

She hopes that this loan will help her increase her customers and thus improve her income so that she can provide her children with the best university education in the future.

loans.use: to buy a steam machine to do facial cleansings at her beauty salon.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa nació en la comunidad de Cotañi y vive en la misma comunidad donde nació, ella tiene 45 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene siete hijos, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo. Su actividad económica principal es la agricultura y tiene varios terrenos donde siembra maíz, papa, cebada, avena, habas, etc. Ella también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Sumaq Paqari” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más cuyes y gallina.  

(La comunidad de Cotañi pertenece al distrito de Huancarani dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Rosa was born in the community of Cotañi and she still lives there.  She is forty-five years old, is married, and from this beautiful relationship, she has seven children.  She is a hardworking and enterprising person who gets ahead through a lot of effort and work.  Her principal economic activity is agriculture, and she has several plots of land where she grows corn, potatoes, barley, oats, beans, etc.  She also makes a living in raising small animals, like guinea pigs and chickens.  

For several years, she has belonged to the communal bank "Sumaq Paqari".  In this opportunity, she requires a loan in order to purchase more guinea pigs and chickens.   

The community of Cotañi belongs to the district of Huancarani, within the province of Paucartambo, in the department of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy more guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a 61-year-old married woman with two children who is earning a living with her motor transport services in Bangko, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She has been in this business for 20 years and has an income of 3,000 PHP monthly from this business. She has gained access to micro finance since she joined GDMPC micro credit. Recently, she has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase another set of new tires. She dreams of having a motorcycle with a side car in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase another set of new  tires

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 27 years old and lives in the Congo Town area of Liberia. It is one of the suburbs of the capital city of Monrovia and one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County. The area boasts one of the best standards of living in the county with affordable rents, good roads, access to water and lots of transportation options. 

Ruth is single with two children, ages 5 and 10, which live at home and are currently attending school. The last grade Ruth finished before getting to business is grade 7. For the past six years she has been operating a cook shop (restaurant) where she sells rice and soup in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her mother. Ruth enjoys her business because the business gives her more money. She sells six days a week, from 7 am to 5 pm, and most of the time she uses a taxi to get her goods at her shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients such as fish, pepper, oil, vita, etc. for her business. Her plan is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients such as fish, pepper, oil, vita, etc. for her business

loans.name: Talabbek

texts.en:
Talabbek makes a living by providing a taxi service with his own car. He has been in this business for 15 years. He works from Monday to Sunday. He is 39 years old and married. His wife is a housewife and they have two children, who are 15 and 9 years old. Talabbek is the only feed keeper in his family. He plans to develop his business and maximize his profit as his children have a great demand for money.

Talabbek needs this loan to buy a new car. This will help him to improve the conditions of his taxi service so that he can continue working. His dream is to strengthen his business and offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a car for his taxi business

loans.name: Mark

texts.en: Mark, 27, is a married entrepreneur in Mohon, Panaon. He has one child, and he has been earning money from his transport service business for almost 2 years now. Aside from this business, he owns and manages a farm where he plants and harvests bananas to sell. Recently, he borrowed an amount of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer. He hopes to expand his farm for the better future of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Sadeeqa

texts.en:
Sadeeqa, 27, is from Gaza.

She is married and has one child.

She has owned a grocery store since 2008.

She asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a refrigerator and an electricity generator for her grocery store.

She hopes that this loan will improve her income and thus help her approach her dream of having one big house for her family.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and an electricity generator for her grocery store.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu, 39 years old, operates a shop selling charcoal in the Paynesville South area of Liberia. It is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia and one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County. The area boasts one of the best standards of living in the county with affordable rents, good roads, access to water and lots of transportation options.

Fatu is a widow with six children between the ages of 12 and 21, who are living at home with her. Only four are currently attending school. The last grade Fatu finished before getting into business was Grade 2. For the past six years, she has been selling charcoal in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her mother. She enjoys her business because it gives her more money. She sells six days a week from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. Most of the time, she uses a bus or pickup to get her goods to her shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her charcoal business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction and insulation material for a house for her daughter to live in.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Epifania nació en la comunidad de Cotañi y vive en la misma comunidad donde nació, ella tiene 30  años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene dos hijos, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo. Su actividad económica principal es la artesanía hace tejidos, ella también se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Sumaq Paqari” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar lana de alpaca.  

(La comunidad de Cotañi pertenece al distrito de Huancarani dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Epifania was born in the community of Cotañi, and she still lives there.  She is thirty years old, is married, and through this beautiful relationship, she has two children.  She is a hardworking and enterprising woman that gets ahead through a lot of effort and work.  Her principal economic activity is craftsmanship; she knits.  She also makes a living in agriculture and in raising small animals, like guinea pigs and chickens.  

For several years, she has belonged to the communal bank "Sumaq Paqari".  In this opportunity, she requires a loan in order to buy alpaca wool.  

The community of Cotañi belongs to the district of Huancarani, within the province of Paucartambo and in the department of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy alpaca wool.

loans.name: Ibtissam

texts.en:
Ibtissam is a 50-year-old married woman, mother of five children. She has been working in the food business for 13 years. In 2003, she opened her present convenience store. She is well known in her region with her special prices and quality of products served. Most of Ibtissam's customers are neighbors and friends. In the beginning, she had difficulties how to manage both her business and family needs, but through time she got used to it and she's well organized.

Ibtissam applied for a loan from Kiva's partner in order to increase her business merchandise with special summer beverages. She will also use part of the loan to pay for her son's engagement expenses as her gift to him.

She hopes to open a supermarket in the future, and hopes to keep on providing her family with the necessary needs.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special summer beverages

loans.name: Checjilum Group

texts.es:
La señora Elena es unida de hecho, tiene 32 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela, tiene 6 hijos y de ellos 3 estan estudiando, ella se dedica a actividades pecuarias, compra pollos para engorde y luego los vende, inició este negocio cuando surgio la necesidad de ayudar a su familia, y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de pollos para engordarlos y concentrado para las mismas, en el futuro muy cercano, desea desea tener una granja de pollos de engorde y gallinas ponedoras; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a actividades pecuarias y artesanías.

en la fotografia solamente aparecen 15 integrantes, puesto que las 3 mas, no pudiron asistir cuando se tomo la fotografia.
texts.en:
Elena is 32 years old and is in a domestic partnership. She has six children and three of them attend school. Elena did not have the opportunity to go to school, and makes a living in animal husbandry, buying chickens to fatten up and sell. She started this business when she needed to help her family, and she currently has ten years' experience.

She has formed a group to request a loan, and she will use her portion to buy chickens to fatten up, as well as concentrate feed for them.

Elena wishes to have a farm for chickens and laying hens in the near future. The other members of her group make a living in animal farming and crafts.

Only 15 members are depicted because 3 of them were not able to be present when the picture was taken.

loans.use: to buy chickens to fatten up

loans.name: Ebrahim

texts.en: Ebrahim is a 26-year-old married man with one child. He lives in Sana'a, Yemen. He has completed his bachelor a. recently. He is a soldier making a low salary. He says his salary is not enough to cover his family's expenses. He is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses. Being an ambitious man, he accumulated a small amount to buy a new laptop, but the amount is not enough. So, he applied for a youth loan of 100,000 Yemeni rials from AMB to cover the cost of purchasing a laptop. He hopes to improve his living standards and enroll his child in school.

loans.use: to cover the cost of purchasing a laptop.

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.es:
Mauricia nació en la comunidad de Cotañi y vive en la misma comunidad donde nació, ella tiene 43 años de edad y es soltera, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo. Su actividad económica principal es la artesanía hace tejidos, ella también se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, chanchos y gallinas. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Sumaq Paqari” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar lana de alpaca. 

(La comunidad de Cotañi pertenece al distrito de Huancarani dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Mauricia, 43, single, was born in the community of Cotañi and she still lives there. She is a hardworking and enterprising person that gets ahead with a lot of effort. Her main economic activity is making handicrafts (knitting). She also raises small farm animals like guinea pigs, pigs and hens. Mauricia has been a member of the communal bank “Sumaq Paqari” for some years now and is requesting this time a loan to buy alpaca wool.

(The community of Cotañi belongs to the Huancarani district, which is located in the Paucartambo province, Cusco department in Peru).

loans.use: to buy alpaca wool.

loans.name: Layla

texts.en:
Layla is a 44-year-old single woman who works in a computer business and service to make her living. She has an internet cafe. Almost all of the villagers visit to benefit from her services and the games provided.

Layla works hard to keep her business updated to keep her customers pleased. She applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her computers in reply to the increased number of customers in a well managed way. This increase will definitely reflect positively on her income and living. She hopes to keep on replying to customers' needs and being capable of updating her business in order to move to a bigger place in the future.

loans.use: To increase her computers for additonal income

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es:
Emiliano nació en la comunidad de Cotañi y vive en la misma comunidad donde nació, él tiene 41 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo. Su actividad económica principal es la ganadería, agricultura y a la crianza de animales como ovejas, vacas, cuyes, chanchos y gallinas. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Sumaq Paqari” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. 

(La comunidad de Cotañi pertenece al distrito de Huancarani dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Emiliano was born in the Cotañi community and still lives there.  He is 41 years old, married and has three children.  He is hard-working and enterprising and is moving forward in life with a lot of effort and work.  Emiliano makes a living raising cattle and in agriculture, raising animals such as sheep, cows, guinea pigs, pigs and hens.  Emiliano has been a member of the "Sumaq Paqari" communal bank for some years and, on this occasion, he needs a loan in order to buy young animals such as guinea pigs and hens.

(The Cotañi community is part of the Huancarani district in the Paucartamo province of the department of Cusco, Peru).

loans.use: to buy young animals such as guinea pigs and hens.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José nació en la comunidad de Cotañi y vive en la misma comunidad donde nació, él tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y tiene cinco hijos, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo. Su actividad económica principal es la albañilería, a la agricultura, la ganadería y la crianza de animales como ovejas, vacas, cuyes, chanchos y gallinas, él tambien se dedica a la artesanía o sea hace chulos, mantas, chalinas a base de lana de alpaca y oveja. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Sumaq Paqari” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar lana de alpaca y oveja. 

(La comunidad de Cotañi pertenece al distrito de Huancarani dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
José was born in the Cotañi community and still lives there.  He is 43 years old, married and has five children.  He is hard-working and enterprising and is moving forward in life with a lot of effort and work.  José makes a living in construction, in agriculture, raising cattle and raising animals such as sheep, guinea pigs, pigs and hens.  He also does artisan crafts, making hats, blankets and scarves with alpaca and sheep wool.  José has been a member of the "Sumaq Paqari" communal bank for some years and, on this occasion, he needs a loan in order to buy alpaca and sheep wool.

(The Cotañi community is part of the Huancarani district in the Paucartamo province of the department of Cusco, Peru).

loans.use: to buy alpaca and sheep wool.

loans.name: Batsuh

texts.en: Mr. Batsuh is 48 years old and lives with his wife and four daughters in a ger in Uvs province of Mongolia. His daughters study at local schools and university. His wife, Tsendsuren, is currently unemployed and starting a tailoring business at home along with taking care of the family. Batsuh has been running a taxi service since 2004. He is a well experienced and hardworking man who is now requesting a loan of $2,100 US to replace his vehicle's tires to provide a taxi service smoothly with no sudden pause. He is the only working person at this time and he covers all the family expenses with his taxi service.

loans.use: to replace his vehicle's tires to provide taxi service smoothly with no sudden pause

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
47-year-old Victoria operates a small local shop selling slippers, baby-grease, cream, combs and diapers  in the Paynesville South area of Liberia.  It is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia and one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County.  The area boasts one of the best standards of living in the county with affordable rents, good roads, access to water and lots of transportation options. 

Victoria is single and has six children, aged between 22 and 10. Three are currently attending school and five of them live at home.  She stopped her education at KII,(class next to first grade).  She describes herself as a good businesswoman.

Victoria has had a shop business for the past 22 years.  She works 12 hours a day, six days a week at her business.  Her greatest challenge in business is during the rainy season when she hardly gets any customers. She intends to use the loan to buy more inventory for her business. She started her business with help from her brother and mother. She likes her business because it helps buy some items in the home.  In the future, she wants to own a house.  

Victoria wants to thank the lenders for supporting BRAC Liberia and its borrowers.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her business.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi vit avec son conjoint revendeur  et leurs 04 enfants à Lomé. Les trois premiers âgés de 6,4 et 02ans sont scolarisés. Quant au dernier de 07 mois il est toujours avec sa maman. Afi afin de prêter main forte à son conjoint dans les charges du foyer, revend depuis 2007 des habits (friperie) dans une boutique. Comme perspectives d’avenir, elle espère avoir une autre boutique et améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Afi lives with her salesman husband and their four children in Lomé. The three eldest - aged six, four, and two years old - all attend school. As for the youngest, at seven months he is still with his mother. In order to assist her husband in covering the household expenses, Afi has been selling secondhand outfits in a shop since 2007.
As for the future, she hopes to have a second store and to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.en:
Abdurahmon is 58 years old. He and his wife are farmers and have two children. He is very hardworking and kind-natured. He has a lot of friends and all of them love him very much.

Abdurahmon has been farming for 25 years, producing potatoes and wheat. He has been in this line of work since he was a young man, so all of his experience has been dedicated to producing crops. His produce is sold at the local market in the region.

He wants to develop his business further and for that, he needs to improve the condition of his land. He has no money to buy mineral fertilizers and that’s why he is asking for a loan of 3000 somoni to buy mineral fertilizers. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers for the land where he grows potatoes and wheat

loans.name: Comfort's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of four members: Comfort, Mary L, Hannah and Mary A. They sell provisions, fish and slippers. They reside in the Teshie community. They have been together from 2010 to date and are still doing very well.

Comfort is a 73-year-old widow and sells provision (biscuits, toffee, detergents, bread, Milo, milk, rice, and sugar). She is very happy and active in what she does. She has been with ID Ghana for the past three years and is doing very well. She has been in this business activity for 22 years now. She works from Mondays to Saturdays and has six apprentices. 

This is Comfort's 4th loan and she needs the amount of GHS 800 to buy more goods to sell to her customers. She is grateful to ID Ghana. 

Her group needs a total amount of GHS 3,150 to buy more goods to sell to their customers in the Teshie community.

loans.use: To buy  biscuits, toffee, detergents, bread, Milo, milk, rice, and sugar to sell to customers.

loans.name: Denis

texts.es: Denis tiene la edad de 18 años, está soltero y vive con los padres y hermanos. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de abono y dar asistencia  a la plantación de café. El desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarles a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Denis is 18 years old, single, and lives with his parents and siblings. He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and to care for his coffee crop. He would like to maintain his coffee crop so that it will produce more and therefore give him more income. He hopes in the future to give his parents a better quality of life and more financial stability. He also hopes to continue growing as a person and as a coffee grower. This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He had not previously had any loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR gave him the loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizer for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 40 year old resident of Kinaawa who is married with two children who all attend school. She has a business of poultry that she runs in order to support the family in meeting their basic needs. 

Mariam received a loan of ugx.1,000,000/= for specifically paying school fees for her children whom she wants to acquire knowledge for their bright future. 

Mariam’s customers are the restaurants, chicken rosters and the neighbors who come from different places to buy chicken.
 
However, Mariam faces challenges of inadequate capital, diseases which affect her birds, high increased price in poultry feeds, competition as well. 

Mariam is a hardworking woman and has the capability of doubling her income if she gets enough capital.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed and expand her small scale poultry farm.

loans.name: Taywah

texts.en:
Taywah is 23 years old and operates a table market selling goods such as rice, pepper, oil etc in the Paynesville South area of Liberia.  

It is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia and one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County. The area boasts one of the best standards of living in the county with affordable rents, good roads, access to water and lots of transportation options. 

Taywah is single with a three year old child who lives at home with her. She is also attending school, and finished the 12th grade. For the past ten years she has been selling rice, oil, pepper etc in the local market, she started this business with money given to her by her mother. She enjoys her business because it gives her more money. 

She sells six days a week, from 7am to 6pm, and most of the time she uses shared taxis to get her goods to her shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase more stock for her business, her plan is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her business

loans.name: Uktam

texts.en:
Uktam has been involved in agriculture for 30 years, growing mainly corn and beans. He sells his crops in the local market. With the profits he earns from sales, he helps cover family expenses. He lives with his family in his own home. 

Uktam is requesting a loan for $3,000, which he will use to buy farm supplies, such as fertilizers and seeds, to help with his cultivating activity, so he can improve the cropland and earn more income. What he sells now is not enough to cover his expenses, so the loan will help him continue covering farming expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Boubou

texts.fr:
Monsieur BOUBOU est né vers 1970, marié et père de six enfants, il vit dans une famille traditionnelle au quartier Fana-coura dans la ville de Fana, avec ses deux épouses,  Région de Koulikoro République du Mali. 
BOUBOU, s’est installé dans les activités d’achat et de vente  des articles divers il y’a près d’une dizaine d’année. Il est très sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses articles.
Dans le souci de satisfaire cette clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse et exigeante, il décide de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son sixième prêt et tous les cinq précédents se sont bien dénoués, souvent par anticipation.  
Avec ce  nouveau prêt, il compte acheter  une quantité importante d’articles divers : façades de téléphones, montres, radio, piles, lunettes et pochettes pour téléphones avec les grossistes de Bamako. Ses marchandises sont vendues dans le marché de Fana dans un kiosque aux abords du goudron. La clientèle est composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice de 140 000F CFA par  mois  qu’il utilisera pour les dépenses de la famille et le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Boubou was born in around 1970. Married and the father of six children, he lives with his two wives in a traditional family in the Fana-coura district of the town of Fana - in the Koulikoro region of the Republic of Mali.
Boubou began buying and selling various objects about ten years ago. He is much sought after by his customers, due to the quality of his products. With the objective of meeting the demand from this growing and increasingly demanding customer base, he decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso.
He is on his sixth loan, and all the previous five are fully repaid - often early. With this new loan, he intends to purchase a significant quantity of the following items: Telephone covers, watches, radios, batteries, glasses and pouches for mobile phones - all from wholesalers in Bamako.
His products are sold in Fana market from a stand at the side of the road. His customers are both male and female.
He plans to make a monthly profit of 140,000F CFA which he will use partly to cover family expenses, and the rest will be put back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase various items for resale.

loans.name: Ichiaka

texts.fr:
Monsieur ICHIAKA est né vers 1988, marié et père d’un enfant, il vit dans une famille traditionnelle au quartier Badialan avec ses parents, dans la ville de Fana  Région de Koulikoro République du Mali. 
Monsieur ICHIAKA, excelle dans l’achat vente de chaussures en plastique il y’a près de deux ans.
Il est à son sixième prêt et tous les précédents ont été bien dénoués souvent anticipés.  
Avec ce nouveau prêt, il compte acheter  cinq balles de chaussures en plastique avec les grossistes de Bamako. Ces chaussures seront vendues dans le marché de Fana sous un hangar et une partie est aussi vendue dans les environnants pendant leur jours de foire respectif. La clientèle est composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice de 90 000F CFA par  mois  qu’il utilisera pour les dépenses de la famille et le reste dans son activité de vente de chaussures.
texts.en:
Ichiaka was born around 1988. Married and the father of one child, he lives with his parents in a traditional family in the Badialan district of Fana, a town in the Koulikoro region of the Republic of Mali. Ichiaka has been doing well trading plastic shoes for almost two years now. He is on his sixth loan, and all the previous ones have been fully repaid - often early.
With this new loan, he intends to buy fives bundles of plastic shoes from the wholesalers in Bamako. These shoes will be sold in Fana market under a canopy, and some will also be sold in the surrounding areas on their respective market days - to both male and female customers.
He plans to make a monthly profit of 90,000F CFA, part of which he will use to cover the family's expenses with the rest invested back into his shoe selling business.

loans.use: to purchase shoes

loans.name: Iram

texts.en:
Iram is a 33-year-old married woman. She has been in a beauty parlor business for two years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through her services she has become very famous in her street. 

In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetics products for the parlor. But because of having low cash in hand she contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for her fourth loan. She needs a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities. She is hopeful to get a boost in her earnings by catering to more customers time after time.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is 23 years old and from Gaza. He has owned a shop for selling soft drinks and sweets since 2011.

He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a refrigerator and juice squeezer for his soft drinks and sweets shop. He hopes that this loan will help him increase his sales and thus, improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and juice squeezer for his soft drinks and sweets shop.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 42 years old and lives in Paynesville South, a suburb just outside Monrovia. The area is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County, with one of the best standards of living in the country. Good roads, access to clean water, affordable rents and plentiful transportation options make Paynesville South one of the most popular places to live.  

Annie is a widow with two children, aged 20 and 18; they both live in the same house with their mother. She is a high school graduate. For the past 10 years, she has been selling charcoal in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her mother. She enjoys her business because the business gives her more money. She sells six days a week, from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m., and most of the time, she uses a taxi to get her goods to her shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her plan is to buy a car and build a store.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Juliet's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of three members; Juliet Lydia, Margeret and Bernice. They sell soft drink, provision, slippers and batik in the Teshie community. They have been a group from February, 2013.

Juliet is a 36 year old batik designer who is married to Frank, a 37 year old welder. They have 2 children. She has been designing and selling batik for the past 6 years. She sells from Mondays to Sunday from her home to her customer. She is standing in the middle of the photograph.

This is her 5th loan and she needs GHS 1,100 to buy materials & dyes to design batik, in order to sell to her customers. 

The group needs a total amount of GHS 2,300 to buy more goods to sell to their customers in the community.

loans.use: to buy materials & dyes to design batik, in order to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Basel

texts.en:
Basel is 28 years old and from Gaza.

He has owned a project for house cleaning and polishing tiles since 2011 and he has one employee. He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a new machine for tile polishing.

Through this loan he will be able to increase the scope of his work and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a new machine for polishing tiles

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Ms. Riffat is a 28-year-old vigorous, married woman. She has been involved in the business of hand-embroidery for many years. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband does not earn enough to support his family well alone. 

Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. She is a mother of four children; all are school-going. 

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 20,000 Pakistan rupees to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet with the increasing demand. She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her town. She would like to teach embroidery skills to them, so they can help her expand her business, and also earn money for themselves.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet with the increasing demand.

loans.name: Maime

texts.en:
Maime is 32 years old, and lives in Montserrado County which has the largest Free-port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is living together with her fiancee and has seven children aged between 9 months to 9 years old,  only three attend school, and they all live at home.

Unfortunately she finished her education at 6th grade, but she manages her business well. For the past five years she has been operating a table market where she sells rice, bitter-ball, pepper, okra, etc in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her fiancee and enjoys her business because it gives her more money.  

She sells six days a week, from 7am to 5pm, and most of the time she uses the bus to get her goods to her spot. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, bitter-ball, pepper, okra, etc for her business, and her plan is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, bitter-ball, pepper, okra, etc for her business

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 30-year-old married lady who has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Sajida makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan for PKR 30,000, which she will use to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her 6th loan cycle with a good repayment history. Sajida wishes to use part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Shafaq

texts.en:
Ms. Shafaq is a 32-year-old and a mother of two children. For the past three years, she has been running a business of cloth selling. By this time, she has become famous in her community for providing good quality fabric in unique designs and colors. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters, as well as financial matters. 

While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her child to school for studies. She has some savings and applied for a loan of 30,000 rupees to purchase more variety of cloths in different colors and designs by taking into account the taste and choice of her customers. She is in her third loan cycle with Kashf Foundation and has shown excellent repayment behavior.  She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of cloths in different colors and designs by taking into account the taste and choice of her customers.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Ms. Nasreen is 35 years old and a married woman. Four years ago, she started her own business of hand embroidery. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Nasreen’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. She is a mother of eight children and wants to grow her business.  She contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 15,000 rupees to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand of her customers without fail. She shared her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Ms. Zarina is 51-year-old married woman. She is a vigorous lady and, for the past three years, has been running a business of cloth trade. Zarina buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She always has a great collection to offer to her customers and makes enough to fulfill the needs of her four children. 

She is in her third loan cycle; currently she requested a loan of 25,000 rupees from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of summer cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of summer cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Nasrin

texts.en:
Ms. Nasrin is a 51-year-old married woman who has been doing a business of animal sales for the last one year. She buys animals (baby goats and baby cows) at low prices and brings them up, then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. Now she has seven goats; her business is good enough to lead her a decent life. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; currently she requested a loan of  20,000 rupees to purchase two more goats. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all of her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Nasiran

texts.en:
Nasiran had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. 

Two years ago she began stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. She is a mother of three and motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.  

By this time she has attained regular list of customers but due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy material including cloth, threads in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons. 

She is currently in her third loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy material including cloth, threads in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is home to the main campus of Moi University. She has three children and has been doing this farming work for four years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Milking my cow." Her biggest challenge is getting dairy feeds. An animal on the farm has been given the names of Sossini.

Emily was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "They offer affordable interest rates." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "Dairy keeping."

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Emily replied that she will get milk to feed her family.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Emily owns the following: cow and poultry, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, solar power, TV and DVD, but does not have electricity, running water or a sewing machine.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 42 years old, married, and has four children. She has been successfully running a general store at the corner of her house, which she has been doing for three years.  Her husband assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market. 

Nasreen is requesting a loan for 25,000 PKR, which she will use to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. Nasreen is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Activas está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, son mujeres que con las ganas de salir adelante se han unido y están luchando tenazmente por ir creciendo.
Shirley es la presidenta del grupo, ella siempre se esfuerza por crecer y salir adelante, ser el ejemplo para sus compañeras y motivarlas a seguir. Shirley por su parte se dedica a la venta de joyas de todo, lo cual al principio le costó un poco, pero con el tiempo fue creciendo.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de cadenas, anillos, aros, pulseras y demás joyas para poderlas vender y ofrecer joyas novedosas a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group called “Mujeres Activas” (Active Women) is in its third cycle of the Women’s Committee Program.  They are women who, with a desire to get ahead, have come together and are tenaciously fighting to grow.

Shirley is the president of the group.  She always strives to grow and to get ahead, to be the example for her colleagues and motivate them to keep going.  Shirley, for her part, makes a living selling all kinds of jewelry, which at first was a little difficult for her but grew with time.

She is requesting this loan to buy chains, rings, earrings, bracelets and other jewelry to be able to sell them and offer novel jewelry to her customers.

loans.use: to buy chains, rings, earrings, bracelets, etc.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a 28-year-old married woman who is running a business of stitching. She very well knows the techniques of stitching and designing clothes and makes enough to meet the household expenses. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  

She earns enough to lead a decent life. She is a mother of three and is striving hard to meet their demands including food, clothing, and health. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors and packs of zippers, buttons and laces to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors and packs of zippers, buttons and laces to meet increasing demand.

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en:
Nabeela is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of two daughters. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members alone. This compelled Nabeela to initiate her own beauty parlor business to contribute to the family income. For this purpose she spared a corner of her house and started providing services of makeup, hair styling and facials to the people of her community. 

Through her services she has become very famous in her street. In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetics products for the parlor. But because of having low cash in hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for her first loan. 

She needs a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities. She is hopeful to cater to more customers time after time, which ultimately will help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.

loans.name: Roshan

texts.en:
Ms Roshan is a 43-year-old, married woman, running a business of milk sales with her husband for 15 years. Now, they has four buffaloes and they sell their milk to many of their neighbors, along with butter and cheese that they make from the milk.  She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them, while her husband sells it to different places, on a daily basis. They are happily doing it together to support their family.  

Roshan is a mother of four children and she needs to earn much more money to meet their everyday expenditures, including food, clothing, and education. In order to make huge profits, she requested for a loan of PKR 20,000/- to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk which, ultimately, helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Pocohilense Group

texts.es:
La señora Tomasa Martin de estado civil soltera, tiene 28 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, se dedica a tejer guipiles y fajas para damas, inició este negocio con el apoyo de su madre y hasta el momento lleva 3 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y decide solicitar un préstamo para ampliar su capital de trabajo, comprando hilos para poder tejer guipiles y fajas, en el futuro desea obtener un capital grande para poder ofrecer variedad de estilos en sus ventas; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a artesania. en la fotografia solamente aparecen 9 integrantes, hacen falta 2 que no pudieron asistir a la reunion.
texts.en:
Tomasa Martin, 28, is single.  She didn't have the opportunity to go to school.  She makes a living weaving huipiles [traditional blouses] and belts for women.  She started this business with the support of her mother and currently has three years of experience.

She's organizing a group and decided to request a loan to expand her working capital by buying thread to be able to weave huipiles and belts.  In the future she wants to get more capital to be able to offer a variety of styles to sell

The other members of the group make a living in handicrafts.

Only nine members appear in the photograph.  The missing two weren't able to attend the meeting.

loans.use: to buy thread

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. 

She has been involved in a business of carpet manufacturing for many years. She makes it with the special kind of wood known as dub wood. The carpets are used in mosques for the purpose of prayer.  

She has become popular in her community for providing good quality carpets. In this way, she is able to handle her family needs and requirements efficiently. 

In order to purchase a stock of wood and some utensils such as cutters and scissors, she applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to Kashf Foundation. This is her second loan. It will help her to increase her production of carpets and her sales. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of wood and some utensils such as cutters and scissors.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca nació en la comunidad de Pumapaqcha y vive en la misma comunidad donde nació, ella tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo. Su actividad económica principal es la artesanía hace tejidos, ella también se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales como ovejas, vacas, cuyes, chanchos y gallinas. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Sumaq Paqari” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. 

(La comunidad de Pumapaqcha pertenece al distrito de Huancarani dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Francisca, 43, lives in the same community in which she was born, Pumapaqcha.  She's married and has three children.  She's a hardworking and enterprising person who gets ahead with a lot of effort and work.

Her main work is in handicrafts making textiles.  She also makes a living in agriculture and raising animals such as sheep, cows, guinea pigs, pigs, and chickens.

She has belonged to Sumaq Paqari Communal Bank for several years.  Currently she needs a loan to buy small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens.

(The community of Pumapaqcha is in the district of Huancarani in the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco, Peru.)

loans.use: to buy small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens

loans.name: Gracemary

texts.en: This is 54-year-old Gracemary. She is married and has two children, 11 and 15 years old. In 1999, Gracemary established her pharmacy. She started her business just after she graduated from nursing school as a trained and qualified nurse. Working six days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,200,000 a month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Gracemary needs a loan in order to buy pharmaceutical drugs costing SLL 3,000,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 900,000. Unfortunately, Gracemary has not achieved her goal, because of domestic problems, but she is hoping to achieve it this time. Honest and hard-working, she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceutical drugs costing SLL 3,000,000 for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.es:
La Sra. Bernarda está casada con el Sr. Ramón hace varios años, tienen 3  hijas pequeñas, por quienes el y su esposa se esfuerzan para poder sacarlos adelante.
Bernarda; tiene un negocio propio que había montado con  mucho esfuerzo, tiene una despensa bien surtida, en la que desde muy tempranas horas trabaja. Además de su trabajo, el Sr. Ramón trabaja como contratista para ayudar a su señora con los gastos del hogar. Gracias al trabajo que están realizando educan a sus hijas, y compran todas las necesidades de su hogar.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser bebidas, verduras, frutas, y demás insumos de primera necesidad para poder seguir dando a sus clientes todo lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
Bernarda has been married to Ramón for a number of years.  They have three young daughters who they work hard to provide for.

Bernarda has her own business which she worked hard to set up.  She has a well-stocked grocery store in which she works from very early in the morning.  In addition, Ramón works as a builder to help his wife with the household expenses.  Thanks to their joint work, they are providing their daughters with an education and are able to buy household necessities.

Bernarda is requesting this loan to invest in buying supplies for her store such as drinks, vegetables, fruit and other basic products so that she can continue giving her customers everything they need.

loans.use: to buy drinks, vegetables, fruit and other goods

loans.name: Winnifed

texts.en:
Winnifed is 33 years old. She resides in Paynesville South, a suburb just outside Monrovia. The area is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County with one of the best standards of living in the country. Good roads, access to clean water, affordable rents and plentiful transportation options makes Paynesville South one of the most popular places to live. 

She is a single and has four children between 20 and 6. Two live at home and attend school. She is a high school graduate, and she describes herself as a very hardworking woman.

For the past four years she has been operating a table where she sells rice, charcoal, oil, etc., around the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her mother. She enjoys her business because the business gives her more money. She sells six days a week, from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. and most of the time she uses a bus to get her goods to her table. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more inventories such as rice, charcoal, oil, etc., for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more inventories such as rice, charcoal, oil, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Janneh

texts.en: This is 33-year-old Janneh from Liberia. She resides in Paynesville South, a suburb just outside Monrovia. This is one of the most heavily populated areas in Montserrado County, with one of the best standards of living in the country. Good roads, access to clean water, affordable rents and plentiful transportation options make Paynesville South one of the most popular places to live. Janneh is single with two children, 8 months and 6 years old. One is currently attending school, and they both live with her in her home. She runs a business selling items such as rice, oil, salt and coal from a market table. She describes herself as a serious businesswoman. She started her business one year ago, using money given to her by her mother. Typically, she works at her business from 7 AM to 6 PM, from Monday to Saturday. She transports her goods to her business by bus. She cites her greatest challenge as a shortage of capital. She is proud of her business, because it supports her household. Using the proceeds of this loan, she intends to buy more inventory. In the future, she plans to build her house and educate her children. She sincerely thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her business selling items such as rice, oil, salt and coal from a market table.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Ms Nasreen is a 52-year-old, married woman. She is an energetic, hard-working lady and, for the past five months, has been running a business of cloth sales. She buys cloth of different fabrics, in various colors and designs, from the market, at wholesale rates, and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough money through her business. 

Nasreen requested a loan of PKR 35,000 from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs, to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs, to attract more customers and expand her inventory.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is a 28-year-old married woman. The man shown with her in the photo is Zarina’s husband.

She is doing her own business of weaving rugs and shawls with the support of her husband. They have gained three years of experience in this field and have built a successful business. Both are doing it happily together to earn enough for their hand-to-mouth existence. 

Zarina applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy raw materials such as bundles of wool and threads in various colors. With the help of this loan, she hopes to increase her sales and wishes to spend part of profits on providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as bundles of wool and threads in various colors.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 24-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. 

She has been running a business of clothing sales for two years. She purchases a variety of cloths in various colors and fabric and after doing stitching, she sells them to the people of her community. She receives orders on a daily basis and makes enough to contribute to the family income.  

To meet the orders of her customers on time, Asia requested a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloth in various colors and packs of spools of threads and laces. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her greater sales. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of cloth in various colors and packs of spools of threads and laces.

loans.name: Tuychiboy

texts.en: Tuychiboy is married and has two children, who he has always wanted to provide with a good quality of life. It’s for this reason that, six years ago, he began own business of driving. By providing good service, he has managed to gain many customers. Since he’s had his business, his family’s quality of life has been improving.  His children are able to get a good education, and the financial challenges are being solved little by little. He is applying for a loan to buy new truck. This will permit him to provide better service and to increase his income, which will allow him to offer his children and wife a better quality of life and better financial opportunities for getting ahead.

loans.use: to buy a new truck for his transportation business.

loans.name: Kubra

texts.en:
Ms. Kubra is a 37-year-old, married woman, and a mother of four children. For many years, she has been running a business of trading cloth. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her community. By this time, she has become famous for selling good-quality cloth in her community. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

Currently, Kubra has requested a loan of PKR 35,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloth of the summer season, by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. 

Kubra is in her fifth loan cycle, with good repayment history. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloth of the summer season.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: This is 28-year-old Helena from Liberia. She resides in Paynesville South, a suburb just outside Monrovia. This is one of the most heavily populated areas in Montserrado County, with one of the best standards of living in the country. Good roads, access to clean water, affordable rents and plentiful transportation options make Paynesville South one of the most popular places to live. Helena lives with her fiancé and three children, who are between the ages of five and ten. Her three children are attending school, and they live with her in her home. She runs a business selling fresh fish from a market table. She describes herself as a serious businesswoman. She started her business two years ago, using money given to her by her fiancé. Typically, she works at her business from 7 AM to 6 PM, Monday to Saturday.  She transports goods to her business by shared taxi. She cites her greatest challenge as a shortage of capital. She is proud of her business because it supports her household. She intends to use the proceeds of this loan to buy fresh fish for her business. In the future, she plans to build her house and educate her children. She sincerely thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to sell at her market table.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Fatu from Liberia. She resides in Paynesville South, a suburb just outside Monrovia. This is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County, with one of the highest standards of living in the country. Good roads, access to clean water, affordable rents and plentiful transportation options make Paynesville South one of the most popular places to live. Fatu is married and has six children, between the ages of 1 and 18. Five of her children are attending school, and they all live with her in her home. She runs a business selling items such as rice, oil, pepper, Vita juice and onions from a market table. She describes herself as a serious businesswoman. She started her business two years ago, using money given to her by her husband. Typically, she works at her business from 7 AM to 4 PM, Monday to Saturday. She transports her goods to her business by bus. She cites her greatest challenge as a shortage of capital. She is proud of her business because it supports her household. She intends to use the proceeds of this loan to buy more items for her business, such as rice, oil, pepper, Vita juice and onions. In the future, she plans to build her house and educate her children. She sincerely thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as rice, oil, pepper, Vita juice and onions to sell at her market table.

loans.name: Sabougnouman Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMAN III sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Sirimou, un des villages de la commune de Marka Coungo, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres  l’arachide, du mil, du gombo et du sésame. Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, TATA première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des débout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1Ha de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Marka Coungo, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50 000F CFA environs par campagne qui sera utiliser aider le conjoint dans les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The seven members of the group SABOUGNOUMAN III are married women averaging 39 years of age and four children each. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in Sirimou, a village in Commune de Marka Coungo, in Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their work at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown include peanuts, millet, okra, and sesame. The group members are on their sixth collaboration with the institution. 

With this new loan, TATA, who is the first person  standing from the left in the photo, intends to purchase farm inputs and sundry equipment and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining about 1 hectare of millet and peanuts. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in Marka Coungo City to a customer base composed of women and men. She plans on making an average profit of about 50,000 francs per planting. The profits will be used to help her husband in covering family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, weeding, and sundry equipment

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is a primary banana and sugar cane-growing region. She has two children and has been doing farming for 12 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Digging." Her biggest challenges are: "Climate change and disease." Animals on the farm have been given the names of: "Nyota."

Alice was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "Assisted her to buy a cow."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi Kilimo's required microfinance training session: "Benefits of microfinances."

Her highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked, "How will this loan benefit her family?," Alice replied: "Will increase milk production."

As part of Juhudi Kilimo's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Alice owns the following: 'cow, poultry, and pump,' but she does not own: 'pig, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards, based on this loan. This borrower has in the household: 'mosquito net, electricity, running water, sewing machine, TV, and DVD,' but does not have: 'solar power.'

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to pay for a dairy cow.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 33 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single and has four children, whose ages are between 20 and nine years old. Only two are in school and all four of them live at home. She described herself as a hard-working woman.

For the past three years, Beatrice has been running a small, local shop where she sells used clothes in the local market. She sells six days a week, from 7am to 5pm. She likes her business because of the ways in which customers buy from her and she started this business with money given to her by her mother. Every day, she uses a shard-taxi to get her goods to her business spot. 

Beatrice is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She plans to build a house for her children. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia Microfinance Company Limited.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Bridget's Group

texts.en:
Bridget's Group consists of four partners residing in Teshie. They are Bridget, Joyce, Esther and Felix. They have been together for one year and are still doing very well. They sell fish, second-hand clothing, and charcoal. 

Felix, the leader, is a 33-year-old, second-hand clothing seller. He is single and has been doing this work for the past three years. Through his dedication and seriousness in his business, he has been able to build up trust with ID Ghana. 

For this loan, he is requesting an amount of GHS 400 to help him boost the business and to satisfy his customers, in and around the community.

The four members, together, need GHS 1,450 to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: to buy one bale of jeans skirts to sell to women.

loans.name: Corazon Valiente Group

texts.es:
El grupo denominado Corazon Valiente está en el programa de comité de jóvenes, ellos se han unido con la esperanza de que por medio del trabajo en conjunto de todos ellos al menos puedan crecer y ayudar a sus padres.
La Srita. Yeny es una de la integrantes, ella es presidenta  del grupo se dedica a la venta de lencería en puesto de venta que tiene su abuela, hay día en que sale a hacer sus ventas en forma ambulante, para tener mejores resultados con su venta. Por medio de su esfuerzo por salir adelante ella logró mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, recibe asistencia  permanente, asiste a reuniones de su comité.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder usarlo en la compra de lencería con lo cual podrá seguir teniendo buena variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes. En la foto aparecen 10 personas, ya que los extras son los codeudores de los 
.
texts.en:
The 'Corazon Valiente' (Brave Heart) group is taking part in the Young People's Committee program.  They have come together in the hope that, through their joint work, they will be able to grow and help their parents. 

Yeny is one of the members of this group and is also the group president.  Her business is selling underwear from a sales stall belonging to her grandmother, though there are some days when she goes out to make her sales as an itinerant street vendor, in order to achieve better sales.  Through her efforts to get ahead, she has managed to improve her own quality of life as well as that of her family.  She receives permanent assistance and attends her committee's meetings.

Yeny is requesting this loan to buy underwear so that she can continue having a good range to offer her customers.  n.b. There are ten people in the photo as some of them are co-signers to the young people's loan.

loans.use: to buy underwear for resale

loans.name: Rosaura Aracely

texts.es:
Rosaura,  se le presenta la necesidad de seguir invirtiendo más en el negocio de venta de ropa y en la tienda, por eso requiere de capital de trabajo; este le permitirá  comprar productos de la canasta basica para la tienda tales como: aceite, frijoles, arroz, embutidos; asimismo ropa para damas y niñas tales como: blusas, camisas, vestidos, pantalones, chores, trajes, overol, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus inventarios y obtener más ingresos; las condiciones económicas han mejorado y las circunstancias familiares se mantienen.
texts.en: Rosaura needs to further invest in her clothing business and her store.  In order to achieve this, she needs working capital.  This will enable her to buy basic household products for her store such as oil, beans, rice and sausages.  She will also buy ladies' and girls' clothing such as blouses, shirts, dresses, pants, shorts, suits, overalls, etc.  The previous loan helped her to increase her stock levels and make more income.  Her financial situation has improved and her family's situation is stable.

loans.use: to buy oil, beans, rice, sausages, blouses, shirts, dresses, pants, shorts, suits, overalls, etc.

loans.name: Sabougnouman Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMAN II des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Sirimou, un des villages de la commune de Marka Coungo,  préfecture de Dioîla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres  l’arachide, du mil, du gombo et du sésame. Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, PAYE première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des débout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1hectare  de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Marka Coungo, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50 000FCFA environs par campagne qui aidera le conjoint à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.

The women live for the most part in polygamous families in Sirimou, a village in Commune de Marka Coungo, Dioîla prefecture, in Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their work at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown include peanuts, millet, okra, and sesame. The group members are on their sixth collaboration with the institution. 

With this new loan, PAYE, who is the first person  standing from the left in the photo, intends to purchase farm inputs and sundry equipment and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining about 1 hectare of millet and peanuts. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in Marka Coungo City to a customer base composed of women and men. She plans on making an average profit of about 50,000 francs per planting. The profits will be used to help her husband to cover family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, weeding, and sundry equipment.

loans.name: Sabougnouman I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMAN I sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Sirimou, un des villages de la commune de Marka Coungo, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide, le mil, du gombo et du sésame. Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution.
