They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their work at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown include peanuts, millet, okra, and sesame. The group members are on their sixth collaboration with the institution. 

With this new loan, KOROTOUMOU, who is sitting first from the right in the photo, intends to purchase farm inputs and sundry equipment and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining about 1 hectare of millet and peanuts. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in Marka Coungo City to a customer base composed of women and men. She plans on making an average profit of about 100,000 francs CFA per planting. The profits will be used to help cover family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, weeding, and sundry equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a water pump kit for irrigation

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther lives in Sibnkor, a section of Montserrado County, which is the capital of Liberia and its well-known commercial center. She is 38 years old, married, and the mother of three children between the ages of 7 and 13, all of whom are enrolled in school and live at home. For the last six years, she has earned a living by selling dried fish in the local community market. She started this business with help from her husband and learned the trade from her mother. She works for eight hours a day and transports her produce to market by using taxis. She describes herself as business-minded, and enjoys her work because she can earn a good profit. She is requesting a loan to buy more dry fish to sell so that she can expand her sales and pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to expand her sales by buying more dried fish.

loans.name: Tiessiri  V Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  membres du groupe TIESSIRI  V sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Koni, un des villages de la commune de Marka Coungo,   région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide, du mil et du sésame. Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, KADIATOU troisième personne au milieu, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1.Ha de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Maraka Coungo, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100 000F CFA environs par campagne qui sera utilisé pour aider le mari à prendre en charge les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The five members of the group "TIESSIRI V" are married women averaging 35 years of age and four children each. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in Koni, a village in Commune de Marka Coungo, in Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their work at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown include peanuts, millet, and sesame. The group members are on their sixth collaboration with the institution. 

With this new loan, KADIATOU, who the third person in the middle in the photo, intends to purchase farm inputs and sundry equipment and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining about 1 hectare of millet and peanuts. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in Marka Coungo City to a customer base composed of women and men. She plans on making an average profit of about 100,000 francs CFA per planting. The profits will be used to help her husband to cover family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, weeding, and sundry equipment.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a Ugandan citizen, aged 45 and divorced with 4 children, all attending school. Robert is a businessman who deals in produce and the cattle trade, and also grows different types of crops which work as side income for him.

He has done these businesses for the last 5 years and says his main purpose was to boost his income and take care of his children. He has purposely applied for this loan to buy a piece of land to help provide a cattle shed and a farm house for the cattle herders.  
 
He also hopes to use this loan to buy two Friesian bulls for cross breeding for better yields. This will further finance studies for his children. Robert confesses that his main challenges are dealing with cattle and livestock diseases, epidemics like foot and mouth disease, and disasters like droughts that have run for over eight months. However, he boasts of improvement in his daily life because of this business.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: La Sra. Lucy  tiene 45 años,  casada con dos hijos de las edades de 18 y 13, todos ellos en edad escolar,  ella se dedica al comercio de variedad de carne en su carnicería que se encuentran en la zona de Tahuantinsuyo,  este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Lucy  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de un congelador grande para conservar sus productos en buen estado su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que requiere la congeladora para la venta de carne., la Sra. Lucy  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que hay varias carnicerías en la zona, pero ella tiene mucha clientela por la amabilidad con la que trata a su clientela y  va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de otra congeladora grande, su deseo para su negocio es tener un negocio estable y rentable y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Lucy is 45 years old. She is married and she has two children.  The children are 18 and 13 years old. Both are in school. Lucy sells a variety of meats at her butcher shop located in the Tahuantinsuyo area. This loan is her second with the institution. Lucy is going to use this loan to purchase a large freezer for keeping her products in good condition. The reason for requesting this loan is that a freezer is required for selling meat.  The challenge Lucy faces in her business is competition since there are several butchers in the area. She has a large customer base because of her friendly manner with her customers. She is going to use these benefits to purchase another large freezer. Her wish for her business is to have a stable and profitable business in order to be able to increase her earnings

loans.use: purchase a freezer.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: La Sra. Ángela sigue con la actividad de la venta de comida cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de insumos por mayor, creció en su actividad e incremento su clientela, y por ende sus ingresos económicos, en esta ocasión solicito el crédito para la compra de insumos también como arroz, fideo y aceite por mayor para la elaboración de sus comidas,  se siente feliz y agradecida por esta nueva oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Ángela continues with the activity of selling food.  She relates that she did well with her previous loan since she used it to buy ingredients at wholesale.  Her activity grew and so did her clientele and as a result so did her income.  On this occasion she’s asking for the loan to buy ingredients like rice, noodles and oil at wholesale too to make her dishes.  She feels happy and grateful for this new opportunity she’s being offered.

loans.use: to buy food preparation ingredients.

loans.name: Xiomara Noemi

texts.es:
Xiomara es una mujer de joven de 25 años de edad con muchos sueños, muchas esperanzas para su única hija la cual está en el kínder, para ella y su pareja siendo el, el único apoyo e involucrado en el cultivo de café del cual son propietarios. Ella tiene un grado de educación de primaria no completado el cual curso el primer grado y no pudo continuar por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres mismos que le enseñaron a trabar la tierra desde muy pequeña. En compañía de su pareja trabajan la tierra hace más de 10 años y las tierras que trabajan son propias gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres el cual esta ubicadas a 200 metros de su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan a pie para dar el mantenimiento a sus cultivos mismos que son comercializados en el mercado local y con los diferentes compradores que llegan a la zona.

Hoy en día ella solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abono, foliares para dar mantenimiento y asegurar la cosecha de café de esa forma fortalecer el grano y sanear sus cultivos en su totalidad. 
  
Su meta es hacer de sus tierras y sus cultivos los mejores de la zona para poder generar ingresos para su familia y poder cumplir su sueño y deseo el de ver a su hija convertida en una persona profesional, próspera, con mucho éxito en la vida logrando cada meta que se proponga para que sea una persona triunfadora en la vida.
texts.en:
Xiomara’s a 25-year-old woman with many dreams and hopes for her only daughter who is in Kindergarten and for her and her spouse.  He is her only support in growing a coffee crop they own.  She did not complete elementary school; she only attended first grade but was unable to go further for lack of economic support from her parents who taught her how to work the land when she was very little.  She and her spouse have worked the land for more than ten years.  The land they grow on is theirs thanks to an inheritance from their parents.  It’s located 200 meters from their house and they get to it on foot to care for their crops which are then sold in the local market and to various buyers that come to the zone.

She’s asking for help to buy fertilizer, manure and leaf fertilizer to provide crop maintenance and insure a good coffee crop; to strengthen the beans and keep her entire crop healthy. Her goal is to make her  land and her crops the best in the zone so she can generate family income and be able to reach her dream of seeing her daughter become a professional, prosperous person with much success in life reaching every goal she sets for herself to become a victorious person in life.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Fifame Group

texts.fr: FIFAME est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des cohabitantes. La représentante du groupe, nommée Pauline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Pauline âgée de 39 ans et est mariée à un certain Bernard. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Pauline vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges du ménage. Pour ce faire, Pauline vend des boules d’akassa (fait à base de farine de maïs) et du poisson de façon ambulante depuis six ans. Pauline s'approvisionne dans au port de pêche du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Pauline s’associe avec les autres membres du groupe FIFAME pour solliciter un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
FIFAME is a group of three persons whose members live together. The group's representative, Pauline, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 39 years old and married to a man named Bernard. The couple have three children, not all in school but all in their care. Pauline lives with her husband and children. 

The couple jointly ensure that the household expenses are covered. To do so, Pauline has been selling 'akassa' balls (made from cornmeal) and fish on the streets for six years. She gets her supplies from a Benin fishing port. 

With the goal of bolstering her business and satisfying the demands of her customers, Pauline joined with the other member of the group FIFAME to request a second loan from ALIDé. The previous loan was indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase condiments and fish to sell

loans.name: Saygon

texts.en:
Please meet 50-year-old Saygon from Paynesville North in Liberia. Paynesville North has the largest market in Montserrado County.  The area is home to “round time marketers”, traders who travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county. As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distribute to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia.

She completed 1st grade and is married.  describes herself as a hardworking person. Her spouse is a driver. She has five children between the ages of 15 and 28.  Two are in school and two live at home. 

Saygon has a table at the market which sells red oil, pepper, okra, etc. She has been in business for ten years and works 10 hours at her business every day. With this loan, she will buy inventory for her shop. One of the greatest challenges that she faces is the rainy season. She transports her goods by shared taxi. She started her business with money from her husband. She is proud of her business because helps to improve her children's lives. Her plan is to educate her children and one day own a store in the near future. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy inventory for her shop.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia de 45 años de edad, se dedica a al venta de mercancía (ropa, accesorios y calzado) desde hace algunos años, como fuente económica. Su familia es lo más importante para ella y el motor que la impulsa a salir adelante. La calidad de vida de sus dos hijas se ha constituido en su mayor reto, razón que la ha motivado a laborar fuertemente y brindarles una educación de calidad. 
Sueña con tener una vivienda propia y garantizarle a su familia mejores oportunidades de vida. Razones que la han impulsado a solicitar un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido con el propósito de aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
45-year-old Claudia has a business selling merchandise (clothing, accessories and footwear) which she has been running for a number of years.  It is her source of income.  Her family is the most important thing in the world to her and they motivate her to continue making progress.  Her daughters' quality of life has been her biggest challenge and this has motivated her to work hard so that she could provide them with a good education.

Claudia dreams of owning her own home and guaranteeing her family better opportunities in life.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan which she will invest in buying stock with the aim of increasing her sales.

loans.use: to buy clothing, accessories and footwear

loans.name: Musayam

texts.ru: Мусаям добродушная женщина. Ей 35 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Детям 12, 8 и 5 лет. Она имеет большой опыт в системе образования таджикского народа. Она работает в сельской школе учительницей и имеет много учеников, которые на сегодняшний день работают в различных сферах. Она гордится своими учениками. Мусаям планирует отремонтировать свой старый дом. Деньги, которые отправляет ее муж, не хватает для ремонта и ее зарплата тоже очень маленькая. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов для ремонта дома. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Musayam is a kind-spirited woman.  She is 35 years old, married and has three children.  Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia.  Her children are ages twelve, eight and five.  She has much experience in the Tajik education system.  She works at a rural school as a teacher and has had many students that now work in many different industries.  She is proud of them.  Musayam plans to make repairs to her old home.  The money that her husband sends to her is not enough for the renovation--neither is her own pay which is little.  She is asking for a loan of 2,000 somoni to buy construction materials.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing house

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience lives in Montserrado County, the capital city of Liberia, which is well known as the most commercial city in Liberia. Patience is 29 years old and single with two children, ages 6 and 2 years old. They are in school and live at home. 

For the past two years Patience has been selling rice, pepper, vita, etc. in the community market. She started this business with help from her mother and also learned this way of selling from her mother. She spends 8 hours a day with her business and she uses a taxi most of the time to get her goods to her table.

She said that she is business minded, and likes her business because it gives her some profit. She is requesting a loan to buy more rice, pepper, vita, etc. to increase her sales.  Patience wants to get more money to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more rice, pepper, vita, etc. to increase her sales.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, de 32 años de edad,es soltera y no tiene hijos, actualmente vive en la casa de su madre junto a su hermano luchando juntos por salir adelante.Nelly se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa como polos, faldas, blusas y camisas para niños y niñas así como también prendas interiores femeninas en diversos modelos, tallas y colores que son los más solicitados por sus clientes en ciertas temporadas. Toda su mercadería lo distribuye entre sus vecinas y amistades. Lleva realizando este trabajo por más de 5 años y actualmente cuenta con muchos clientes gracias al trato personalizado y cordial que muestra cuando realiza sus ventas. Ocasionalmente también vende prendas usadas en los pueblos ribereños.Lo que le gusta de esta actividad es que le genera un ingreso económico con el cual sustenta los gastos de su hogar, se siente contenta  ya que su actividad le ha traído muchas satisfacciones y le ha sacado de muchos apuros económicos, tiene muchas ganas de seguir trabajando y ampliar la cantidad de productos de ofrece.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles para comprar ropa de diversos modelos, tallas y colores.
texts.en:
Nelly, 32, is single and has no children.  She currently lives in her mother’s house with her brother; they strive together to get ahead.  Nelly works buying and selling clothes like shirts, skirts, blouses and shirts for boys and girls; she also sells women’s underwear in various styles, sizes and colors that are the most requested by her customers in certain seasons.  

She sells all her merchandise among neighbors and acquaintances.  She’s been in this business for more than five years and currently has many customers thanks to the personalized, cordial treatment she offers at the time of the sale.  She sometimes also sells used clothes in various towns along the river banks.  What she likes about this activity is that it generates income to cover household expenses.  

She feels happy because this activity has brought her much satisfaction and has gotten her out of many economic tight spots.  She very much wants to continue working and expanding the amount of products she offers.  On this occasion, she’ll ask for 1,000 soles to buy clothes in various sizes, styles and colors.

loans.use: to buy clothes at wholesale.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Sinkor in Montserrado County where living conditions are almost like the capital city of Liberia. It is well known as the best laid out place in Liberia. She is 46 years old and married with two children, ages 26 and 8, who are both in school and live at home.

For the past ten years Sarah has been selling spare ribs in the community market. She started this business with help from her husband and learned this way of selling from her mother. She spends 9 hours a day with her business, and she uses a taxi most of the time to get her goods to her table.

She said that she is business-minded and likes her business because it gives her some profit. Sarah is requesting a loan to buy more spare ribs to increase her sales. She wants to get more money to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more spare ribs to expand her sales.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Inés, de 48 años de edad, esta casada y tiene un hijo de 12 años, vive en su casa propia junto a los miembros de su familia.El trabajo de Inés, consiste principalmente en la venta de comidas. Tiene su puesto de ventas en el mercado de la ciudad y ahí ofrece diariamente los más deliciosos platillos regionales como pescados asados, chorizos, pollo y otros que caracterizan a la comida peruana. Su labor empieza desde muy temprano y culmina aproximadamente a las 3 de la tarde. Lleva realizando este negocio por 8 años con la ayuda incondicional de su esposo.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que desarrolla una labor que le fascina desde muy pequeña, siempre cocinó y le agrada ahora ponerlo en práctica como una oportunidad de negocio, además gracias a este trabajo tiene buenos ingresos económicos que le sirven para solventar los gastos de su hogar y brindarles las comodidades necesarias a su familia.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3500, está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir avanzando con su negocio.Con el monto solicitado comprará progresivamente todos los ingredientes e insumos utilizados en la preparación de sus potajes como aceites, arroz, verduras, tubérculos, condimentos carnes y otros productos.
texts.en:
Inés, 48, is married and has a 12-year-old son.  She lives in her own house with her family members.  Her work consists primarily in selling food.  She has her stand in a market in the city and she offers delicious regional dishes like grilled fish, sausages, chicken and others that are characteristic of Peruvian cuisine there every day.  Her work starts very early and ends at about 3 in the afternoon.  She’s been in business 8 years with her husband’s unconditional support.

What she likes about her work is that she works doing what has fascinated her since she was very little; she always cooked and now she puts it into practice as a business opportunity.  In addition, this work earns good income that she can use to cover household expenses and provide comfort for her family.

On this occasion, she’ll request 3,500 soles and she’s very happy for the financial support she’ll get to continue in business.  She will use the requested amount to progressively buy all the ingredients and supplies like oil, rice, vegetables, tubers, condiments, meats and others she uses to prepare her meals.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Binda

texts.en:
Please meet 24-year-old Binda from Paynesville North in Liberia. Paynesville North has the largest market in Montserrado County. The area is home to “round time marketers”, traders who travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county. As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distributes to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia. 

She completed 2nd grade and is married. She describes herself as hardworking person. Her spouse is a security guard. She has a four-month-old child. 

Binda has a shop where she sells artificial hair. She has been in business for ten years and works 8 hours each day at her business. With this loan, she will buy more inventory. One of the greatest challenges that she faces is the rainy season. She transports her goods by shared taxi. She started her business with money from hr husband. She is proud of her business because it help to improve her children's lives. Her plan is to educate her children and one day own a store in the near future. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: she will buy more inventory for her shop.

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.ru: Диловару 23 года. Он женат на трудолюбивой женщине, которая занимается вышиванием национальных платков. Диловар и его жена не имеют детей. Диловар более 3 лет предоставляет услуги съёмщика свадебных торжеств и других мероприятий, а также монтаж по заказу клиентов. Он имеет большой талант о достаточный опыт. Поэтому он выполняет свою работу высококачественно и имеет своих клиентов на рынке конкуренции. Диловар уже второй цикл кредитуется и имеет хорошую кредитную историю. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, как цемент, древесина, песок, краски и т.п.  для ремонта дома, так как его дом старый и нуждается в капитальном ремонте. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Dilovar is 23 years old and is married to a hardworking woman who works making the national women's clothing of Tajikistan.  Dilovar and his wife do not have children.  For more than three years, he has worked as a cameraman for weddings and other events.  He also makes montages to order.  He is very talented and has much experience.  Because of this, his work is of high quality and he has his own clients despite much competition.  This is Dilovar's second loan and he has a positive credit history.  He is asking for a loan of 2,500 somoni to buy construction materials such as cement, wood, sand, paint, etc., to make repairs to his home since it is old and needs major renovations.  He awaits your kindness and relies on your compassion.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, wood, soil, etc.

loans.name: Jacobo

texts.es: Jacobo, tiene 36 años de edad, es casado, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en el municipio de Nuevo Celilac, Santa Bárbara. El lleva 9 años de dedicarse a cultivar sus propias parcelas de café y granos básicos en cantidades pequeñas para consumo y venta. La producción de café la vende en pergamino en el mercado local del municipio. Ha solicitado varios préstamos para sus cultivos, lo que le ha permitido aumentar poco a poco. La venta de su producción es la fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. El préstamo que solicita actualmente es el sexto ciclo y lo va invertir en la compra d e fertilizantes para mejorar el cultivo de café y lograr sacar buena cosecha. Su objetivo es seguir ampliando las parcelas poco a poco y poder darle a su familia lo necesario como alimentación, salud, educación y vivienda.
texts.en:
Jacobo, 36, is married and lives with his wife and three children in the city of Nuevo Celilac, Santa Bárbara. For nine years, he has been growing coffee and basic grains in small quantities on his own land for consumption and sale. He sells his coffee crop in parchment bags at the local market. He has previously applied for several crop loans, which have allowed his business to slowly grow. Crop sales are his source of income to support his family. 

This will be his sixth loan cycle, and he will use the money to buy fertilizer to improve his coffee plantings and produce a good harvest. His goal is to slowly add more land and to give his family what it needs in terms of food, health care, education, and housing.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Wrejay

texts.en:
Wrejay lives in Montserrado County, the capital city of Liberia. It is well known as the most commercial city in Liberia. Wrejay is 48 years old and married. Her husband is not working now. They have two children, ages 28 and 9. Only one is in school and lives at home.

For the past seven years Wrejay has been selling ed-doe (a small root vegetable related to taro), palm nuts, potatoes, etc. in the community market. She started this business with help from her husband when he was working, and learned this way of selling from her mother. She spends 10 hours a day with her business, and she uses a taxi most of the time to get her goods to her table.

Wrejay said that she is business minded, and likes her business because it gives her some profit. She is requesting a loan to buy more ed-doe, palm nuts, potatoes, etc. to increase her sales. She wants to get more money to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more ed-doe, palm nuts, potatoes, etc. to increase her sales.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Watchoee is 46 years old and lives Paynesville North Area, Liberia. Paynesville North has the largest market in Montserrado County. The area is home to “round time marketers”, traders that travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county. As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distribute to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia. She is single and has three children between the ages of 16 and 20 years old. Only two of them live at home and attend school. She was too unfortunate to attend school. She has been selling soft drinks in the local market for the past six years, a business she started with money given to her by her brother. She learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks for her business. Her future plan is to educate all of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Adrian Pascual

texts.es:
Adrian tiene 35 años de edad, es padre de una pequeña de 11 años a quien quiere muchísimo y por el cual lucha cada día para poder darle una vida digna. Por ello cada día Adrian trabaja con mucho en su pequeño negocio de elaboración de puertas de fierro, mantenimiento y venta de repuestos ya que con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar, Adrian tiene su pequeño negocio desde hace 3 años y lo logro gracias al apoyo de su padre, quien le enseño todo lo que sabe.

Adrian está muy agradecido con el apoyo brindado por los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado el podrá comprar una compresora con cual podrá  realizar mejor su trabajo y ya no tendrá que alquilarla, así podrá mejorar sus ingresos y atender mejor a sus clientes, con lo cual podrá seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una carrera profesional a su hija, tener un taller más grande y poder formalizarlo”.
texts.en:
Adrián, 35, is the father of an 11-year-old daughter he loves very much and for whom he strives daily to be able to give her a proper life.  Because of this, Adrián works very hard in his small metal shop making metal gates and maintaining and selling spare parts because with the fruits of his labor he’s able to cover household expenses.  Adrián has had his small business for three years; he managed this thanks to his father who taught him everything he knows.

Adrián is very grateful for the support Kiva lenders have given him because thanks to it he will be able to buy a compressor that will help him do his work better since he won’t have to lease one any longer; his income will increase and he will be able to give better customer service so he can continue to strive to make his greatest dream reality: to give his daughter a professional career and to have a larger workshop and to be able to formalize it.

loans.use: to buy a compressor.

loans.name: Tenneh

texts.en:
This is Tenneh from Liberia.  She lives in Paynesville North, which is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia.  Paynesville North has the largest market in Montserrado County.  The area is home to “round time marketers”, traders that travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county.  As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distribute to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia.

She is 35, single with three children.  Her children's ages ares 9 months and 12.  They all are currently living at home and only two are in school.  
For the past seven years, Tebbeh has owned her own table  business selling fashion slippers.  She will use the loan proceeds to purchase fashion slippers for her business.  

On average, she works ten hours at her business.  She started her business with money given to her by her mother. She transports her merchandise by shared taxi.  She cites the rainy season as her biggest challenge.  Her favorite part of her business is the profit she makes every time.  In the future, she would like to buy a car and build a house.  

She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase fashion slippers for her business.

loans.name: Las Tres Rosas Group

texts.en:
The Trust Bank, “Tres Rosas” (Three Roses) consists of eight responsible and hard-working women. They live in the same community and have known each other for a long time. Because they have the common goal of seeking a better future for themselves, their families and their community, the women are focused and very connected with each other.

As is the case with all Friendship Bridge Trust Banks, the group has a Board of Directors. Silvia is the President of the group. She is 46 years-old and has eight children. Three years ago, Sylvia started a small business which is a convenience store. It was located in the small room of her home. Soon, she realized that she had to increase her store inventory and it was at that point that she requested a small loan from Friendship Bridge. She happily informed us that the business is doing quite well!

Silvia has requested a new loan (which would be her third loan cycle) of $410 in order to purchase a refrigerator. Her clients have requested cold products such as dairy products (yogurt, cheese, cream) and she plans on making ice cream! She will also sell meat. Sylvia has had no difficulty in making her payments on previous loans. She has a well-thought out business plan and has learned a great deal about business administration as it is one of the educational themes covered in the monthly meetings of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank. A few of the other themes include self-esteem, health, diet and women’s issues.

Sylvia and her fellow Trust Bank members appreciate having access to small loans and education. They gain confidence in themselves, realize that they have a voice, and weave new relationships. They express their gratitude to Kiva investors for believing in their ability to move forward with confidence and education.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Reina Isaura

texts.es: Reina de 39 años de edad, vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos. Doña Reina vive en condiciones muy humildes y durante mucho tiempo a trabajado duro para poder ayudar a sus hijos, Tiene un  puesto de tortillas en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, tiene muchos clientes que la buscan debido a que sus tortillas siempre están a la hora. doña reina solicita un credito para poder invertir en la compra de maiz por mayor y darle mantenimiento a su plancha para que siempre este en buenas condiciones y se pueda ofrecer un mejor servicio a los clientes y lograr obtener mayores ingresos con los cuales pueda seguir ayudando a sus hijos para que sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Reina is 39 years old and lives in her own home with her four children.  She lives in very humble conditions and has worked hard for a long time in order to help her children.  For several years she has had a tortilla stall at her home and has gained many customers because her tortillas are always ready on time.  

Reina is asking for a loan in order to buy corn at wholesale and to do maintenance on her grill so that it’s always in good condition.  That way, she will be able to offer better service to her customers and to improve her income so that she can continue helping her children so that they continue to go to school.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale and to do maintenance on the grill she uses to make tortillas.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 26 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which has the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is living together with her fiancee and ten-year-old child who attends school. Hawa stopped school in the 7th grade, but she is very good at managing her business to help herself and her family.

For the past five years Hawa has been selling rice by the cup, pepper, oil, plantain, etc. in the local market. She started this business with a small amount of money given to her by her fiancee. She sells from Monday to Saturday, 7AM to 6PM. She learned this trade from her friends. 

Hawa is requesting a loan to purchase inventory for her business. She plans to build up her children's future by educating them, and also wants to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase inventories for her business.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu is 49 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which has the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is single with three children between 8 and 20 years old. Only one lives at home and attends school. Fatu was unfortunate and did not attend school.

She has been selling fresh fish in the local market for the past nine years now. She started this business when she noticed her children's father was not serious. So, in order to help herself and her children she learned this trade from friends. She sells from Monday to Saturday, 7AM to 6PM, and uses a shared taxi to get her goods to her table. 

Fatu is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh fish for her business. Her future plan is to educate all her children. She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish for her business.

loans.name: Tumendalai

texts.en:
Mr. Tumendalai, 47 years-old, lives with his family in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. The family resides in an apartment. 

From 1983 to 1990, he worked as a serviceman at a private business entity. In 1990, he began rendering passenger transportation service to local people, usually traveling between Ulaanbaatar and Darkhan. His wife has been working as a laboratory technician since 1988 and is considered by her superiors as the best staff. 

The apartment they live in has been deteriorating over they years without any renovation and in 2010, he purchased it and made shallow repairs. Now he is requesting a loan of 3000000 MNT in order to purchase vacuum insulated windows, hardwood floors and fiberglass. As a result, the family will live in comfortable and warm place. More importantly, they will preserve lot of energy previously used for heating. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase vacuum insulated windows, hardwood floors and fiberglass.

loans.name: Lolina

texts.en:
A $600.00 loan is offered to Lolina to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as biscuits, noodles, sugar and coffee. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2010. She feels comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Lolina independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee and other goods.

loans.name: Esther Norella

texts.es:
Esther de 37 años de dad, es madre cabeza de familia y desde hace dos años inició con la venta de mercancía (ropa, calzado, productos para el cuidado corporal) a familiares, amigos y vecinos, como medio de sostenimiento para su familia. Aprendió la actividad de manera empírica y asegura que ha sido una de sus mayores bendiciones porque gracias ésta ha logrado mejorar su calidad de vida. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mercancía.
Sueña con sacar a sus dos hijos adelante y brindarles una educación de calidad para que gocen de mejores oportunidades en el mundo laboral.
texts.en: Esther, 37, is a mother and head of household.  She started selling merchandise (clothes, shoes and personal care products) two years ago to family members, friends and neighbors as a way of supporting her family.  She learned this type of work on her own and she insists that it’s become one of her greatest blessings because thanks to it she’s managed to improve her quality of life.  She’s currently asking for a loan to buy merchandise.  She dreams with moving her two children forward and to give them a quality education so that they can enjoy better employment opportunities.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and personal care products.

loans.name: Buenas Mujeres De Jucha Group

texts.en:
The Trust Bank, “Las Buenas Mujeres de Jucha” (The Good Women of Jucha) is composed of nine responsible and enthusiastic women whose average age is 36 years. As they want to increase their businesses, they have requested an additional loan from Friendship Bridge. Their goal is to provide a better future for their families and their community.

Carmen is the 50 year-old Treasurer of the Trust Bank and has a large family of six children. She feels quite proud to be a member of the group. Carmen mentions that she especially likes being on the Board of Directors as she is able to develop her leadership skills.

Three years ago, Carmen began to work in the tailoring and garment industry. She learned a lot about the business from her son and daughter-in-law and began to make tee shirts, shirts and pants. Carmen is excelling in her business and will use her new Friendship Bridge loan to meet the requests of future clients. She will purchase an additional sewing machine. Two additional people have been hired! Carmen tells us that she anticipates a lot of work in the next few months and so the loan will come at a good time!

Carmen, along with her fellow Trust Bank members, appreciates the confidence that Kiva investors have placed in their ability to progress forward in their lives with loans and education. The women are grateful and amazed that people around the world hear of their need and share monetary support

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Luis Antoni

texts.es:
Luis es un joven de 26 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Imperial y es un joven de carácter amigable y muy alegre. Luis es un joven muy trabajador, con mucho esfuerzo a logrado estudiar la carrera de Economía y actualmente trabaja como empleado en una institución de su ciudad. Con el fruto de su trabajo apoya a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, ya que su familia es de condición humilde; el cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable y honrado.

Luis está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar la reparación de la cocina de su vivienda, ya que actualmente el techo es de calamina y con ello podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, así el seguirá trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño: ”Poder sacar su título profesión.
texts.en:
Luis is a young 26-year-old living in the city of Imperial; he’s a friendly, very cheerful young man.  Luis is a hardworking young man who with much effort has succeeded in studying the career of Economics and currently works as an employee in a city institution.  With the fruits of his labor he helps out his parents with household expenses since his family is of limited means.  He believes he’s getting ahead because he’s very responsible and honest.

Luis is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve given him he will be able to repair his kitchen at home since the roof is currently plywood.  Doing this will improve his family’s quality of life and he will continue working to make his greatest dream reality: to become a graduate in his profession.

loans.use: to repair the kitchen.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
This is Rebecca from Liberia. She lives in Paynesville North, which is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia. Paynesville North has the largest market in Montserrado County. The area is home to “round time marketeers”, traders who travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county.  As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distribute to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia.

Rebecca is 30 years old and single with two children. Her children's ages are 7 and 13. Both are currently living at home and are in school. Rebecca owns her own table business, selling fresh fish for the past seven years. She will use the loan proceeds to purchase fresh fish.  

On average, she works 12 hours a day at her business. She started her business with money given to her by her mother. She transports her merchandise by shared taxi. She cites the rainy season as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is the profit she makes every time. In the future, Rebecca would like to buy a piece of land and build a house. 
 
She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish.

loans.name: Les Fidele De Dilaires 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.fr:
Paulimus est le coordinateur de son groupe Fideles de Dilaire. Il n est pas marie. Il a 3 enfants. Paulimus habite dans la région nord`est Haïti ou  l’électricité est rare et de l’eau portable est très limite.

Paulimus dirige son commerce de vente de produits cosmetique  pendants les 6 derniers années. Il espère que ce emprunt l’aidera a grandir son commerce

Des autres membres de Fideles de Dilaire ont besoin d’un emprunt pour les commerces ventes produits cosmétiques, charbon, chaussures, etc. Il dit que son défi principal est de devenir un plus grand commerçant

Son but principal c’est d’avoir un plus grand commerce qui lui facilitera  à construire une plus grande maison avec prêt de Esperanza Int.
texts.en:
Paulimus is the coordinator of his group Fideles de Dilaire. He is not married and has three children. He lives in northeastern Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. 

Paulimus has been running his own business selling cosmetic products for the last six years. He hopes that this loan will help him to expand his business.

Other members of Fideles de Dilaire have need of a loan for such business as selling cosmetics, charcoal, shoes, etc.  He says that his main challenge is to become a bigger merchant. 

His main goal is to have a bigger business that will facilitate construction on a bigger house with  loans from Esperanza Int.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics products to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy, de 37 años de edad , esta casada y es madre de 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia.El trabajo de Nancy consiste en la venta de lencería como calzones, pantaletas y otras prendas interiores que ella misma confecciona o que en ocasiones compra en tiendas mayoristas para que posteriormente los ofrezca a sus clientes. Esta labor lo complementa de manera paralela con la venta de cosméticos y productos de aseo personal mediante el sistema de pedidos por catálogo. Tiene un pequeño espacio de trabajo y exhibición en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes en busca de perfumes, talcos, cremas o algún accesorio de utilidad. Lleva en esta actividad cerca de 1 año, trabaja sola y por fortuna gana muy bien. Por lo pronto, continúa trabajando y le gusta lo que hace ya que mantiene estable sus ingresos económicos con los clientes que ya ha logrado consolidar, está muy contenta por la independencia que tiene y porque puede generar ella misma el dinero que requiere para solventar los gastos en su hogar.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 800 soles y está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio.Con el monto solicitado comprará prendas de lencería, perfumes, talcos, cremas de piel y algunos accesorios femeninos.
texts.en: Nancy is 37 years old, married, and has 3 children, all of whom live with her in her house, which she owns. Nancy sells undergarments, such as boxers and knickers, which she either makes herself or sometimes buys from wholesalers to sell to her customers. She also sells cosmetics and personal hygiene products through a catalogue. At her house, there is a small space dedicated to her business, where she shows her customers the products she has for sale, such as perfume, talcum powder, moisturiser, or accessories. Nancy has been in business for nearly a year now, works alone and earns a decent living at it. She plans to keep in this line of business, since she likes it, not in the least because she has a solid customer base already, which enables her to have a somewhat steady income. She is very happy with the independence the business affords her, and very proud to be able to take care of household expenses. She asks for a loan of 800 soles and is happy to know that she benefits from this help, all the more so because she is sure that her business will grow. Nancy will use the loan to buy undergarments, perfume, talcum powder, moisturiser, and some feminine accessories.

loans.use: to buy undergarments and hygiene products to sell.

loans.name: Flor Marina

texts.es:
Flor María, desde hace 6 meses tiene un almacén, en donde se dedica a la comercialización de ropa, accesorios y calzado.  Laboró por muchos años como empleada en una tienda de ropa hasta que tomó la determinación de independizarse e invertir sus ahorros en la creación de su negocio. Hoy se siente satisfecha por su determinación y asegura que ha sido un gran logro para ella. Con el fin de crecer dentro del mercado local, Flor se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mercancía para tener mayor variedad de productos e incrementar sus ingresos. 
Su mayor sueño es tener una vida tranquila sin preocupaciones económicas y disfrutando del amor de su familia.
texts.en:
Flor María has had a store for the last six months where she sells clothes, accessories and shoes.  She worked for many years as an employee in a clothing store until she made the decision to become independent and invest her savings in creating her own business.  Today, she feels satisfied by her determination and stresses that it’s been a great accomplishment for her.  

Aiming at growing in the local marketplace, Flor is asking for a loan to buy merchandise in order to have a wider variety of goods available to increase her income.  Her greatest dream is to live in peace free of economic concerns enjoying the love of her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and accessories.

loans.name: Gisela Natalia

texts.es: Gisela de 29 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora. Ganarse la vida es un gran reto para ella, asegura que trabajar es una de sus grandes pasiones. Razón por la cual se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado por catálogo desde hace 6 años. Gracias al desarrollo de su actividad hoy su vida ha cambiado y cuenta con una mejor calidad de vida. Con el fin de seguir creciendo dentro del sector comercial, Gisela se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de  mercancía. Espera que dicha inversión aumente su rentabilidad y pueda comenzar a ahorrar para cumplir su gran sueño de tener una vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Gisela, 29, is an enterprising woman.  To earn a livelihood is a great challenge for her.  She points out that to work is one of her great passions which is why she has been selling clothes and shoes via catalog for six years.  Thanks to her work’s development her life has changed today and she has better quality of life.  

Aiming at continuing to grow in the commercial sector, Gisela’s asking for a loan to buy merchandise.  She hopes that said investment will increase her profitability so she can start to save up to reach her great dream of owning a house.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes at wholesale.

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en:
Long-time business owner, Herbert has owned and operated Boyce Suprette Grocery Store in Boyce, Louisiana for more than 25 years.  His retail grocery store offers the community fresh and high-quality items at a low everyday price.  At his grocery, you can find just about anything, whether you are in the mood for a quick snack or preparing a meal for your family.  

Herbert came across Accion Texas Inc. while at the Small Business Development Center in Louisiana.  He was referred to Accion and approved to receive a loan, which allowed him to continue to pay his four full-time and two part-time employees, maintain a cash reserve for emergencies, purchase food for stock, and pay for the delivery services of the items.  

Herbert thanks his church for spreading the good word about his business and his friends from the community for promoting his store daily by word of mouth.  Herbert creates flyers to post around the community to help with advertising, too.  These many tactics, along with his Accion loan, have given the store a boost. 

In the future, Herbert plans to hire one additional full and part-time employee to assist with the business and continue to be the best local grocer in his community.  “Having money available for emergencies and staff without sacrificing is a big help,” said Herbert.

loans.use: to continue to pay his four full-time and two part-time employees, maintain a cash reserve for emergencies, etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Please meet 45-year-old Victoria from Paynesville North in Liberia. Paynesville North has the largest market in Montserrado County. The area is home to “round time marketeers”, traders who travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county.  As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distribute to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia. 

Victoria completed 8th grade and is single. She describes herself as a hardworking person. She has four children between the ages of 30 and 16. Two are in school and live at home. 

Victoria has a table where she sells plantain and oil. She has been in business for ten years and works 9 hrs. a day. With this loan, she will buy plantain and oil for her business. One of the greatest challenges that she faces is her small income. She transports her goods by shared taxi. She started her business with a loan from her mother. She is proud of her business because it pays her home expenses. Her plan is to build a house. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy plantain and oil for her business.

loans.name: Henry De Jesús

texts.es:
Henry de 44 años de edad, laboró por más de ocho años en una carpintería, donde desarrollo su potencial y perfeccionó el oficio como ebanista. Conocimiento que lo motivó a crear su propio negocio y a constituirse como independiente. Asegura que crear su propia empresa ha sido una de sus mayores bendiciones ya que la calidad de vida de su grupo familiar ha mejorado considerablemente. Labora diariamente de siete de la mañana a seis de la tarde. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de materia prima (madera) con el fin de adelantar los pedidos y generar ingresos. 
Sueña con ampliar su taller, por lo cual se encuentra realizando adecuaciones  en su vivienda.
texts.en: Henry, 44, worked for more than 8 years in a carpentry shop where he developed his potential and honed his skills as a cabinetmaker.  This knowledge led him to open his own business and work for himself.  He stresses that creating his own firm has been one of the greatest blessings because his family’s quality of life has improved considerably.  He works every day from seven in the morning to six in the evening.  He’s currently asking for a loan to buy raw materials (lumber) in order to fill orders and generate income.   He dreams with enlarging his workshop and is doing some remodeling of his house to do so.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Janneth Amparo

texts.es:
Janneth a sus 40 años de edad es madre de dos hijos. Se dedica al oficio de la  confección, como actividad económica para el sostenimiento de su familia. Se enfoca en la confección de pijamas y blusas para dama, en un pequeño taller ubicado en su residencia, lo que le permite dedicarle tiempo a las labores del hogar y a compartir con sus hijos.  
Se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos (telas, hilos, agujas) con el propósito de aumentar las ventas y mejorar la calidad de vida de su hogar. Sueña con tener un taller más grande y convertirse en una fuente de empleo para su comunidad.
texts.en:
Janneth, 40, is the mother of two children.  Her economic activity to support her family is making clothes.  She focuses on pajamas and blouses for women in her small shop located at home which allows her to have time to do her household chores and to spend with her children.

She’s asking for a loan to buy supplies (fabric, thread, needles) to increase sales and improve her home’s quality of life.  She dreams with having a larger workshop and becoming a source of employment for her community.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Echo Des Anges De Ouanaminthe Group

texts.fr:
Denise est la coordinatrice de son groupe Echo des Anges. Elle est  mariée elle a 2 enfants. Elle habite dans la région nord`est Haïti ou  l’électricité est rare et de l’eau portable est très limite. 

Denise dirige son commerce de vente de produits alimentaire  pendants les 5 dernières années. Avant de ce commerce elle était la  vendeuse de toute sorte. Elle espère que ce emprunt l’aidera a grandir son commerce

Des autres membres de groupe ont besoin d'un emprunt pour les commerces tel que ventes produits cosmétiques, boissons gazeuses etc. Elle dit que son défi principal est de devenir une plus grande commerçante dans la zone.  Son but principal c’est d’avoir un plus grand commerce qui lui facilitera  à construire une plus grande maison avec prêt de Esperanza Int.
texts.en:
Denise is the coordinator of her group Echo des Anges. She is married and has two children. She lives in northeastern Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. 

Denise has been running her business selling grocery items for the last five years. Before this business, she used to sell all sorts of things. She hopes that this loan will help her to expand her business.

Other members of the group have need of a loan for such businesses as selling cosmetics, carbonated beverages, etc. She says that her main challenge is to become a bigger merchant in the area. Her main goal is to have a bigger business, which will facilitate the construction of a bigger house with loans from Esperanza Int.

loans.use: to purchase food items to sell

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo a sus 59 años de edad es padre de tres hijos. Desde hace 12 años se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles como dulces y snacks de manera informal, recorriendo las calles de su localidad. En lagunas ocasiones estaciona su carrito cerca al parque principal, debido al flujo de personas. 
Con el fin de comprar surtido para su negocio, aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su grupo familiar, Guillermo s encuentra solicitando un crédito ya que carece de recursos propios para realizar dicha inversión.  
Su mayor deseo, es brindarle a su hijo menor la oportunidad de ingresar a la universidad y convertirse en un gran profesional.
texts.en:
Guillermo, 59, is the father of three children.  He’s been selling foodstuffs like candy and snacks informally in the local streets for the last 12 years.  Sometimes he parks his cart near the main park because of the abundance of passersby.

Aiming at buying stock for his business and to increase income and improve his family’s quality of life, Guillermo’s asking for a loan because he lacks resources of his own to make said investment.  His greatest wish is to provide for his youngest son’s enrolment in university so he can become a great professional.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of candy and packaged snacks.

loans.name: Assimahedou

texts.fr: Assimahedou est une femme âgé(e) de 39 ans. Elle est mariée à un militaire. Elle est mère de famille tous scolarisés. Assimahedou travaille comme revendeuse de céréales plus précisément le mais depuis 2009. Elle vend seule et s’approvisionne dans les villes de l’intérieur. Assimahedou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales. Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait diversifier les produits et assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en: Assimahedou is a 39-year-old woman and married to a soldier. She is a mother with children, who are provided with schooling. Since 2009, she has been working as a retailer of grains, that is, corn to be exact. She makes her sales alone and gets her supplies from inland cities. Assimahedou has requested her first WAGES loan to purchase some grain. In the next few years, she would like to diversify her products and ensure her family's vital needs are met.

loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Diana Maryori

texts.es:
Diana de 39 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora y con grandes deseos de superarse. Trabaja en un taller de confección como operaria, alternando la actividad con la venta de mercancía (ropa, accesorios y calzado) con el fin de mejorar su condición económica y colaborarle a su madre con los gastos del hogar. 
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mercancía con el fin de reforzar el inventario y cumplir con los pedidos solicitados. Sueña con tener una gran tienda de ropa y dedicarse de tiempo completo a la actividad.
texts.en: Diana is 39 years old. She never gives up in the face of difficulties and always aims to improve her situation. She works as a dressmaker in a workshop, and also has a business selling clothes, beauty products, and shoes, her goal being to improve her financial situation and to help her mother with household expenses. Diana asks for a loan that she will use to buy merchandise in order to have more in stock and be able to fulfil her customers' orders. Her dream is to have a big clothes store and to tend to it full-time.

loans.use: to buy clothes, beauty products, and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal AMISTAD CUSQUEÑA,el banco esta ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio continua con brindado el servicio de taxi,el socio lleva años con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,el socio a la vez continua dedicandose a la crianza de animales como ganados y conejos ,el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

El socio solicita el credito para la compra de repuestos para su carro.

El socio se siente agradecido por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
He belongs to the “Amistad Cusqueña” (Cuscan Friendship) communal bank located in Cusco District, Cusco Province in Cusco Department.  He continues providing taxi services; he’s been in business for years and he does well thanks to the daily effort he puts into his business.  At the same time, he continues raising animals like cattle and rabbits.  He wants to continue working this way to continue supporting his family.

He requests the loan to buy spare parts for his car.  He feels grateful for the granted loan and commits to make his payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy oil for his vehicle.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca, de 23 años de edad , está casada y tiene un pequeño hijo de 1 año, tiene un terreno propio en donde ha construido su casa, sin embargo, por el momento vive en un cuarto alquilado cerca a su centro de labores.El negocio de Rebeca consiste principalmente en brindar servicio de atención a pacientes con alguna dolencia o que requieren de atención médica inmediata o rutinaria. Es una mujer profesional que está haciendo de su carrera técnica de enfermería una forma de vida ya que considera que la vida y la salud de las personas son los aspectos más importantes del ser humano. Trabaja en local alquilado en compañía de otra enfermera quien le ha enseñado todo lo necesario para cumplir bien con su trabajo y gracias a ello puede atender a cualquier persona que necesite ayuda brindándole los cuidados requeridos o la orientación necesaria para que sean atendidos por un médico especialista. Lleva en este negocio más de 1 año.Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que le permite tener tiempo para dedicarse a su familia en el momento que sea necesario. Espera seguir trabajando como lo ha hecho hasta ahora y poco a poco implementar su local de atención con la adquisición de más equipos.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 800, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su negocio , por otro lado se compromete a cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas.Con el monto solicitado comprará artículos de salud como guantes quirúrgicos, alcohol, algodón, jeringas y algunas pastillas para malestares leves.
texts.en:
Rebeca, 23, is married and the mother of a one-year-old son. She owns land on which she is building a house; however, at the moment, she is renting a room close to where she works. Rebeca's business is mainly offering care to patients with some pain or who require immediate or routine care. She is a professional and is studying nursing, as she thinks that people's lives and health are the most important aspects of being human. 

She works from a rented space with another nurse, who has taught her what she needs to do her job well. Thanks to her, Rebeca is able to attend to any person who needs help by providing the required treatment or by referring them to a medical specialist. Rebeca has been working in this capacity for more than a year. She is pleased that her work allows her time for her family when necessary. She expects to keep working as she has until now and slowly buy more equipment for her care center. 

She has applied for a loan of  S/. 800 and is very happy to know that funding might be available to make her more confident in growing her business. She promises to make her payments on time. She will use the funding to buy health care items such as alcohol, cotton, syringes, and medicine for minor aches and pains.

loans.use: to buy health care items such as alcohol, cotton, syringes, and medicine for minor aches and pains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to manufacture one of her designs and use those profits to grow the company.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael was a drug addict for nearly half a century.  He lost his family, home, car and job and was left wandering the streets of San Antonio, homeless, with only a backpack of clothes to his name.  

Before changing his life around, his daily routine consisted of doing drugs, going to work without drugs, and then returning home to do more drugs.  

Now 59, Michael is at last sober.  And he owns a business.  And he’s even creating jobs for others.

“It’s God’s will. I’m lucky to be alive,” he proclaims.

He started his business, MKH Construction, in June 2012.  Within two months he had contracted 10 projects simply by word of mouth.  And the business has continued to grow.  He repairs homes to make them presentable for leasing. As Michael tells it, some tenants are not gentle on their properties, so landlords contract with him to fix, repair, or replace balconies, air and light fixtures and flooring.

Michael normally works on homes in Cibolo, Schertz and Converse, Texas. His business employs four to five residents of Haven for Hope, a transitional living campus for the homeless in San Antonio – where he also spent time getting his life back together.

Michael has been in the construction industry since he was 17 when he took his first roofing job in California. From there, he worked for a general contractor, who only hired workers who knew how to do everything to fix a house.  While living at Haven for Hope, Michael contemplated working for the national do-it-yourself chain Home Depot--until he attended a day class on construction. “I was bored and had nothing to do, so I volunteered to work with the instructor, and he saw I knew a little more than him,” Michael said.

That instructor introduced Michael to Accion Texas, Inc., allowing him to become the first Haven for Hope resident to receive a loan.  Michael returned to Accion nine months later to purchase equipment. “I’m running an honest job. What’s different about me is that I buy all materials and I don’t collect until the project is complete,” he says proudly.  “The loan enabled me to buy tools that will help me do an even better job for my clients.”

loans.use: to purchase tools

loans.name: Tuvshinmandakh

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuvshinmandakh, 35 years old, lives with her family in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional 'ger' (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. She has been working as a miner at a mining company for two years. He husband has the position of marketing manager at a restaurant.

 Even though they have a house on their land, they live in a Mongolian traditional ger since the house has vulnerable windows, walls and roofs. But recently they decided to move into their house because as winter comes, the ger couldn't afford comfortable and warm accommodation due to its long-time usage. So Mrs. Tuvshinmandakh is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, planks, vacuum-insulated windows, hardwood floors, shingles, fiberglass, cotton and gypsum.

 Using those materials, she and her husband will repair and insulate their house. As a result, they can live in a comfortable and warm place no fear of harsh wintertime. More importantly, the renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, emit less smoke, and contribute to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin Tobar de 36 años de edad, es chef de profesión. Debido a dificultades socioeconómicas salio de su ciudad natal para ir en búsqueda de mejores oportunidades de vida. Desde hace nueve meses abrió al público un pequeño restaurante, el cual ha tenido un crecimiento rápido gracias a su sazón y calidad en el servicio. 
Con el fin de seguir creciendo y posicionarse en el mercado, Edwin se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una máquina tajadora de tocineta. 
Sueña con tener un gran restaurante y seguirse capacitando para estar a la vanguardia.
texts.en: Edwin Tobar is 36 years old and a chef. Due to financial difficulties, he left his hometown in search of better opportunities. Nine months ago, he opened a small restaurant, which took off quite well thanks to the tasty dishes served and the amiability of the chef. In order to keep his restaurant growing and have it better positioned on the market, Edwin asks for a loan to buy a bacon-slicing machine. He dreams of making his restaurant a success and of keeping ahead of the curve by constantly improving his skills.

loans.use: to buy a bacon-slicing machine.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco vive en la ciudad de Pisco, es un joven de carácter amigable y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, debido a sus pocos recursos económicos solo pudo estudiar una carrera técnica, la cual es Conducción de maquinaria pesada pero debidoa la necesidad de apoyar a su familia logro conseguir empleo como vigilante en una pequeña empresa de su ciudad y con el fruto de su trabajo apoya a su madre con los gastos del hogar, Marco trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y cree que  esta saliendo adelante porque es responsable.

Marco está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar un moto con lo cual podrá movilizarse para poder realizar su labores de vigilancia y poder ahorrar dinero en transporte, de esta manera tendrá un vehículo con el cual realizar mejor su trabajo y podrá seguir luchando  para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Tener su propia empresa”.
texts.en:
Marco lives in the city of Pisco.  He’s a friendly young man who very much wants to get ahead.  Because of his limited economic resources he was only able to study a technical career which is heavy machinery driving.  However, because he needed to support his family he got a job working as a security guard in a small firm in his city and with the fruits of his labor he’s able to help his mother with household expenses.  Marco works about 10 hours daily and believes he’s doing well because he’s responsible.

Marco’s very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve give him he ‘ll be able to buy a motorcycle so he can get from place to place and carry out his watchman chores while saving money on transportation costs.  In this way, he’ll have a vehicle with which to do his work better and he’ll continue to be able to strive toward making his greatest dream reality: to have his own firm.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy kitchen equipment.

loans.name: Kpemahuton Group

texts.fr: Le groupe KPEMAHUTON est composé de trois personnes qui sont des cohabitantes. La représentante du groupe, nommée Epiphanie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Epiphanie est âgée de 33 ans. Epiphanie n’a pas fréquenté l’école mais a appris la coiffure. Epiphanie est mariée à un certain Marius. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Epiphanie vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges familiales. Pour ce faire, en plus de son activité, Epiphanie vend des mèches dans son atelier depuis neuf ans. Epiphanie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Epiphanie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe KPEMAHUTON, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group KPEMAHUTON consists of three members who all live together. The group is represented by Epiphanie, age 33, who has her hand raised in the photo. Epiphanie never attended school, but she learned hairstyling. She is married to a man named Marius, and the couple have three dependent children who all go to school. 

Epiphanie lives with her husband and their children, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. To that end, Epiphanie has been selling hair extensions from her salon for the past nine years. She buys her stock at a market in Benin. 

To achieve customer satisfaction, and to increase her sales and revenue, Epiphanie is seeking a first loan from ALIDé together with the other members of KPEMAHUTON.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions.

loans.name: Kerly

texts.es: Kerly, de 22 años de edad, está casada y vive en compañía de su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 1 año de edad en la casa de sus suegros.Kerly se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, entre los que se encuentran; arroz, azúcar, leche, panes, huevos, aceite, verduras, bebidas, golosinas y mas. Este negocio lo tiene en su domicilio actual en donde atiende todos los días y a tiempo completo. Lleva trabajando cerca de 1 año en este rubro. Al inicio tuvo la ayuda de su madre pero ahora el negocio es solo de ella y recibe la ayuda de su esposo. Complementa este negocio con la venta de prendas de vestir.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para cumplir otras actividades eventuales, afortunadamente le va muy bien ya que siempre tiene clientes debido a la variedad de productos que ofrece y porque además en la única bodega en su barrio, espera poder seguir surgiendo y hacer crecer su negocio.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 soles y está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que recibe ya que le permite seguir creciendo con su negocio .Con el monto solicitado comprará mercadería conformada por arroz, azúcar, panes, huevos, leche y aceites.
texts.en: Kerly is 22, married, and lives with her husband and their one-year-old in her in-laws' house. She sells groceries such as rice, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, cooking oil, vegetables, drinks, sweets, and others. The store is located where she lives and she tends to it every day full-time. She has been working in this business for one year. At the beginning, she had help from her mother, but now the business is her own and it is her husband who helps her with it. She also sells clothes on the side. What she likes about her work is that it still leaves her with some spare time to have another business. Fortunately, her business is going very well, and she never lacks customers, thanks to the wide variety of products on offer and to being the only store selling alcohol in her neighbourhood. Kerly hopes to continue growing and to improve her business. She asks for a loan of 1,500 soles and is very happy for the opportunity, since it will help her reach her goals. She will use the money to buy rice, sugar, bread, eggs, milk, and cooking oil.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana is 53 years old and she is now applying for a loan of $1.200 to improve her business.  She opened her kiosk in 2006 with her own working capital of $350.  She earns a good income from her business.

She will use her loan to buy some stock to keep in her store such as body lotion, soft drinks, beer, noodles and rice. She is a very hard-working woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past seven years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy body lotion, soft drinks, beer, noodles and rice

loans.name: Pichsamporhs

texts.en:
Pichsamporhs (pictured here), age 24, is single and lives with her parents and brother in Phnom Penh. Her father drives a remoque taxi, her mother is a chef, and her brother is also a student.
  
Pichsamporhs is now in her first semester and second year at the Accountant University in Phnom Penh.
 
She will go to her second semester; hence, she requested a loan in the amount of $250 to pay for her second semester and second year of her university.

loans.use: To pay for school fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase crates of soft drinks.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a retired mother of 6. She runs her own business, which sells Coca-Cola products. She is 57 years old. She is requesting a Kiva loan so that she can grow her business by buying more stocks for her shop.

Rosemary has been running her business for one year. Before she started the business, she worked at a college as a matron and guidance counselor for 27 years. Today, Rosemary spends her days at her red and white cooler where she sells drinks. When asked what challenges she finds in running her own business, she says she does not have enough working capital to grow her business, and as such she can not order enough stock and sometimes goes for a period of time without having drinks to sell.

Rosemary is hopeful that once she gets her loan, she will be able to order more drinks. This will help her earn more profits from her business.

loans.use: to order more drinks.

loans.name: Tripher

texts.en:
Meet Tripher: He is 35 years old. He runs his own business as a distributor of Coca-Cola products in Lusaka’s Chilenge Township. A staff member of Zoona asked him the following questions:

Can you tell me about yourself?
"I am Tripher, I live here in Lusaka with my wife, my 2-year-old son and 10 relatives from both mine and my wife’s family."

What is your educational background?
"I have a diploma in Business Administration and I would like to get my degree soon."

What do you love most about running your own business?
