"I love being self-employed because I have clear goals that I want to achieve and I work towards that. It is also nice to make my own decisions."

What challenges do you face in your business?
"The biggest challenge that I face in my business is that I do not have enough money to order a lot of stock, and as a result I end up disappointing my customers. There are times when I run out of stock at my shop due to the fact that my capital is small."

What do you want to use the Kiva loan for?
"I want to use the Kiva loan to buy stock for my shop. This loan will help me because once I order the drinks, at least my stock won’t be running out on me for some time."

What are your hopes and dreams for your future?
"I have many dreams, but my biggest is to see my son grow into an educated somebody. For my business, I dream of opening up two more Coca-Cola distribution centres in Mongu town and Chisamba district."

loans.use: to purchase crates of soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Ruben Eustaquio

texts.es:
Ruben tiene 43 años de edad, es padre de 3 hijos de 9, 17, 19 años y a quienes quiere mucho y por quienes trabaja con mucho esmero y dedicación para poder sacarlos adelante.
Día a día Ruben trabaja como chofer de taxi, especialmente trabaja ofreciendo los servicios de colectivo por las calles de su distrito y puede atender hasta 20 clientes diariamente y trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día; el cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque es responsable cuando conduce.

Ruben está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar llantas nuevas y realizar un mantenimiento a su vehículo, de esta manera evitara tener accidentes y conducir un vehículo en buen estado y seguir luchando para cumplir su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos”.
texts.en: Ruben is 43 years old and has three children, aged 9, 17, and 19, whom he loves very dearly. He works with all his might and dedication in order to give them a better life. Day in and day out, Ruben provides transportation in his taxi, roaming the streets of his town to deliver much the same service a bus would. He works 10 hours a day and sometimes has as many as 20 customers a day. He attributes his success to his amiability towards customers and his highly responsible driving. Ruben is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since, thanks to their help, he will be able to buy new tires and perform maintenance on his car, in order to avoid any accidents. He prides himself on driving a safe, well-maintained vehicle. He never loses sight of his greatest dream, which is to give his children the means to learn a profession.

loans.use: to buy tires and perform maintenance on his taxi.

loans.name: Maria Gladiz

texts.es:
Doña María es una mujer de 40 años de edad soltera y madre de 2 hijos los cuales son mayores con hogares y viven todos en familia bajo el mismo techo incluyendo sus 2 nietos. Ella es agricultora hace más de 10 años en lo que es la actividad de la siembra y cultivo de café en la cual también se involucran sus 2 hijos siendo ellos los únicos apoyos para ella. Sus cultivos están a una distancia de un kilómetro y medio al cual se trasladan  pie diariamente. En la actualidad su mayor desafió es la falta de energía eléctrica en la zona donde está construida su casa ya que no se tiene planeado por un tiempo la instalación de energía eléctrica por lo cual es necesaria hoy en día para mantener iluminada su casa la cual lo hace mediante leña de ocote, candiles y vela comercial.

Pero con la ayuda que hoy en día ella solicita podrá comprar un panel solar el cual será de apoyo para mantener su casa iluminada y evitar la quema de palo de ocote, candiles u otros que sean dañinos para la salud y para el medio ambiente.

Su sueño es lograr con el paso de los años comercializar su producto en grandes escalas ya que por medio de eso ella podrá generar más ingresos para su familia como los de seguir ampliando sus cosechas. Pero su meta es poder comprar el panel solar para poder disfrutar de su hogar en familia con sus hijos y sus nietos de una manera sana sin perjudicar el medio ambiente y la salud.
texts.en:
María is 40 years old, single and mother to two children, both of whom are adults.  They all live together under the same roof, including with María's two grandchildren.  María has worked in agriculture for over ten years.  She sows and grows coffee and receives help from her two children - though they are her only support.  María's crops are a kilometre away from her home and she arrives there each day on foot.  Her biggest challenge currently is a lack of electricity in her home.  The town is not expected to have electricity for some time so María is forced to light the home with ocote pine firewood, oil lamps and candles.

However, with the help that she is now applying for, she will be able to buy a solar panel which will help keep the house lit and avoid having to burn firewood, oil or use anything else that might be harmful to health or the environment.

María's dream is, in time, to sell her product on a larger scale as then she would be able to generate a higher income for her family and continue increasing her harvest.  Nevertheless, her goal is buy the solar panel to use at home with her children and grandchildren so that they are healthy and not causing damage to the environment.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel for her home.

loans.name: Bryan

texts.en:
Bryan is 25 years of age, married with an only child, and lives in San Roque, Panaon, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Bryan is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to the local community  for 2 years now. Aside from this business, he also owns and manages a farm planting and harvesting bananas and other fruit trees for sale. He has requested a new loan of 10,000 PHP  to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

In the future, Bryan hopes to gain double income from his business to provide a better future for the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Phares

texts.en:
Phares is 60 years old. She runs a Micro-Distribution Centre (MDC), where she sells Coca-Cola products at wholesale to local retailers and customers. 

Phares enjoys running her business because she sees it as a way to provide a service to people in her community as they do not have to use any transport money to get to her container to purchase drinks for resale. When asked what challenges she faces in running her MDC, Phares says she does not have enough empty bottles and so cannot order as much stock as she would like to. She also struggles with transportation from her house to her container, as there is quite a distance between the two places.

When Phares gets her Kiva loan, she will use it to order more empty bottles and order more drinks for her container. She is hopeful that this will give her business the boost that it needs.

Phares’s biggest dream is to become the biggest distributor of soft drinks so that one day her grandson can take over the running of her business. She thanks the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to order more empty bottles and drinks for her container.

loans.name: Munkhjargal

texts.en: Mr. Munkhjargal, 55 years old, lives alone in Kherlen, an eastern town of Mongolia. He has been growing and selling vegetables to local people for many years. Recently the well he used for irrigation dried up and this incident caused his seed planting schedule to be delayed. He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to cover the cost of digging a well on his land. After digging this well and connecting up the irrigation system, he will be able to plant his seeds immediately. He usually grows cabbage, potatoes and carrots. In his town, he is well known for his hardworking and stern character.

loans.use: to cover the cost of digging a well

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz de 32 años de edad, es madre de un hijo y actualmente se encuentra en periodo de gestación. Aseguran quienes la conocen que es una mujer pujante y trabajadora. Uno de sus mayores sueños es tener su propio negocio con el fin de dedicarle más tiempo a su familia. Hoy este sueño comienza a materializarse, debido a que se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido (productos de la canasta familiar), estanterías, vitrina y un enfriador, con el fin de abrirla al público. 
Manifiesta que su negocio tendrá un alto nivel de aceptación debido a que en su barrio no existe tiendas generales. 
Espera mejorar la calidad de vida  su grupo familiar y garantizarle a su hija de 16 años el acceso a la educación superior.
texts.en: Beatriz is 32 years old. She has a child and is pregnant. The people who know her vouch for her being a strong, hard-working woman. One of her greatest dreams is to have her own business in order to devote more time to her family. This dream is slowly becoming a reality, as she is asking for a loan to buy consumer goods to sell, as well as shelves, a display case, and a fridge, to open a shop. She is confident that her store will thrive by virtue of being the only one of its kind in the neighbourhood. She hopes to improve her family's standard of living and to help her sixteen year-old daughter go to university.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell as well as shelves, a display case, and a fridge to open a shop.

loans.name: Gracilda

texts.en: Gracilda is taking a loan of $600 (USD) from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) for her clothing business. She is married and has nine children. She has a shop to generate income for her family. She has been thinking how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. With her loan, she will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as second-hand clothes, shoes and handbags. She is happy that TRM offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes, shoes and handbags

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina es una mujer de 38 años y esta casada con Paulino conformando así una familia junto a sus 4 hijos. Gracias a varios años de trabajo junto a su pareja tiene una vivienda hecha con ladrillos y cemento.Desde hace 17 años se dedica a trabajar en el campo cultivando cacao orgánico.Tiene una parcela que heredó por parte de sus abuelos  cuando fue joven y le sirvió para obtener ingresos cultivándola con mucha dedicación para mantener económicamente a su familia.Para obtener frutos con buena calidad usa abono orgánico el cual compra en uan de las distribuidoras más grandes de la zona.Se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy dedicada a su trabajo, es por ello que a diferencia de otros productores de su zona solo contrata a trabajadores del lugar para la cosecha de los frutos que después seca y vende a los compradores de su zona obteniendo el precio final de acuerdo a la calidad que estos productos logrando recuperar el dinero invertido.Su principal objetivo es trabajar con la motivación que la caracteriza para brindar el apoyo económico a sus hijos menores y enviarlos a estudiar a la ciudad.Este es el tercer préstamo que recibe de KIVA y agradece la oportunidad que le brindan para seguir adelante.Desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para comprar abono orgánico y mejorar la calidad de sus plantas.
texts.en: Catalina is 38 years old and married to Paulino.  Together they are a family alongside their four children.  Thanks to various years working with her husband, Catalina now has a home built of bricks and cement.  Catalina has now been working in the fields for seventeen years, growing organic cacao.  She has a plot of land that she inherited from her grandparents when she was young and it has helped her to earn an income to support her family.  In order to obtain a good quality product, Catalina uses organic fertiliser that she buys from one of the area's biggest distributors.  Catalina is dedicated to her work and so is different from other producers in the area.  She only takes on labourers from the area for harvest.  After the harvest she dries the fruit and sells it to buyers in area, the price varying according to the quality of the product.  This sale allows her to earn back the money she has invested.  Catalina's main goal is to work with motivation so as to provide financial support to her younger children and send them to study in the city.  This is Catalina's third loan from Kiva and she is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving that will help her to prosper.  Catalina is applying for a loan of 1000 Nuevo Soles to buy organic fertiliser and to improve the quality of her plants.

loans.use: to buy organic fertiliser.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Francisco está en su ciclo número 11 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Son mujeres jefas de familia, que han visto una gran oportunidad de progreso en el grupo es por eso que decidieron unirse.
Geronina es una persona muy talentosa y lo demuestra en los productos que vende. Se dedica a la venta de zapatillas bordadas de todas clases. Sus clientes siempre quedan encantadas con las zapatillas y es por eso que tiene muy buena venta y le esta yendo muy bien. Ella quiere seguir creciendo con el tiempo, y de esa forma poder cumplir con sus clientes.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, lentejuelas, zapatillas y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus zapatillas bordadas.
texts.en:
This group is called San Francisco and is in its 11th cycle in the Committee of Woman program, where all are working and help one another get ahead.  They are women heads of household who have seen a great opportunity to progress so they decided to get together.

Geronina is a very talented person and demonstrates it in the products she sells.  She sells embroidered slippers of all types.  Her customers are always enchanted with the slippers and this is why she has such good sales and things are going well for her.  She wants to continue growing over time and wants to meet her customers’ needs.

She is asking for this loan so that she can buy thread, needles, sequins, slippers, and other supplies so she can make her embroidered slippers.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Pichmeamveasna

texts.en:
Pichmeamveasna (pictured here), age 20, is single and lives with his parents and sister in Phnom Penh. His father drives a remoque taxi, his mother is a chef, and his sister is also a student.  

Pichmeamveasna is now in his first semester and second year of his University in Phnom Penh. He is majoring in architecture. 

He will go to his second semester; hence, he requested a loan in the amount of $500 to pay for his second semester and second year of his university.

loans.use: To pay for school fees

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es:
Daysi es una joven de 22 años y está casada con Danny con quien tiene una pequeña hija. Sus padres le cedieron una vivienda hecha de madera.Daysi trabaja en el campo cultivando algunos productos de la zona tales como cacao orgánico, café y barbasco.Desde niña creció junto a sus padres quienes realizaban la misma actividad económica motivándola a seguir con el negocio familiar de manera independiente años mas tarde.
Al comprometerse con Danny encontró en el un gran compañero de trabajo con quien sale al campo todas las mañanas para realizar las distintas tareas esperando obtener frutos de calidad al final la campaña productiva.
El cacao orgánico es un producto muy rentable en su localidad pero a su vez requiere mano de obra constante para darle un buen cuidado y mantenimiento por eso contrata constantemente a trabajadores del lugar para el retiro de maleza entre sus plantaciones y así evitar su deterioro.Su principal objetivo es iniciar la construcción de su vivienda con ladrillos y cemento.Este es el segundo préstamo con KIVA y agradece la oportunidad financiera que le brindad para seguir adelante.En esta ocasión desea contar con 500 suevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Daysi, 22, is married to Danny, with whom she has a young daughter. Her parents gave her a house made of wood. Daysi works in the field growing regional crops such as organic cacao, coffee, and mullein. She grew up watching her parents do the same work, which prompted her years later to follow the family tradition on her own. On becoming engaged to Danny, she found a great work partner, with whom she goes to the fields every day to do various chores in hopes of obtaining quality crops at the end of the growing season. 

Organic cacao is a very profitable local crop, but it requires continuous labor to care and maintain it. She regularly hires local workers to pull weeds between the plants to keep them healthy. Daysi's main goal is to build a house with bricks and cement. This is her second loan cycle with Kiva, and she is grateful for the chance to get ahead. She has applied for a loan of 500 suevos soles to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Eleonora

texts.en:
Eleonora is 41 years old and single. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 50,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries.

Eleonora has been in this business for 11 years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Jane Janny

texts.es:
Jane tiene 33años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, ciudad cálida, alegre y de gastronomía variada. Jane e suna mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante, sobre todo porque es madre de 2 pequeños de 7 años y uno de tan solo 8 meses, por los cuales trabaja muy duro y le brinda todo su amor ya que son lo más importante que ella tiene. Por ello cada dia Jane se esfuerza mucho en su trabajo, ella labora como empleada en una pequeña empresa de su ciudad, y también tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, con lo cual tiene un ingreso extra para los gastos de su hogar. 

Jane está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como polos, short, bividís, entre otros; de esta manera podrá mejorar sus ingresos y tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer, así ella seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos y tener una tienda propia para su negocio”.
texts.en:
Jane is 33 years old and lives in the city of Pucallpa, a city that is warm, happy and a variety of foods. Jane is a woman who has a great desire to get ahead, above all because she is the mother of two young children, one who is seven years old and the other who is only eight months. She works very hard ofr them and gives them all of her love, as they are the most important things in her life. For this reason Jane works very hard at work every day. She works as an employee in a small business within the city and also has her own small business where she sells clothing, with which she has an extra income to cover the household expenses. 

Jane is very thankful for the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help that they have brought to her she will be able to buy merchandise for her business including polo shirts, shorts, men's tank tops and other apparel. In this way she will be able to improve her earnings and have a greater variety of products to offer. She will continue fighting to make her greatest dream a reality: "offering her children the chance to become professionals and to have a store where she can put her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise including shorts, men's tank tops, blouses and other items.

loans.name: Elvina

texts.en:
Elvina is 48 years old and married with one child.

Elvina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Elvina requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elvina has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 34 years old and married with three children who are all in school. Gemma works very hard to provide for them.

Gemma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Gemma has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of grocery items such as bread, soft drinks and biscuits. 

In the future, Gemma would like to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Paix De Jesus 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.fr:
Duquene est le coordinateur de son groupe Paix de Jesus 1, 2 & 3. Il n est pas marie il a 3 enfants. Il habite dans la région nord Haïti ou  l’électricité est rare et de l’eau portable est très limite. Il dirige son commerce de vente de produits alimentaire  pendants les 5 derniers années
 
Duquene espère que ce emprunt`l’aidera a grandir son commerce. Des autres membres de Paix de Jesus ont besoin d’un emprunt pour les commerces tel que ventes produits cosmetiques, nourriture, boissons gazeuses, charbon, etc. Il dit que son défi principal est de devenir un plus grand commerçant
texts.en:
Duquene is the coordinator of Paix de Jesus 1, 2 and 3. He is single and the father of three. He lives in the North of Haiti, where electricity is scarce, and drinkable water is very limited. He has been running his business selling food products for five years.

Duquene hopes that this loan will allow him to expand his business. The other members of his group need a loan for business such as selling cosmetic products, food, soda drinks, charcoal etc. He says that his main challenge is to increase the scope of his business.

loans.use: to stock up on food items.

loans.name: Dadurus Group

texts.en: Otelia is one of the group. She is applying for this loan to improve her business. She is 26 years old and she will use this loan to buy some additional items like oil and palm wine. Dadurus means hope to her because she is taking this loan to improve her living conditions, and so her children can attend school.

loans.use: To buy oil and palm wine

loans.name: Frangelina

texts.en: Frangelina is taking a loan of $1000 (USD) from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) for her business. She is married with one child and her husband works in motorcycle transportation. She has a clothing shop to generate income for her family. She wants to run a bigger business but does not have enough working capital so she applied for her first loan. She will use the loan to buy additional items to keep in her store such as clothes, shoes and bags. She is happy that TRM offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and bags

loans.name: Yoladis Ester

texts.es: Yoladis de 32 años de edad es una mujer casada que habita al suroccidente de la ciudad con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 10 y 12 años. Ella se dedica a la actividad comercial desde hace 2 años, cuando después de trabajar en oficios varios en diversas oficinas, desde las 6 hasta las 9 de la mañana, decidió aprovechar el tiempo restante para generar otros ingresos que beneficiaran su hogar. Así fue como inició vendiendo  ropa, para damas y caballeros  y por otro lado carnes frías. Su día laboral lo inicia, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, visitando a los clientes y de lunes a domingos. Realiza sus compras de contado en distribuidores especializados en sus productos que se ubican en el centro de Barranquilla.  Su meta es ampliar el negocio y ofrecerles  una educación de calidad a sus hijos. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará; Ropa para damas, pantalones, camisetas, carnes frías, con ello aumentará su capital de trabajo y empezará a cumplir su sueño de prosperidad.
texts.en: Yoladis is 32 years old, married, and she lives with her husband and two children, ages 10 and 12, in the southeast part of the city.  She has been a merchant for two years, when after two years of working in various trades at several offices, from 6:00am to 9:00am, she decided to take advantage of the remaining time to generate other income that would benefit her household.  This is how she began selling men’s and women’s clothing and also cold cuts.  She begins her workday at 8:00 am and works until 6:00 pm, visiting customers M-F.  She buys for cash from distributers, located in the Barranquilla city center, who specialize in her products.  Her goal is to expand her business and offer a quality education to her children.  This is the reason she has approached Kiva.  This will be her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, though which she will buy woman’s clothing, such as pants and shirts; and also cold cuts.  This will allow her to increase her working capital and help her begin her dream of prosperity.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is married and she works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more items, like bread, soft drinks, and other groceries.

Teresita has been in this business for five years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save money to expand her business and to repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items, like bread, soft drinks, and other groceries.

loans.name: Diana Marcela

texts.es:
Diana es una joven de 28 años de edad y madre de dos hijos. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la fabricación y arreglo de calzado. Actividad que aprendió por tradición familiar y que le permite generar el sustento para su hogar. Con un pequeño taller ubicado en su residencia, esta mujer lucha diariamente por buscar mejores alternativas de vida. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos (hebillas, suelas, tacón, cuerina) para terminar una producción que tiene represada por falta de capital.
Sueña con aumentar sus ingresos y comprar una vivienda para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Diana is a 28 year old young woman and the mother of two children.  She has been making and repairing shoes for the past 10 years.  She learned this through a family tradition which allows her to generate an income with which to support her household.  With her small workshop, located in her home, this woman works daily to find better alternatives for her life.  She is asking for this loan so she can buy supplies (buckles, soles, heels, leatherette) to complete a production run which is on hold due to a shortage of working capital.

She hopes to increase her income and buy a house in order to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Daniela Soledad

texts.es:
Daniela es una joven de 20 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, Daniela es una joven muy carismática y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, sobre todo porque vive al lado de sus padres y para ella lo más importante es poder apoyarlos.  Daniela logro estudiar la carrera de medicina veterinaria, pero debido a que no encontraba  empleo Por ello Daniela trabaja día a día en una empresa de venta de artículos eléctricos, y con el fruto de su trabajo apoya a sus padre con los gastos del hogar, ella cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es responsable y muy colaboradora.

Daniela está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una pequeña moto con la cual podrá transportase, ya que vive en un lugar alejado y de esta manera podrá ahorrar en transporte, asi ella seguirá trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su propia veterinaria y un negocio de fotografías”.
texts.en:
Daniela is a young woman, age 20, living in the city of Ica. She is very charismatic and has a great desire to get ahead, above all because she lives with her parents and her greatest priority is to be able to support them. She was able to study veterinary medicine, but because she was unable to find work in that area, she now works for a company that sells electronics. With her income from this work, she supports her parents with the household costs. She thinks that she is getting ahead because she is responsible and a strong team worker.
Daniela is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because, thanks to their support, she will be able to buy a small motorcycle to get around. She lives in a rural area; with this purchase, she will save on transportation costs. She will thus keep working in order to make her greatest dream reality: to have her own veterinary clinic and a photography business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business selling frozen foods in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 22,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Suzette's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is 38 years old and married, with three children.

Ma. Theresa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ma. Theresa has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Ma. Theresa aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 26 years old and married, with two children.

Mary Jane works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mary Jane has been in this business for three years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha works hard to support her family. Editha is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Editha requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store like shampoo, coffee, laundry soap, sugar and candies.

Editha has been in this business for three years now, and earns additional income from raising livestock.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Editha would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha's family lives in the village of Villa Domingo. She is blessed with four children. Editha helps her husband manage a farming business in their village. They have been doing this for 10 years to support their daily expenses and the educational needs of their children. Editha and her husband usually earn PHP 12,000 every harvest season. The earnings are just enough to meet their needs so Editha is requesting additional capital for their farming business. She wants a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticides needed for her rice growing. She hopes that her yield will increase through the loan she is requesting.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticides needed for her rice growing

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 62 years old and widowed with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Elsie has a food vending business in the Philippines. Elsie requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Elsie has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Elsie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida runs her piggery business. She is glad because, through her hard work and proper care to her raised hogs, she is able to keep her piggery business profitable. Leonida is 55 years of age and a widow.

Leonida would like to continuously grow her piggery business, thus she is requesting a loan. She is seeking an amount of PHP 11,000 which will be used to buy hog feed and essential vitamins to raise pigs. 

Leonida hopes and prays that lenders will continue to support her financially, so she could sustain her piggery business. She believes that her goals will be realized someday because she has been doing her best in order to earn greater income and secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and essential vitamins to raise hogs.

loans.name: Calal

texts.en:
Calal is 36 years old and a father of two daughters. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is a Fuzuli refugee. 

For the past ten years, Calal has been working hard to manage his pharmacy, which sells medicine. His wife is also helping him in this work. He loves his work and is doing it by heart. He works at the business six days per week and twelve hours per day. He says, at present, his business is doing well. Calal is very popular in his region because everybody knows him as a good doctor, also.

To help expand his business, Calal has requested a loan of AZN 2,000. The loan will be used to buy more medicine to sell and will help Calal to generate greater profits and increase his capital, so as to have enough health facilities. 

Calal hopes that, in the future, he will be able to open a big clinic, so that he can help his community recover from illness. He appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more medicine to sell.

loans.name: Nirmeen

texts.en:
Nirmeen is 30 years old, from Gaza. She is married and has three children.

Nirmeen has owned a clothes shop since 2009 and has two employees. She asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy a glass door and some clothes for her clothes shop.

She hopes that this loan will increase the goods displayed and, thus, improve her family's income.

The one who appears in the picture is Nirmeen's husband since, due to cultural matters, Nirmeen refused to appear.

loans.use: to buy a glass door and some clothes for her clothes shop.

loans.name: Janeth Yessenia

texts.es:
Janeth es una mujer de 29 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con sus tres pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella es padre y madre para sus hijos; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Janeth no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Contabilidad, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar con sus hijos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Janeth trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas tanto al por mayor y menor, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas, puede atender un promedio de 10 clientes y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Janeth se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de 3 vitrinas y 2 andamios, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder exhibir y mostrar sus golosinas, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propio puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Janeth is a 29-year-old woman who lives in the city of Cañete, in the district of Imperial, with her three little children whom she loves very much; they are her main reason for living. She is a very kind, hard-working and enthusiastic person who gives her all to get her family ahead; she is both father and mother to her children. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and due to the need to start work at a very young age, Janeth was not able to study accounting. In her free time she enjoys playing with her children. Sometimes, she cooks a delicious arroz con pato [rice and duck] for her family.
On her own initiative, with great hard work and dedication, Janeth operates her business selling candy wholesale and retail. She works every day for approximately ten hours. She is able to serve an average of ten clients and believes that it is going well for her because of her good prices and kind treatment of others.
Janeth is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she will be able to buy three display cases and two shelves, which will be of great use to her in displaying her candies. This way, she will be able to keep working hard to achieve her greatest dream; to have her own sales stall.

loans.use: to buy three display cases and two shelves.

loans.name: Twizerane I Group

texts.fr:
Suzanne fait partie du groupe  Twizerane I  et   habite à Gitega. Elle a 31  ans et est mariée  à Richard, un tailleur. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants dont 1étudie.

Elle fait le commerce de maniocs  depuis  4 ans. 

Elle est à son dixième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  acheter une grande quantité de maniocs  à revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Suzanne is part of the Twizerane I group and lives in Gitega. She is 31 years old and is married to Richard, a tailor. Together they have two children of whom one is in school.

She has been trading cassava for the past four years. She is on her tenth credit loan with Turame.

With the KIVA credit loan she will buy a large quantity of cassava to resell, to increase her earnings.

loans.use: buy a large amount of cassava to resell, to increase her earnings.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is taking out a loan of $600 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is married and has 8 children. Her husband is a teacher. She has a shop to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about running a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as second-hand clothes, second-hand shoes and second-hand bags. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) because they offer loans to poor people.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes, second-hand shoes and second-hand bags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for dairy cow.

loans.name: Waldir Enrique

texts.es:
Waldir es un joven de 18 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Waldir no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Mecánica, pero gracias a su esfuerzo Waldir estudio pequeños cursos técnicos de mecánica y mantenimiento, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Verde para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Waldir trabaja como obrero campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, el realiza labores de riego, cosecha y otros, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Waldir se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una maquina de cocer, la cual brindara a su madre para ayudarla, ya que ella se dedica a la refacción de prendas de vestir y su máquina actual está bastante deteriorada, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Waldir is a young man of 18.  He is single and lives in the city of Cañete, in Imperial district, with his parents and siblings.  He is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to improve himself.  Sadly, owing to a lack of financial resources and a need to work, Waldir was unable to study for a degree in mechanical engineering.  However, he has worked hard to take some small technical courses in mechanics and maintenance.  In his free time, he enjoys playing soccer with his friends and he also sometimes cooks a delicious 'arroz verde' to share with his family.

On his own initiative, working with a great deal of determination and commitment, Waldir is employed as a farm laborer in his city.  He performs irrigation work and harvest crops, among other tasks.  He works for approximately 10 hours every day and believes that things are going well because of the effort he puts in and the friendly way he treats others.

Waldir is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, he will be able to buy a sewing machine which he will give to his mother to help her.  His mother makes clothing and her current machine is in a bad state of repair.  Waldir will continue working hard to realize his big dream of studying for a degree.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for his mother

loans.name: Qadir

texts.en:
Qadir is 25 years old, married, and lives with his wife in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is a Fuzuli refugee. 

Qadir raises cattle, fattens them, and sells them for a profitable price. He has been in this business for three years. He is very kind, caring, and also very energetic in his work. Since high school, Qadir chose not to study, but to continue the family tradition and to come to this business. This is a very profitable business and Qadir is doing it together with his father.

He sells meat at the central bazaar for profits. In Azerbaijan, there is a high demand for meat because it is used in a lot of meals, such as kufta (soup), kababs, dolma, etc. His income from this business is AZN 195 per month. In order to fully support the family, Qadir is looking forward to expanding the business and making it a very successful one. 

Now, he has applied for a loan of AZN 1,800 from Aqroinvest Credit Union to buy more calves. Qadir, at this very young age and with a great passion and energy, plans to become a successful businessman in the town. He appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more calves to sell.

loans.name: Mahammad

texts.en:
Mahammad is 34 years old, married and has a one son and one daughter. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife and children  in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is a Fuzuli refugee. For 10 years, he has been raising cattle and selling their milk. Milk is very popular drink among local people; they prepare different products such as yogurt and cheese. Milk products are in high demand because of their health benefits.
Mahammad earns an income of 120 AZN from this business. His wife is helping him run the business. Regardless of difficulties in raising cattle, Mahammad is a very positive man and doing this business with heart. He has applied for loan of 1900 AZN from Aqroinvest in order to buy more calves. He has plans to expand the business and to meet the high demand potential for milk in the market. This is his sixth loan and he has a good loan repayment history. Mahammad appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more calves

loans.name: La Dignite De  Dilaire Group

texts.fr:
Phanie est la coordinatrice de son groupe Dignite de Dilaire. Elle habite dans la région de Dilaire dans Trou-du-Nord d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Elle a dirigé son commerce de vente de produits alimentaires pendant les 7 dernières années. 

Phanie voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans le riz, la viande, le sucre, les haricots, etc. Des autres membres du groupe ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre des produits alimentaires, cosmétiques, vêtements, chaussures et du charbon.

Phanie a déclaré que son principal défi est en mesure de vendre plus depuis la crise économique en Haïti n'obtenez pas beaucoup d'argent et que vous voulez développer votre entreprise.
texts.en:
Phanie is the coordinator of the Dignity de Dilaire group. She lives in the Dilaire area of Trou-du-Nord, Haiti where electricity is scarce and access to water is very limited. She conducted her business selling food products for the past 7 years.

Phanie wants to use this loan to invest in rice, meat, sugar, beans, etc. Other group members need a loan for such businesses as selling food products, cosmetics, clothing, shoes and coal.

Phanie said her main challenge is to increase her sales. Since the economic crisis in Haiti you can not obtain a lot of money if you want to expand your business.

loans.use: buy rice, meat, sugar, beans, etc.

loans.name: Maria Ercilia

texts.es:
Maria, tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera de un niño de 3 años de edad, vive con sus padres. Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas para obtener ingresos y ayudar con los gastos del hogar, lo realiza de lunes a sábado de 7:00am a 12:00pm, lo aprendió con su madre y lleva dos años de desempeñarlo.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar maíz, gas propano para la elaboración de tortillas; este le ayudar a incrementar sus ingresos debido a la inversión del crédito.
Su sueño el fortalecer el negocio para mejorar la situación económica.
texts.en:
Maria is 30 years old, is a single mother, lives with her parents, and has a three year old son.  She sells tortillas in order to generate an income and help with the household expenses.  She works Monday through Saturday from 7:00 am to 12:00 pm, learned this trade from her mother, and has been doing this for two years.

She will use the money from this loan to buy dried corn and propane gas to make tortillas.  This will help her increase her income.

Her dream is to strengthen her business so that she can improve her financial condition.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is 21 years old from Gaza.
He has owned a fruit and vegetable shop since 2011.
He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a small automobile for his shop.
Through this loan he will be able to cut the cost of transportation and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a small automobile for his fruit and vegetable shop.

loans.name: Sindi Guadalupe

texts.es:
Sindi, solicita un nuevo préstamo porque requiere más capital de trabajo en el taller de costureria; este le permitirá comprar zippers, hilo, botones, estampados, entre otros materiales de costura.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a fortalecer el negocio y con las ganancias ha podido  apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios, ya que su sueño es que ellos se preparen profesionalmente.
texts.en:
Sindi is asking for a new loan because she needs more working capital for her sewing workshop.  This will allow her to buy zippers, thread, buttons, snaps, and other supplies.

The previous loan helped her strengthen her business and she was able to use the earnings to support her children’s education.  Her dream is for them to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy syupplies.

loans.name: Lizet Pilar

texts.es:
Lizet es una mujer muy trabajadora,  ella vive en la ciudad de iCA, ciudad ubicada al de nuestro país, la cual se caracteriza por la amabilidad de sus pobladores, asimismo se caracteriza por su agricultura. Lizet solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar para ser enfermería.

Con mucha dedicación Lizet tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza, como perfumes, cremas, maquillaje, entre otros, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con sus clientes y porque ofrece productos de calidad.

Lizet está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo ella podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio como cremas, perfumes, entre otros, con lo cual tendrá más variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y sobre todo porque podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Lizet is a hardworking woman who lives in the city of Ica in southern Peru. This area is known for its friendly people and for its agriculture.  She only completed the fifth grade of elementary school, but she would very much have liked to study to become a nurse.

With a great deal of dedication, Lizet manages her small business selling beauty products, such as perfumes, creams, makeup and other items.  She works around eight hours per day and can serve up to twenty customers each day.  She believes that her business is doing well because of her friendly customer service and the high-quality products that she offers.

Lizet is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their support she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business, such as creams and perfumes.  She will thus be able to offer a greater variety of products to her customers.  Above all, she will be able to improve her income and keep fighting to make her greatest dream a reality - to have her own home.

loans.use: buy merchandise such as creams and perfumes.

loans.name: Khatira

texts.en:
Khatira is 37 years old, married, and mother of three children. Khatira is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her husband and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. She is a Fuzuli refugee. She is very kind, caring, and also very energetic in her work. 

Khatira raises cattle, fattens them, and sells them for a profitable price. Her husband is the major support for her in this business. She sells meat at the central bazaar for profits. In Azerbaijan, there is a high demand for meat because it is used in a lot of meals, such as kufta (soup), kababs, dolma, etc. Her income from this business is AZN 100 per month. In order to fully support the family, Khatira is looking forward to expanding the business and making it a very successful one. 

Khatira has applied for a loan of AZN 1,800 from Aqroinvest Credit Union to buy more calves. This is her sixth loan. Khatira, at this very young age and with a great passion and energy, plans to become a successful businesswoman in the town. Her good client history is a little proof of this.

loans.use: to buy more calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Donatilda

texts.es:
Donatilda Tiene 47 años de edad,es madre soletra de 3 hijos , tiene una casa hecha de madera la cual es fruto de su esfuerzo.Donatilda se dedica a cultivar cacao orgánico , cuando se inicio en el campo contaba con la ayuda de su esposo y tras su divorcio contrata a trabajadores del lugar para las tareas de mantenimiento.
Con el paso de los años y gracias a su trabajo en el campo ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos y al mismo tiempo agrandar el tamaño de sus terrenos comprando más terrenos en donde expandió sus plantaciones de cacao con la finalidad de mejorar sus ingresos económicos.A notado que varios árboles de cacao están desfasados e imposibilitados de dar frutos y es necesario cambiarlos siendo necesario contar con más dinero para la próxima campaña productiva.Para mejorar la calidad de los frutos usa solo abono orgánico porque considera que los fertilizantes químicos deterioran los terrenos de cultivo a largo plazo.Este es el tercer préstamo con KIVA razón por la cual se siente muy agradecida , en esta oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para comprar plantas de almácigo y reemplazar los árboles de cacao desfasados que tiene en sus terrenos de cultivo.
texts.en:
Donatilda is 47. She is a single mother of three children and has a wooden home thanks to her own hard work. Donatilda cultivates organic cocoa. When she started this work she counted on her husband's support. Through her divorce, she has hired local labourers to do the maintenance.
With the passing of time, and thanks to her work in the fields, she has been able to get her children ahead while expanding her land. She has bought more land and expanded her cocoa plantations with the goal of improving her income. 
She has noted that several of her cocoa plants are getting old and are not producing anymore; it is necessary to change them so that she will have more money in the next harvest. In order to improve the quality of her produce, she only uses organic fertilizer because she feels that chemical fertilizers harm the soil long-term. This is her third loan with Kiva, and she is very grateful. She would like to have 1,000 nuevos soles for the purchase of seedlings and to replace the old cocoa plants on her land.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and replace old cocoa plants.

loans.name: Anali Maribel

texts.es:
Anali es una mujer de 30 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta , que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella es padre y madre para sus hijos; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Anali no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Contabilidad que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar una riquísima Sopa de Leche para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho y dedicación, Anali trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, bebidas, tubérculos y verduras, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Anali se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un pequeño refrigerado y una congeladora, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder almacenar y mantener en mejor estado las bebidas  y verduras que vende, de esta manera Anali podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un minimarket.
texts.en:
Anali is a 30 year old woman who lives in the city of Pisco with her two young children.  She loves her children and they mean everything in the world to her.  Anali is a very friendly, hard-working, enthusiastic person who puts all her efforts into providing for her family as she is both mother and father to her children.  Sadly, owing to a lack of financial resources and the need to work from a very young age, Anali wasn't able to study for a degree in accountancy as she had wanted to.  In her free time, she enjoys cooking a delicious 'sopa de leche' to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with a lot of dedication, Anali works in her small business selling groceries, drinks, tubers and vegetables.  She works approximately 12 hours every day.  She feels happy carrying out her work and she believes that her business is doing well because she charges reasonable prices and treats people in a friendly manner.

Anali is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy a small refrigerator and a freezer.  These appliances will be very helpful to her in storing the drinks and vegetables that she sells and she will be able to keep them in good condition.  Anali will be able to serve more customers and will continue working to realize her big dream of owning a mini-mart.

loans.use: to buy a small refrigerator and a freezer

loans.name: Jalal

texts.en: Jalal is a 30-year-old man living in Taiz, Yemen.  He completed secondary school but was not able to proceed further with his studies due to the difficult living conditions he faced.  Jalal's business is a grocery store, which he started six years ago.  He worked hard to raise money to establish the business as it was to be the starting point of his young life.  He was able to gain many customers and he is now inspired to expand his capital and income by purchasing all the grocery items needed by members of his neighborhood.  To do this, he has taken a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.  In the future, he hopes to expand his business by opening a supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for his business.

loans.name: Hadya

texts.en:
Hadya is a 53-year-old married woman from Ramallah.  She has 3 children who are continuing their primary school education and university education.  She owns a beauty salon since 2003 and has two employees.

Hadya requested this loan in order to buy a facial cleansing steam machine and some makeup for the salon.  Through this loan she will be able to increase her income and approach her dream of having a beauty academy.

loans.use: to buy a facial cleansing steam machine and some makeup for the salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Donatilda

texts.es:
Donatilda es una mujer muy trabajadora de 65 años , es viuda y tiene varios hijos. Tiene una casa hecha de adobe donde vive junto a su familia.Posee un terreno de cultivo que compró cuando era muy joven con ayuda de su difunto esposo para trabajarlo y mantener económicamente a sus hijos.
Al quedar viuda se vio obligada a trabajar de manera independiente recibiendo muchas veces la ayuda de trabajadores del lugar .Tiene en sus terrenos agrícolas varios productos que considera rentables como cacao orgánico,café entre otros.Con el paso de los años y gracias a su trabajo a logrado comprar otro terreno en donde decidió plantar mas árboles de cacao porque a diferencia de otros productos es mas fácil de cuidar y con la venta de los granos secos a los compradores de la zona es posible recuperar el dinero invertido con buenas ganancias adicionales.Para desempeñar un buen trabajo debe contar con dinero para satisfacer las necesidades de sus terrenos tales como retirar la maleza con ayuda de trabajadores del lugar y fertilizar sus suelos con abono orgánico.Es la tercera vez que KIVA le brinda un préstamo por ser una socia puntual y haber demostrado que gracias a los préstamos que viene recibiendo va mejorando su calidad de vida.  Desea en esta ocasión contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para comprar abono orgánico y fertilizar sus plantas con la ayuda de jornaleros.
texts.en:
Donatilda is a very hardworking woman who is 65 years old.  She is a widow, and has several children.  She lives with her family in a house that she has that is made of adobe.  She has some land that she bought when she was very young with the help of her deceased husband, so that they could work the land and support their children.  Once she was left a widow, she saw the need to work independently, often making use of the help of workers in the area.  On her land, she cultivates a variety of products that she considers to be profitable, such as: organic cocoa, coffee, and other products.  Over the years, and thanks to her work, she managed to buy other land where she decided to plant more cocoa trees, because compared to other products they are easier to care for.  With the sales of the dried beans to the buyers in the area, it is possible to recover the money invested and also earn good profits.  

In order to carry out her work well, she needs money so that she can maintain her lands with activities such as weed removal with the help of workers from the area, and with products such as organic fertilizers.  This is the third time that Kiva has provided her with a loan, because she is a member who is on time with her payments and has demonstrated that thanks to the loans that she has been receiving, her quality of life has been improving.  At this time, she wants to take a loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy organic fertilizer and to fertilize her plants with the help of laborers.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay for his education

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 21 años, cuando terminó la secundaria se dedicó a trabajar para ayudar en su hogar. Decidió vivir con su pareja Edgar que tiene 24 años y se desempeña como albañil desde muy joven y tienen un hijo con quien sueñan un día sea un profesional, es por esto que juntos se esfuerzan trabajando para que no le falte nada a su hijo. Ana vive con su pareja e hijo en Pastaza, un cantón ubicado en la Provincia con el mismo nombre, perteneciente a la Región Amazónica de la República del Ecuador. La cabecera cantonal es la ciudad del Puyo una ciudad ubicada en medio de la selva amazónica al occidente de la provincia de Pastaza y a 924 m. sobre el nivel del mar. Es demográficamente pequeña pero tiene una gran variedad de sitios que son los preferidos para turistas nacionales e internacionales sobre todo los de actividades ecológicas y de deportes extremos. Una ciudad que crece económicamente cada día por las actividades de comercio, ganadería, agricultura y turismo, por lo que en ella se han establecido sucursales de empresas financieras y comerciales que pretenden aprovechar la actividad económica que mantiene esta pequeña ciudad. En cada negocio se encuentra personas que no se han dado por vencidas frente a la falta de empleo sino que han emprendido con sus ideas de negocio para llevar una vida digna y hacer realidad sus sueños.
Ana desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de diferentes marcas, lo realiza de forma ambulante recorriendo las largas calles de su ciudad visitando a clientes que en su mayoría son mujeres, de la misma forma hace labor de cobranzas y entrega de productos. Comenzó con este negocio para también aportar con los gastos de su hogar y además algunos gastos personales. En muchas ocasiones sus clientes le piden productos que necesitan de manera inmediata, lo cual es una oportunidad para obtener ganancias adicionales, es por esto que solicita un préstamo para comprar productos a mejor precio e incrementar su stock para de esta forma obtener mayores ganancias y así mejorar su calidad de vida y tener un fondo ahorrado para cuando su esposo no tiene trabajos de albañilería donde lo contraten.
texts.en:
Ana is a twenty-one-year-old woman.  When she completed secondary school, she began working to support her household.  She decided to move in with her partner Edgar, who is twenty-four and has worked as a bricklayer from a very early age.  Together they have a son, and they dream that one day he will have a professional career.  For this reason they work hard so that their son will have everything he needs.

They live in Pastaza, a canton in the province if the same name, in the Amazonian region of Ecuador.  The seat of the canton is the city of Puyo, which is located in the middle of the Amazonian forest in the west of the province, at an altitude of 924 meters above sea level.  The area is not heavily populated, but there are a great number of sites that are popular with domestic and international tourists, especially having to do with ecological activity and extreme sports.  The city is growing economically every day from commercial activity, livestock, agriculture and tourism.  Financial and commercial firms have opened branches here in order to take advantage of the economic activity of this small city.

There are many people here who have not given up due to lack of employment opportunities, but who instead have started their own businesses in order to live a dignified life and make their dreams a reality.

For the past three years, Ana has been selling different brands of cosmetics.  She sells her products on the long streets of her city, calling on customers, the majority of whom are women, also collecting payments and delivering her products.  She started this business so that she could share in the household expenses and also cover some personal expenses.  Many times, her customers ask for products that they need immediately, and this is an opportunity to obtain additional income.  

For this reason, she is seeking a loan so that she can build up her inventory and obtain higher profits.  This will in turn enable her to improve her standard of living and to have a savings account to draw on during times when her husband does not have contract work as a bricklayer.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of products.

loans.name: Thembinkosi

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 56 year old Thembinkosi from Bulawayo. She is married and has one child who attends school.  Thembinkosi runs a retail business, selling various clothing items, footwear and blankets. The business has been in operation for two years. She says the main challenges faced are high import duties charged at the border and lack of capital to boost the business. Thembinkosi has requested a loan of $1,000 so that she can order more stock, and restock winter wear as well.  She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will help in paying her day-to-day expenses, both at home and in the business.  In the future, Thembinkosi plans to open more outlets in her rural home as well as other surrounding areas.

loans.use: to purchase various clothing items for resale, which include kids wear, ladies, and men's wear.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 63 years old.  He sells potatoes and has been doing this business for the past twenty-five years. With the loan, he wants to buy more potatoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Maria Juliana

texts.es:
Doña María es una mujer de 42 años de edad, sotera y sin hijos con un grado de escolaridad de primaria no completado cursado hasta el 3 grado y no pudo continuar por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres mismos que le enseñaron a trabar la tierra desde muy pequeña. Ella tiene mucha experiencia en el cultivo de hortalizas como ser: papa, brócoli y coliflor siendo su hermana el único apoyo que ella tiene para trabajar. En sus actividades diarias ella empieza a las 7:00 Am hasta las 3:00 Pm arreglando y limpiando la tierra diariamente. Los fines de semana ella venden su producto en el mercado local al detalle o a los mayoristas que llegan a la zona para su consumo o para revender el producto. Sus tierras están ubicadas a un kilómetro y medio de distancia al cual se traslada a pie diariamente. 

Hoy en día ella solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abono, foliares y semilla certificada para poder cultivar papa.

Sus sueños y deseos son los de poder mejorar su casa de habitación ya que necesita mejoras como repello, un mejor suelo ya que el que tiene es de ladrillo y seguir invirtiendo en sus cultivos para poder salir de su compromiso y seguir siendo beneficiaria de los productos que le ofrece COMIXMUL en alianza con KIVA.
texts.en: María is 42 years old, single, and has no children. She could not go further than third grade in primary school, because her parents, who taught her at a very early age how to till the land, could not support her. She is a very experienced farmer when it comes to growing potatoes, broccolis, and cauliflower. Her sister is her only support. María works from 7 a.m. to 3 p.m. on the land. On week-ends, she sells her produce at the local market, either to direct consumers or to wholesalers who come to her area and sell the produce somewhere else. María's lands are one and a half kilometres away from her home, a distance she walks on foot every day. Today, she asks for a loan to buy fertiliser, manure, foliar concentrate, and certified seeds, in order to plant potatoes. Her hopes and dreams have to do with improving her home: it wants mortar, as well as something else than bricks for a floor. She also wants to keep investing in her crops in order to repay her loan and keep benefitting from the loans granted by field partner COMIXMUL and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser, manure, foliar concentrate, and certified seeds, in order to plant potatoes.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 28 años de edad, es una mujer responsable que vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de 5 años en la casa de sus padres.Elizabeth se dedica a la agricultura hace 10 años junto con su pareja en un terreno agrícola que le cedieron sus padres por ser la única mujer entre sus hermanos.Con el paso de los años y con las ganancias que fue obteniendo compró dos terrenos más en donde tiene plantaciones de cacao orgánico cuyas ganancias son el principal sustento de su familia.Su trabajo consisten en brindarle un cuidado adecuado a sus cultivos para que al finalizar la campaña logre vender los granos secos a los compradores del lugar quienes le otorgan el precio final de acuerdo a la calidad en que se encuentran, es por ello que fertiliza sus terrenos de cultivo con abono orgánico .Al dedicar mayor tiempo a su trabajo recibe la ayuda de su madre quien cuida de su pequeño hijo.Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para continuar con su trabajo.Desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para comprar abono orgánico y nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 28, is a responsible woman living with her husband and five-year-old son in her parents’ house.  Elizabeth and her spouse have been working in agriculture for the past ten years on a piece of land her parents passed down to her because she’s the only girl among her siblings.  As time’s passed and with profits she gradually earned she bought two more parcels of land where she’s growing organic cocoa beans; profit from them is her family’s main source of income.

Her work consists in providing adequate care for her crops so that at the end of the growing cycle she will succeed in selling the dry beans to local buyers who pay final prices according to the quality they find.  Because of this she fertilizes her farmland with organic manure.  Since she spends most of her time at work her mother helps her care for her little boy.  

This is her second Kiva loan and she feels very grateful for the financial support provided to continue with her work.  She hopes to get 2,000 new soles to buy organic manure to nourish her plants.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Benon

texts.en:
Benon is a 47-year-old farmer with six children, ages 18, 15, 12, 10, 08 and 04 years old.  He mainly grows bananas, maize, and beans for household and commercial purposes and has been doing since 2002. 

Benon requests a 500,000 loan to buy materials to complete his residential house.  He wants to complete this house so that the family can live in improved living conditions as opposed to his current condition.

His dream is to expand his farming to a commercial level so that he can have good returns from the business.  However his challenge is the changing seasonality in agriculture plus the fluctuation of the prices for produce on the market.  In the photo is Benon (right) with the Ugafode credit officer (left).

loans.use: to buy building materials for his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Edilberta

texts.es: Edilberta tiene 40 años de edad, es una mujer casada con Celedonio y tiene 7 hijos que viven en una casa de madera que compró gracias a su trabajo.Se dedica a cultivar distintas plantas propias de su región como son el cacao orgánico, café y otros en un terreno agrícola que compro cuando era joven con ayuda de su esposo esperando mantener económicamente a sus hijos.Esta labor lo realiza desde hace 18 años junto a su esposo y en más de una ocasión contrata a trabajadores del lugar para terminar las tareas de mantenimiento agrícola en menor tiempo beneficiando el crecimiento uniforme de todas sus plantaciones.Dentro de sus parcelas tiene más árboles de cacao porque es un producto con buena demanda en su zona y es posible recuperar su inversión con mejores ganancias adicionales.Su trabajo le permite apoyar económicamente a sus hijos porque puede mandarlos al colegio y cubrir los distintos gastos que le ocasionan, no obstante desea con el tiempo mejorar su vivienda construyéndola con material noble y esperando darles un mejor ambiente para vivir.Este es el segundo préstamo que recibe con KIVA y agradece el apoyo financiero que le brindan para continuar con su trabajo.Con los 1,000 soles comprará abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Edilberta is 40 years old and married to Celedonio.  The couple have seven children and live in a wooden house that they worked hard to buy.

Edilberta grows plants which are native to her region such as organic cacao, coffee, etc.  She grows them on a plot of farmland that she bought with the help of her husband when she was young so that she could financially support her children.  Edilberta has been farming with her husband for 18 years and, on more than one occasion, she has hired local workers to help finish off the farming tasks more quickly so that she can benefit from uniform growth on all her fields.  Edilberta has more cacao trees on her land than anything else because cacao is a product which is in good demand in her area and it is possible to recoup her investment with better additional profits.  Edilberta's work enables her to financially support her children so that she can send them to school and cover their other expenses.  However, she hopes over time that she will also be able to improve her home, building it from solid materials, so that she can give her family a better environment in which to live.

This is Edilberta's second loan from Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support that she is receiving as it helps her to continue in her work.  She will use the 1,000 soles she has requested to buy organic compost with which to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic compost

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina tiene  48 años de edad, esta casada con Augusto y tiene 6 hijos a quienes intenta dar una buena calidad de vida, toda la familia vive en una casa de adobe la cual compró con el fruto de su trabajo.Empezó cultivando diversos productos agropecuarios en otros terrenos agrícolas pero poco después y gracias a su labor compró una parcela en donde empezó a cultivar sus propios productos . Actualmente se dedica a la compra y venta de madera cuyo origen proviene de sus parcelas constantemente reforestadas y dedicadas netamente a la producción de árboles madereros como el cedro, caoba y tornillo.
Entre sus principales clientes están los negocios dedicados a la confección de muebles y personas que desean construir su vivienda a base de tablas.Periódicamente recibe capacitación conjuntamente con otros agricultores por parte de entidades dedicadas al cuidado del medio ambiente donde aprende algunos cuidados que debe tener para desempeñar su trabajo.Este es el cuarto préstamo con KIVA y se siente agradecida por al apoyo financiero que recibe para continuar con sus negocio.Con el monto solicitado de 3,000 nuevos soles comprará abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Faustina, 48, is married to Augusto and she has six children she tries to provide good quality of life for.  The entire family lives in an adobe house she bought with the fruits of her labor.  She started out growing various agricultural products on other farmland but gradually later on thanks to her work she was able to buy a parcel of land where she started to grow her own products.  She currently works buying and selling wood that originates on her land that’s constantly being reforested.    They are completely dedicated to producing hardwood trees like cedar, mahogany and 'tornillo' [screw bean].

Among her main customers are furniture making firms and people who want to build wood houses.  Periodically she and other farmers get training from entities dedicated to preserving the environment where she learns some of the care she needs to take in carrying out her work.

This will be her fourth Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support she’ll get to continue in business.  She will use the requested 3,000 new soles to buy organic manure to nourish her plants.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to order various clothing items for resale, as well as hand bags, shoes, and other fashion accessories.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, 23 years old, is a married man. He lives in a rented house in a poor area of Sana`a, Yemen. 

Ali is a soldier, getting a low salary which is not enough to cover expenses for himself and provide money for rent. He needs to make several improvements, but mainly he wants to buy a refrigerator and a washing machine. He doesn't have the necessary money, so he's requesting a youth loan of YER 100,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) to be able to buy the refrigerator and washing machine. 

Ali hopes to own a house, to avoid paying monthly rent.

loans.use: to be able to buy a refrigerator and a washing machine.

loans.name: Kalagala Abakyara Group

texts.en:
Lauben is a married man with eight children. Six of them attend school, and the last two are still too young to go to school. 

Lauben is an agriculturalist who concentrates on cattle-fattening to make a living for himself and his family. He started this business in 2000 because he had to cater to the growing needs of his large family. He started a small retail shop to supplement the already strained income. 

He will use the loan to buy more cattle that he will graze for a short period and then sell. His goal is to facilitate his children's education up to university. He is, however, affected by drought, which affects the productivity of the cattle. He is a hardworking man.

Lauben appears as the second from the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening.

loans.name: German

texts.es:
German tiene 37 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene cinco hijos. Tiene 17 años de trabajar en l agricultura; fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron. Antes solo se dedicaba a estudiar.  Para comprar los insumos tiene que viajar a la ciudad y tarda unas dos horas, debido a ello debe de levantarse muy temprano. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas, herbicidas y pago del rastreo de la tierra para cultivar 14,000 metros cuadrados de yute. Con la inversión, espera que la producción de yute sea muy buena y venderla a precio alto, para que los ingresos le ayuden a cubrir con los gastos de su hogar y para brindar la educación a sus cinco hijos.
texts.en:
