German, 37, has a spouse and five children.  He’s been working in agriculture for 17 years; his parents taught him.  He used to just be a student.  To buy supplies he must travel to the city and it takes him about two hours so because of that he must rise very early.

The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy manure, fertilizer, pesticide and herbicide as well as to pay labor costs to grow 14,000 square meters of jute.  With this investment he hopes the jute harvest will be very good and to sell it at a high price so that the income will help him cover household expenses and to be able to provide schooling for his five children.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Ani is from Yerevan and she lives with her mother and brother. Ani studies at Yerevan State University of Architecture and Construction and is in the third course of study.
Ani's mother and brother work at local supermarket as sellers but unfortunately the income they get is barely enough to cover the household costs and does not allow them to save for Ani's education. So Ani has applied for the loan to SEF International. With the loan's help she will pay for her university tuition and will be able to complete her education.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Elosy

texts.en:
Elosy lives in the Nkubu area of Kenya, situated along the slopes of Mt.Kenya. She has two children and has been doing farming for four years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops, transportation services, personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Selling farm produce' Her biggest challenge is 'Insufficient funds.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Gatune.'

Elosy was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Juhudi has farmer friendly products.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: trained on the importance of savings.

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Elosy replied 'Pay school fees.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Elosy owns the following: 'cow, poultry, motorcycle' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, solar power, running water, TV, DVD' but does not have 'electricity, sewing machine'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: To purchase dairy goats

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora lives with her mother in Yerevan. She is a student at Yerevan State University and is in the second course in the faculty of philology. Together with her studies, Flora works at one of the local companies. Her salary allows her to cover household costs, but is not enough to save for education. 

Flora is requesting a loan for 180,000 AMD, which she will use to pay for her tuition fee for the second semester.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition for the second semester.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en: Maria Elena has been engaged in her distilled water retailing business for more than 15 years. She is also involved in food sales. She is married and has five children. Maria Elena is asking for a loan to buy more gallons and containers for her purified water refilling and retailing business. With additional gallons, she will be able to refill it with purified water and sell it to the people in her place. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her business and augment her income.

loans.use: to buy more gallons for her water refilling business

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane lives in Yerevan with her mother, father and brother. She studies at Yerevan State University and is in the third course of study. The whole family works hard to sustain their living. Gayane's parents work at a candy booth in one of the city markets. The income they earn is barely enough for covering household costs and doesn't allow them to save money for Gayane's education.
That is why Gayane has applied to SEF International for a loan to pay for her university tuition. The loan is very important for Gayane to be able to complete her education and become a good specialist.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Maria Olimpia

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 12, 15 y 39 años, todos trabajan para obtener ingresos para el hogar. Ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas y comida, este oficio lo inicio hace 5 años en un ranchito y poco a poco ha ido incrementando sus ingresos y fortaleciendo el negocio.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar harina, quesillo, chicharron, maíz, arroz, frijoles, platos, vasos, entre otros productos para llevar a cabo su actividad; este le ayudara a tener la mercadería necesaria para brindarles un mejor servicio a los clientes y aumentar las ganancias.
Su sueño es tener su casa propia y ofrecerle una mayor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and children aged 12, 15 and 39 years; they all work to earn income for the home.  She works selling ‘pupusas’ [filled, grilled corn cakes] and food.  She started this occupation about five years ago in a little ranch and gradually has been able to increase her income and strengthen the business.

The loan she needs will allow her to buy flour, string cheese, fried pork, corn, rice, beans, dishes and glasses, among other products to carry out her activity.  This will help her have the necessary merchandise on hand to provide better customer service and increase profits.  Her dream is to own a house and to provide better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, plates, glasses, etc.

loans.name: St.bruno Development Group

texts.en:
Vicent is a member of St.bruno Development Group. He is a 44-year-old, married man who lives in Nnono Villages, a few kilometers from Mpigi town. He lives in his own home, together with his wife and six of his eight children. Vicent also has three orphans he takes care of, following the death of their father (Vicent's elder brother). The three children's mother abandoned them after the death of their late father. 

Vicent deals in agriculture, mainly maize growing and he seasonally trades in agricultural produce. He now wants a loan to hire labor to plough more fields and to use the balance to buy manure and improve on the farm's fertility, to increase his yields. 

He is looking forward to expanding his agricultural produce trade and to supplying bigger markets in the city.

loans.use: to hire labor to plough more fields and buy manure for his farm.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 35-year-old married woman living in a rental home with her family of seven members. Her husband is a driver and also works in the maintenance field.

Iman sells home products at home along with selling a few clothing items and makeup products. She does this to support her husband in paying the household bills and improving their living conditions. 

Now Iman is applying for a loan to increase the quantity of goods she has, and buy more home products and summer clothing items to increase her products.

loans.use: to buy more home products and summer clothing items.

loans.name: Arcelie

texts.en:
This happy and funny woman does not show on her face that she has difficulty in her life. Arcelie is 38 years old and single. She has one child attending school.  Arcelie started the business with a loading station for mobile phones for four years. Now Arcelie also manages a sari-sari store business in their village.
With the high demand for her clothing in their village, Arcelie is requesting a loan of P30,000 to buy beverages, biscuits and snack foods. She hopes to earn higher income to save for her own and her child's future .

loans.use: to buy beverages, biscuits and snack foods.

loans.name: Sorumuto Group

texts.en:
Delfina is one of the members of Sorumuto Group. She is taking the loan to add more to her own working capital in order to buy some additional supplies such as slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits to sell. 

Delfina is a hardworking woman. She started her business a year ago with her own working capital of $70.

loans.use: to buy slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is a 33 year old man who grows tomatoes and also does fish farming. He has five children, four of whom go to school. He also takes care of his aged parents.  He has applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 for buying fish nets and pesticides for the tomatoes. He sometimes has difficulty when he buys pesticides that are adulterated.  His previous loan was UGX 1,000,000.  He benefited from it and that is why he has asked for another loan. Henry started this business when he was barely 16 years old. He did not go far in his studies and so wishes that his children would complete their studies and go on up to university level.

loans.use: To buy fish nets and pesticides

loans.name: Leangsroy's Group

texts.en: Leangsroy is a local farmer who grows rice and soybean as her main source of income. She is widow and mother of two schoolchildren and two little kids residing in Kampong Cham province. This business, which she has been involved with for 14 years, has returned her about 24,500 KHR per day. For this cycle, she leads the first microloan group consisting of three female members. They are seeking for the same loan amount, 1,000,0000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy potash and to pay for transplanting fees. She highly hopes that she can boost her crop productivity on time and gain triple income so that she can save up some money to buy more pigs for raising as additional income.

loans.use: To buy potash and to pay for transplanting fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas, a 64-year-old woman from Campo 1, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, is a widow with two children. 

To earn a living, Felicitas runs a general store. She has been in her business for 13 years and earns 4,600 PHP (Philippines pesos) per month. 

Felicitas requests a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase canned goods, bottled products and noodles for sale. In 2008, Felecitas joined GDMPC to gain access to the microfinance services of the cooperative. 

She plans to save half from her revenue generated from the business as a reserve fund to be used in the future .

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, bottled products and noodles for sale.

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en: Kong, 28 years old and the mother of two children, is a villager from Kampong Cham province. She strives to pay the daily food expenses for the entire household via rice growing on one hectare of land and cassava farming on four hectares. She has been with this business for ten years, generating about 47,000 KHR per day. Never having been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before, Kong and her co-borrower in the same group are first-time borrowers. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR, whereas her joint member is applying for 200,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, to pay labor fees to clear the farmland, and to buy insecticide. She hopes this loan will help her to grow her crops timely and healthfully so that she can improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, to pay labor fees to clear the farmland, and to buy insecticide.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sem's Group

texts.en:
Sem is a 53-year-old mother of six children living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice on seven hectares of farmland for almost thirty-one years. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day. 

Sem has been with VisionFund for four cycles and has completely paid back the past loans while the other member has been with VisionFund for seven cycles. Sem has successfully used the loans to better support her family’s living condition from cycle to cycle. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Sem will use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to make a living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en: Pov is a 48-year-old mother of three dependent children from Sangke district in Battambang province. To deal with daily living costs, she grows corn while her husband works in a local organization. She has been in this current business for 14 years with a successful yield that has returned her about 18,700 KHR per day. Pov and her group members have been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for the past five cycles. After the successful past loan, which she has fully repaid, she feels confident that she can relieve her burden and keep her kids in school. Now, the total amount of her group loan is 4,200,000 KHR. As a group leader, she will spend her loan portion of 1,400,000 KHR in order to buy corn seed and to plow her farmland. She hopes to increase her income with this current business so she can expand her business progressively.

loans.use: To buy corn seed and to plow her farmland.

loans.name: Khaleda

texts.en: Khaleda is a 48 year-old conservative woman.  She asked her daughter to appear in the photo. She is a mother of five.  Her husband works abroad, which leaves her responsible for looking after their children.  She has a daughter, Faten, who appears in the photo and is a university student majoring in Managerial Information Systems. Khaleda is applying for an educational loan to pay for her daughter’s semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s semester fees.

loans.name: Huseynaga

texts.en:
Huseynaga is 51 years old. He lives in a small village with his wife and three children. He has been engaged in agricultural activities for 20 years. His primary income sources are milk, cheese, butter, yogurt and animal sales for meat purposes.  His biggest challenge is the stable.  There are no favorable conditions for animals. But he plans to build a new stable according to standard conditions. 

His children have grown to build their family and household. Huseynaga wants to help them in all their endeavors and supports them. His eldest son plans to get married.  For this reason he has applied for the loan to buy a plot of land for his son. Little by little, they will purchase building materials such as bricks, planks, cement, fiberglass and foam to build a house there.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land for his son.

loans.name: Gladys Yamilet

texts.es:
Doña Gladys tiene una edad de 31 años, casada y madre de 2 hijos los cuales están en la primaria en diferentes grados de educación. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completada la cual con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio por parte de sus padres pudo cursar. Ella en compañía de su esposo siembran y cultivan granos básicos como ser: maíz, frijol y en especial el café siendo este último producto al que más se dedican por su comercialización y facilidad de crecimiento debido a que la zona es apta y tiene un muy buen clima para producir. Sus clientes son los diferentes compradores que llegan a la zona para comprar y re-vender el producto en otros mercados. Las tierras que ella y su esposo cultivan son propias gracias al esfuerzo de muchos años la paciencia y el trabajo puesto por ellos para no trabajar la tierra de una forma alquilada.    

Actualmente ella necesita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abono, foliares, bombas de fumigación para dar un mejor mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café. 
 
Su meta es hacer de esta producción la mejor dando el mantenimiento necesario posible para poder aprovechar el producto final al 100%. Sus sueños es lograr que sus hijos tengan una mejor condición de vida, un mejor nivel de estudio para que se puedan superar y fortalecer en conocimiento y en la vida para poder desempeñarse bien en el ámbito social.
texts.en:
Gladys, 31, is married and mother of two children attending different grades in elementary school.  She completed elementary school thanks to much effort and sacrifice from her parents.  

She and her husband plant and grow basic grains like corn and beans and especially coffee.  This last product is the one they focus on the most because of its commercial value and the ease with which it grows because the zone is most apt for it and the weather is very good for it to produce.  Her customers are various buyers that come to the zone to buy and then resell the product in other markets.  The lands she and her husband cultivate are theirs thanks to the efforts of many years and the patience and the work they put into not having to work leased land.

She needs a loan to buy fertilizer, manure, leaf fertilizer and fumigation pumps to provide better coffee crop maintenance.  Her goal is to make this harvest the best by giving it the best possible necessary maintenance so that the final product can be 100% useful.  Her dreams are that her children attain better living conditions, a better educational level so they can improve and strengthen their knowledge so that they can behave well in society.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Hafeez

texts.en:
Ms. Hafeez is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband from the corner of her house. She has one year of experience in this field and makes enough to meet household expenses.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts for years. 

She is the mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 in order to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is in her second loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages

loans.name: Husam

texts.en: Husam is a 49 year-old governmental employee.  He is a father of six children who tries his best to offer them a better life. For that he opened a small cafeteria where he serves hot drinks. Now Husam is applying for another loan to start making sandwiches to sell along with serving hot and cold drinks to increase his revenue.  Now he wants to get the basic ingredients and a few sandwich-making tools using the loan.

loans.use: to get the basic ingredients for making sandwiches and a few sandwich making tools

loans.name: Elena Aurora

texts.es: Doña Elena de 53 años de edad, es una mujer responsable y muy trabajadora, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, tiene un minisuper cerca de su lugar de residencia y tambien elabora: Cuajada y queso fresco desde hace 3 años, tiene mucha clientela pues sus productos son de muy buena calidad y los da a precios accesibles. Doña Elena solicita un credito para la compra de materia prima para elaborar el queso fresco y la cuajada y tambien para comprar productos para su minisuper como: golosinas, refrescos, granos basicos, etc. y asi poder obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Elena, 53, is a responsible and very hardworking woman. She lives in her own house with her husband and her three children. She has a convenience store close to her home, and she has also been making cheese curd and soft cheese for three years. She has a large clientele because her products are of very good quality and she offers accessible prices. 

Elena has applied for a loan to buy ingredients to make soft cheese and cheese curd. She will also buy products for her convenience store, such as candy, soft drinks, basic grains, etc. She will then be able to earn a better income to give her family greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, oil, soft drinks, and candy for her convenience store and milk to make soft cheese and cheese curd

loans.name: Muneera

texts.en: Ms. Muneera is a 24 year-old lady who enjoys doing hand embroidery. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her territory and she has attained a regular list of customers. She has four children and her husband is not in a good physical shape to support her family alone so she is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life including food, clothes and education. In order to meet the growing demand of embroidery she requested a loan of Rs.30,000 from Kiva partner the Kashf foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more frames, needles and threads in different colors which will help in generating more income. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy more frames, needles and threads in different colors.

loans.name: Fayza

texts.en:
Fayza is a 44-year-old conservative woman, so she asked her husband to take her place in the photo. 

Fayza is a mother to six sons and daughters. She helps her husband in his farming business. They have a few greenhouses and plant nurseries that they want to increase, so Fayza applied for a loan to build new greenhouses and plant more types of vegetables for next season.

loans.use: to build new greenhouses and plant more types of vegetables for next season.

loans.name: Maria Deonila

texts.es: Doña maria es una persona muy trabajadora, quien se dedica de lleno a su negocio, todo con el único deseo de salir adelante y de esta manera brindarle una vida mejor a su familia. María vive junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una venta de frutas y verduras, la cual esta ubicada en el mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace 23 años, su esposo le ayuda con el negocio. María solicita un préstamo para poder comprar papas, cebollas, ejotes, sandias, piñas, guineos, etc. ya que de esta manera ella podrá vender más, lo cual es su prioridad, ya que de esta manera podrá darles una vida mejor a su familia
texts.en:
María’s a very hardworking person who is fully committed to her business; her only wish is to get ahead and provide a better life for her family this way.  

María lives with her husband and three children in her own house.  She has been selling fruit and vegetables in a market near her place of residence for the last 23 years; her husband helps her with the business.

María is asking for a loan to be able to buy potatoes, onions, green beans, watermelons, pineapples, bananas, etc. because she’ll be able to sell more this way and this is her priority because this is how she’ll be able to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Jaime Alberto

texts.es:
Jaime,  se le presenta la necesidad de invertir más en el negocio de venta de lácteos y venta de comida; este le permitirá comprar por mayoreo queso, crema, cuajada, pollo, frijoles, arroz, carnes, condimentos, entre otros para la elaboración de la comida.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus ingresos y aumentar sus inventarios; esto le facilito fortalecer su negocio, sus condiciones económicas han mejorado y las circunstancias familiares asimismo.
texts.en:
Jaime needs to invest more in his business selling food and dairy products.  This loan will permit him to buy items at wholesale, such as cheese, cream, curd, chicken, beans, rice, meats and condiments.  He uses these ingredients in the preparation of his food items.

His previous loan helped him to expand his inventory and increase his sales.  This enabled him to fortify his business, and his family's financial situation has improved.

loans.use: to buy cheese, cream, curd, chicken, beans, rice, meats, condiments and other items.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: Don Guadalupe de 56 año  de edad vive con su esposa en casa propia, se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola, el comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable, adicional a su trabajo en el campo también en su vivienda posee una pequeña tienda que le da ganancias extras para el mantenimiento del hogar; don Guadalupe  es un hombre dedicado  a su labor,  necesita invertir en insumos pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla, abono, insecticida, herramienta, etc.  para tener una mejor cosecha y asi obtener más ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Mr. Guadalupe is 56 years old and lives with his wife in their own house. He works in agriculture, specifically growing corn. He has been working in this field for many years and has gained very valuable experience that helps him to have the best harvests. His plot of land is located in the agricultural area. Mr. Guadalupe sells in all the bordering areas and already has many steady customers. These people always prefer his product because of the quality and affordable prices, as well as the unbeatable service. In addition to his work in the countryside, he also has a small store in his home that gives him extra earnings to maintain his home. Mr. Guadalupe is a man who is very dedicated to his work. He needs to invest in supplies, but he needs money. For this reason, he is applying with INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow him to buy seeds, manure, insecticide, tools, etc. to have a better harvest and be able to earn more and improve his family’s economic stability.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, insecticide, tools, etc.

loans.name: María Lucelly

texts.es:
María es madre cabeza de familia de cuatro hijos. Laboró por más de treinta años en una casa de familia como empleada doméstica. Hoy a sus 55 años, agradece a la familia que la acogió y le brindó la oportunidad de laborar y generar los ingresos para el sostenimiento de sus hijos. En la actualidad desea emprender su plan de negocios, con el fin de crear empresa y trabajar como independiente en el sector de la confección. Razón que la ha motivado a solicitar un crédito que invertirá en asesoría para la creación de su  negocio. Desea adquirir conocimientos en administración y tiempos de producción.
Sueña con mejorar su calidad de vida y convertirse en una gran empresaria.
texts.en:
María is the mother and head of a family of four children.  She has worked for more than thirty years in a home as a housemaid.  Today, she is fifty-five years old.  She is thankful to the family that took her in and offered her the opportunity to work and make an income to provide for her children.  

Presently, she wishes to start her business plan, with the final goal of creating a business and working independently in sewing.  This is what has motivated her to request a loan.  She will invest in consulting services for the creation of her business.  She hopes to acquire knowledge in administration and in production times.

She dreams of improving her quality of life and in making herself into a great businesswoman.

loans.use: to pay for consulting services for the creation of her business.

loans.name: Musaab

texts.en: Musaab is a 20 year-old unmarried man.  He has four brothers.  Musaab is an economics student at a government university in the north of Jordan. He is applying for an education loan to pay for his next semester's tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester fees.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Ms. Naseem had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. Two years ago she began stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to the lack of available funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She is a mother of five children and needs to provide them with good quality food, health and education. She is currently in her 5th loan cycle and applied for a loan of Rs 30,000 from Kiva partner the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy spools of thread, zippers and buttons in different colors to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads, zippers and buttons in different colors.

loans.name: Rashed

texts.en: Rashed is a 20 year-old unmarried man. He is a brother of four siblings. Rashed is a university student majoring in Law Studies. He is applying for a loan to pay for his next semester tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester fees.

loans.name: Emigdio

texts.es: Emigdio de 47 años de edad, casado, tiene dos hijos, los cuales ya son mayores de edad y viven independientemente. Don Emigdio es una persona  muy querida y respetada en el lugar donde vive, por lo dedicado a su trabajo, hay días que tiene que trabajar en jornal en la agricultura para ganar algunos pesos demás y así llevar el pan de cada día a su casa. Don Emigdio trabaja solo, ya que sus hijos se olvidaron  de sus padres desde el momento que salieron de su casa y decidieron trabajar en otro rubro y lejos de su comunidad sin recibir ninguna ayuda económica de parte de ellos, Don Emigdio por no dejar sus tierras hace todo el sacrificio para seguir cultivando y viviendo de lo que más le gusta hacer que es la producción agrícola, por lo que está solicitando el crédito para comprar semillas, abono químico,  productos agroquímicos y de esta forma poder mejorar su producción. Trabaja en su pequeña parcela que tiene en el lugar donde vive, el espera  mejorar sus ingresos económicos y  darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Emigdio, 47, is married and has two children who are adults living independently.  Emigdio is very well-loved and respected where he lives because of his dedication to work.  There are days when he must work as an agricultural laborer to earn a few more pesos to bring daily bread home.

Emigdio works alone since his children have forgotten about their parents from the moment they decided to leave home and work in other lines of work far from their community; he gets no economic help from them.

So as not to neglect his land, Emigdio sacrifices whatever he must to keep cultivating it and living from what he most likes to do which is agricultural production.  This is why he’s asking for a loan to buy seeds, chemical fertilizer and other farm supplies to improve production.  He works on his small parcel of land where he lives and hopes to improve his income and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es: La Sra. Honorata viven en la comunidad de Colomi, tiene 43 años de edad, de estado civil soltera con dos hijos, un pequeño y otro que estudia, económicamente es independiente, se dedica a la agricultura siembra en terreno de 2 Has herencia de sus padres produce papa y papaliza con rotación de cultivos con experiencia en el rubro, además cuenta con cabezas de ganado 2 lecheros y 1 torillo. La Sra. Honorata requiere el crédito para la compra de una cabeza de ganado vacuno lechero y compra de abono orgánico,  por este motivo se apersono a solicitar un préstamo. Por último la Sra. Honorata se sintió contenta al tener la oportunidad de acceder al crédito, además de poder contar con la ayuda de la institución.
texts.en:
Honorata lives in the community of Colomi; she’s 43-years-old, single and has two children, a little one and another attending school.  She’s economically independent.  She works in agriculture growing on a two hectare plot of land she inherited from her parents; she grows various species of potatoes rotating her crops.  She has experience in this line of work and also owns two heads of cattle: two cows and one bullock.  

Honorata needs the loan to buy another dairy cow and to buy organic manure.  Because of this she appeared to request a loan.  Lastly, Honorata felt happy at having the opportunity of accessing credit as well as being able to count on help from the institution.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gualberto

texts.es: Gualberto y su esposa viven en la comunidad de Colomi tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil convivientes por más de cinco años tienen un hijo pequeño que estudia, económicamente son independientes, se dedican a la agricultura siembran en terreno de 1,5 Has herencia de sus padres produce papa y papaliza con rotación de cultivos con experiencia en el rubro además cuenta con 4 cabezas de ganado 3 lecheros y 1 ternero. El Sr Gualberto necesita concluir su vivienda, por este motivo se apersonaron a solicitar un préstamo  poder terminar la obra fina de su vivienda ya que el ahorro que tenia lo invirtió en insumos para agricultura y la construcción de vivienda.                                                                                                       Por último el Sr. Gualberto y Sra. se sintieron contentos al tener la oportunidad de acceder al crédito, además de poder contar con la ayuda de la institución para poder concluir la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Gualberto and his wife live in the community of Colomi; he’s 25-years-old and has lived with his spouse for more than five years.  They have a little boy who attends school.  They are independent economically.  They work in agriculture planting a 1.5 hectare parcel of land inherited from his parents.  He produces potato and ‘papaliza’ [a tuber] rotating his crops; he has experience in this line of work.  He also owns four head of cattle: three dairy cows and one calf.

Gualberto needs to finish building his house which is why he came to request a loan to finish the finishing touches on his house since he used the savings he had to buy farm supplies and for his house’s construction.

Lastly, Gualberto and his wife felt happy to have the opportunity of accessing credit and also to be able to count on support from the institution in order to be able to finish building their house.

loans.use: to build his house.

loans.name: Ingrit Abigail

texts.es: La señora Ingrit es una joven mamá que por la responsabilidad y el cariño a su pequeño niño, genera sus ingresos por medio de las ventas de perfumes, cosméticos, y productos en general, sus clientes, amigos, familiares y personas a quienes deja sus catálogos para que le compren desde labiales hasta bisutería costosa. Actualmente vive en la casa de unos familiares, que al verla sola con su niño, le dieron vivienda y cobijo, sin embargo para los gastos y necesidades ella dedica su tiempo a trabajar de esta manera. Necesita del crédito para poder comprar mercadería y abastecer su negocio, así puede llevar directamente los productos a los diferentes lugares a los que va, y realizar ventas directas, lo que para ella significaría un rote más rápido de su capital de operación. La señora Ingrit cuenta que generalmente el día del  padre, el día de la madre y la navidad son fechas que tiene mayor venta, por lo general realiza sus ventas a crédito y necesita luego su capital de operación para comprar nueva mercadería de los nuevos catálogos que le encargan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ingrit’s a young mother who generates her own income selling perfume, cosmetics and products in general to her customers, friends, family members and people because of the responsibility and love she has for her little boy.  She shows them catalogs so they can buy from lipstick to expensive costume jewelry from her.

She currently lives in family members’ house who when they saw her alone with her child provided a roof and shelter for her.  However, she works this way to cover her own expenses and needs.

She needs the loan to be able to buy merchandise to stock her business so she can take the products directly to the various places she goes to and do direct sales.  For her, this means a quicker turn-over of her working capital.  She relates that generally Father’s Day, Mother’s Day and Christmas are the days of highest sales.  She usually sells on credit so needs working capital to buy new merchandise from the new catalogs that her customers order from.

loans.use: to buy perfume and cosmetics.

loans.name: Einar

texts.es: El señor Einar tiene  28 años, es soltero, Trabaja como consultor, trabaja 6 meses durante el año, también se dedica a la producción agrícola y pecuaria en sus terrenos que tiene en la comunidad de Capilla vieja distante a 15 km. de la ciudad de Monteagudo. Es por eso que él está solicitando crédito para el encerrado de terreno y realizar más divisiones con pasto para su ganado vacuno, ya que él tiene que pagar mensualmente al personal fijo que tiene por el cuidado de los animales y también por el cultivo del maíz. Se traslada hasta su parcela en su tiempo libre que tiene y fines de semana  a ver los animales y producción. Su mayor sueño de él es obtener más ingresos y poder tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Einar is 28 years old, single, and works six months a year as a consultant. He also engages in agricultural and livestock production on the piece of land that he has in the community of Capilla Vieja, 15 km away from the city of Monteagudo. He is applying for a loan so that he can delimit his land and divide it into pastures for his cattle, since he has to pay a monthly salary to the employees that he has hired for taking care of the animals and also for the cultivation of corn. 

In his spare time and on weekends he visits his property to check on the animals and the production. His biggest dream is to increase his profits in order to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to put up fences on his property

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en:
Ms. Nazeeran is a 43-year-old married lady and has ben running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Nazeeran makes enough to provide for her family.

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan for 20,000 PKR which she will use to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Nazeeran wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates

loans.name: Allha -Rakhi

texts.en:
Ms. Allha-Rakh is a 44-year-old active, married woman. She has been effectively doing a business of embroidery at her home for the last 5 years. Her embroidery patterns are very famous in her town. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from the people of her community and makes enough to lead a decent life while her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet everyday expenditures of the household.   She is a loving mother of six children and is in charge of providing her family with good food, health and education.

She has slowly but surely improved her business by taking loans from the Kashf Foundation. Now she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase a stock of threads with packs of sequins, glitters and pearls in different colors to complete customers' orders on time. She expects more profits and desires to spend part of the income on providing good and quality education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of threads with packs of sequins, glitters and pearls in different colors

loans.name: Sugharan

texts.en:
Ms. Sugharan is a 54-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. She is motivated to provide all the facilities of life to her family. The man shown in the photo is Sugharan's son.

She is successfully running a small general store with her son who assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and make enough to meet the expenses of the family members.

Currently, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a stock of rice, flour and grains to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting  a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her 4th loan cycle and has shown good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, flour and grains to meet the increasing demand at her store

loans.name: Sainte Bernadette Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SAINTE BERNADETTE est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Médédjigbé Honorine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Médédjigbé Honorine est âgée de 59 ans. Médédjigbé Honorine a fréquenté l’école jusqu'au niveau secondaire. Médédjigbé Honorine est mariée à un certain Nobert. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés. Médédjigbé Honorine vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges familiales. Pour ce faire, Médédjigbé Honorine vend des boissons et divers articles à son domicile depuis vingt cinq ans. Médédjigbé Honorine s’approvisionne dans un un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Médédjigbé Honorine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SAINTE BERNADETTE, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The Sainte Bernadette group is made up of 3 people who live in the same area. The group's representative, Médédjigbé Honorine, is the one with her hand raised in the picture. Médédjigbé Honorine is 59 years old and attended school until the secondary level. Médédjigbé Honorine is married to Nobert. The couple have 2 children who both go to school. Médédjigbé Honorine lives with her husband and their children. The couple both take care of the household expenses. In order to do this, Médédjigbé Honorine has been selling drinks and various other items from her home for 25 years. Médédjigbé Honorine gets her supplies at a market in Benin. In order to satisfy her clientèle and increase her sales and revenue, Médédjigbé Honorine is requesting, together with the other members of the Sainte Bernadette group, a 2nd loan from ALIDé. The previous loan has been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy drinks and various other items.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Ms. Shehnaz is a 51-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has gained one year of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health.

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy stock of grains, biscuits and packs of cleaning products such as soaps and detergents. It would help her to cater to more customers time after time without fail. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock of grains, biscuits and packs of cleaning products such as soaps and detergents

loans.name: Alode'go Group

texts.fr: Le groupement ALODE'GO est composé de dix neuf (19) personnes qui habitent le même village et font des tontines ensemble. C'est la première fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Henriette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Henriette est âgée de 41 ans et vit au Bénin. Henriette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Henriette est mariée à un certain Pierre. Le couple a six enfants dont certains scolarisés et quatre à leur charge. Henriette vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Henriette et son mari assurent ensemble les charges de ménages. Pour ce faire, Henriette vend de la bouillie de maïs et des beignets à base de farine de blé depuis dix huit ans dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Henriette vend des boules d’akassa (pâte faite à base de l’amidon de manioc). Henriette s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Henriette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement ALODE'GO, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Alode'go group is made up of nineteen people who live in the same village and belong to the same mutual funds group. This is the first time that this group is seeking financial support from ALIDé, in order to increase their business levels. The group's representative, Henriette, is the one with her hand raised in the picture. Henriette is 41 years old and lives in Benin. She did not go to school. Henriette is married to Pierre. The couple have 6 children, some of whom are going to school and 4 of whom they are raising. Henriette lives with her husband and children. Henriette and her husband both take care of the household expenses. In order to be able to do this, Henriette has been selling maize porridge and wheat flour-based doughnuts in her area for 18 years. As a sideline business, Henriette also sells balls of akassa (a paste made from cassava starch). Henriette gets her supplies in a region of Benin. With a view to satisfying her customers and increasing her sales and revenue, Henriette is requesting, together with the other members of the Alode'go group, a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy maize and wheat flour.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Ms. Rukhsana is a married woman and has been doing a business of carpet manufacturing for the past 30 years with the support of her husband. She offers handmade carpets in various designs and has become famous by providing good quality products in her circle. She is happily doing her business for the sake of her family. She is the mother of three and is trying hard to fulfill their demands including food, health, clothing and education. She is also doing sewing as her part time job. In this way she is able to handle her family's needs and requirements effectively.

It’s her fifth year with Kashf Foundation and she is satisfied with the support from it. Currently she applied for a loan of 35,000 PKR to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales and hence better support her family.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales

loans.name: Simuzar

texts.en:
Simuzar is 43 years old, married, and has three children: 19-year-old and 16-year-old sons and a 6-year-old daughter. Her daughter and sons go to school. She wants her daughter to become a painting instructor. Simuzar is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. Now she lives in the Fuzuli region, which is close to the occupied border, with her husband and children. She started her business selling bedding (bedsheets, coverlets, towels etc.) 1 year ago.

Now Simuzar needs a 2,000 AZN loan to buy stock. She wants to use the money from her expanded business to help her family. In the future, Simuzar wants to expand the area of her shop. This will be more profitable for her business. She is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting her.

loans.use: to buy bedsheets, coverlets, towels etc.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Ms. Nusrat is a 48-year-old married lady. She has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Nusrat makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked, Nusrat requested a loan of Rs 50,000, which she will use to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her sixth loan cycle and wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Batdorj

texts.en:
Mr. Batdorj, 26 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Currently, his family is residing in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. He has a position of driver at a private business entity. His wife has been working at a pharmacy since 2005 as prescription writer. 

The house they previously lived in has deteriorated over the years and it needs some serious repair, so he is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT (Kongolian tugriks) to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, planks, fiberglass and foam. Using these materials, he can repair and insulate his house completely and make it back to its original state. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, emit less smoke and then contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Asiimwe

texts.en:
Asiimwe is aged 50 years old. He is married with five children, aged 26, 24, 22, 20 and 18 years, respectively. Three of the children attend school, and he is the one in charge of paying their tuition.

He is a farmer involved in the growing of tobacco, a business he has been doing since 1983 as a major income-generating source for the family. He also grows maize, bananas and coffee, but on a small scale as an additional source of income.

Asiimwe wants a loan of 1,100,000 shillings to pay school fees for his children; two are at technical institutes and one is in secondary school. The harvest time is still a moth away, which is the reason he is applying for the loan.

His dream is to see the children complete their education and maybe look after him when he can no longer work.

Asiimwe is always challenged by the seasonality of agricultural production and the price fluctuations on the market.

loans.use: To pay tuition for three of his children.

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 67 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene seis hijos. Desde muy pequeña se ha dedicado a trabajar junto a sus padres y hermanos en la agricultura y en los cafetales peinando café. A los 18 años de edad se acompaño y empezó a ayudar a su compañero de vida en trabajos agrícolas y en los cafetales junto a sus hijos.  Los insumos agrícolas los adquiere en una ciudad que esta a 6 kilómetros de su casa; viaja en autobús con los insumos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar pollos de engorde y concentrado para los mismos. Con el préstamo empezara a instalar la granja de polos de engorde y así mejorara la calidad de vida de sus hijos. Su propósito, es continuar trabajando muy fuerte para ampliar la granja.
texts.en:
Rosa is 67 years old, in a relationship, and has six children. At a very young age, she decided to begin farming with her parents and siblings, as well as work in the coffee plantations. Rosa entered into a relationship at the age of 18 and began helping her partner with the farm work. She later worked in the coffee fields with her children. Rosa acquires her farming supplies in a city that is located six kilometers from her house. She must travel by bus to obtain these supplies.

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo will be used to buy chickens for fattening and concentrated feed. The loan will enable her to start a poultry farm so that she can improve her children’s quality of life. Her plans include continuing to work hard so that she can expand her farm.

loans.use: to buy chickens for fattening and concentrated poultry feed.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is 51 years old. She lives in the small village of Baghdati District with her husband, three children and a daughter-in-law. Tina requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business startup, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Tina’s son works as a local artisan and gets a small monthly income. Besides that, they are involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a pig, three milking cows and a vineyard. They sell the harvested grapes and dairy products at local markets. It is hardly enough on food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Tina requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Tina has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The startup loan program envisages provision of business startup and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Tina will build a greenhouse. After the greenhouse is built, she will be able to sow vegetables and sell the harvested vegetables. This will increase the income of their family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva startup loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse and sow vegetables.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
In 2011, Michelle left her hometown of Miami when the opportunity to acquire a franchise of Healthy Living magazine in Austin presented itself. Her chance to pursue her dream of improving the physical, mental, emotional, and spiritual essence of readers was just a plane ride away.

As a devoted Healthy Living magazine reader for the past ten years, Michelle understood the importance of health and wellness. After purchasing the franchise publication, she soon discovered the magazine franchise wasn’t doing too well, but her drive and persistence kept her moving forward.

After hearing of Accion Texas Inc., Michelle applied and was approved for a loan she is using to focus on expanding the publication’s distribution, page count, and sales team. She has seen an increase in sales and is ready for the growth of the business.  

“It may be a long path, but it is worth it,” Michelle said. “What I did was a leap of faith. I lived in Miami my whole life, but I wanted to do something that made a difference. I moved myself a thousand miles to a town I did not know and took over a franchise magazine. My motto is do one thing every day that scares you. The journey may not be easy, but it will give you more strength and courage.”

loans.use: to expand the publication’s distribution, page count, and sales team.

loans.name: Ervin

texts.en:
Ervin started his own janitorial company, ENJ Enterprise, as a side business 10 years ago.  He prides himself in doing top quality work for his customers at a competitive price.  Although he still has a full-time job, Ervin is looking to increase his business’s customer base so that he can be one step closer to financial independence.

Ervin was recently awarded a new contract with Fort Sam Houston in San Antonio.  While thrilled at the new business opportunity, he was concerned about the large financial strain his business would experience during the first month of taking on the new contract.  As he explored his options to resolve this concern, Ervin came across the Accion Texas Inc. website and applied for a loan.

With the funds he receives from the loan, Ervin will be able to cover payroll expenses for his employees until he receives the first payment from his new customer.  This is an important and large contract that Ervin would not have been able to take on without a boost to his working capital.  He is hopeful that this will help propel his company to the next level as he works toward his ultimate goal of full-time business operations.

loans.use: to cover payroll expenses

loans.name: La Cabañita Group

texts.es: Alejandra tiene 41 años de edad, ella pertenece a un grupo llamado La Cabañita y dice que una prima fue que la invito a formar parte del grupo el cual trabaja con Visión Fund pidiendo créditos para mejorar su negocio y con las ganancias mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Ella es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, Ale como de cariño le dicen se dedica a la venta de colchas, zapatos, ropa para dama y caballero por catalogo, dice que emprendió este trabajo para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que tiene 4 hijos y no podía salir a trabajar fueras ya que con ella vive su abuelita a la cual cuida porque está enferma y tiene que estar al pendiente de ella, dice que por eso decidió poner su propio negocio para estar más al pendiente de su casa, ella por la mañanas prepara a sus hijos para ir a la escuela y después hace el desayuno para su abuelita y para ella ya  que su esposo sale a muy temprana hora a trabajar, hace su aseo y se va a vender de casa en casa su ropa, colchas que vende y hay veces que ya sus clientas la van a buscar hasta su casa para encargarle algo. Dice que sus artículos que vende los surte en tiendas autorizadas en la población de Zitacuaro para que le den mejores precios. Ahorita ella está pidiendo el crédito para surtir algunos pedidos que tiene pendiente por parte de sus clientas, comenta que en este mes es cuando tiene más ventas ya que hay varios festejos del día de la madre, del día del maestro, el día del estudiante, las clausuras de las escuelas y la gente aprovecha para hacer regalos y van a ella y le compran zapatos o ropa, es por eso que ahorita ella quiere tener muy bien surtido. Alejandra agradece a VisionFund por la confianza que le han tenido y hacerle créditos para mejorar su negocio y así poder apoyar a su esposo, a sus hijos y a su abuelita. Las demás integrantes del grupo se llaman Consuelo, Florentina, Esperanza, Tomasa, Blanca Estela, Maricela, Martha, Liliana, Reynalda y Sofía ellas invertirán en sus negocios de taller de serigrafía, en la compra de artículos para tienda de abarrotes, en la compra de insumos para elaborar antojitos mexicanos, para la compra de insumos para elaborar pan, para la compra de material para elaborar joyería fina y bisutería, en la compra de refacciones para arreglo de vehículos, para la compra de alimento para gallinas para engorda y después venderlas.
texts.en:
Alejandra, 41, belongs to a group called “La Cabañita” (The Little Cottage) and says that her cousin invited her to join the group that works with Visión Fund asking for loans to improve their businesses aiming at improving their families’ quality of life.  She’s a very hardworking, cheerful woman.  

Ale, as she’s affectionately called, sells bedspreads, shoes and clothes for women and men by catalog.  She says she started this business to help her husband with household expenses since she has four children and was unable to work outside the home because her grandmother also lives with her and she’s not well and she must take care of her.  She says that’s why she decided to start her own business so she could stay and care for her home.  

She gets her children ready for school in the morning and then makes breakfast for her grandmother and for her since her husband leaves for work very early in the morning.  She does her cleaning chores and then heads out to sell bedspreads house to house; sometimes her customers come to her house looking for her to order something or other.  

She says that she gets the things she sells from authorized suppliers in the city of Zitácuaro so she can get better prices.  At the moment, she’s asking for a loan to fill some pending customer orders.  She comments that this is the month when sales are highest because of Mother’s Day, Teacher’s Day, Student’s Day and the end of the school term; people take advantage of this to give gifts and they come to her to buy shoes and clothes.  This is why she wants to be well-stocked right now.  Alejandra thanks VisionFund for the trust they’ve placed in her and for giving her loans to improve her business thus helping her husband, children and grandmother.  

The other group members are named Consuelo, Florentina, Esperanza, Tomasa, Blanca Estela, Maricela, Martha, Liliana, Reynalda and Sofía.  They will invest in their businesses which are: silkscreen shop, grocery store, Mexican fast-food snacks, bread baking, fine and costume jewelry making, vehicle repair shop and feed for fattening up chickens for subsequent sale.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads, shoes and clothes by catalog.

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en:
Ms. Ishrat is a 41-year-old widow; she has been doing a business of selling vegetables for the past two years. She is very enthusiastic in her business of selling vegetables and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support her family. She is a loving mother of three daughters and is trying hard to fulfill their basic necessities through her business. 

For the improvement of her business, Ishrat contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase sacks of vegetables such as onions, potatoes and ginger. This will help her to meet market demands consistently. 

Ishrat dreams to provide a quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables such as onions, potatoes and ginger.

loans.name: Wilmer Kevin

texts.es:
Wilmer es un hombre de 21 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Wlimer se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Medicina Humana, el está cursando el segundo ciclo de su carrera y es un buen estudiando, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Lomo Saltado para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Wilmer trabaja como camarero en un restaurante de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su rapidez y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Wilmer se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de su uniforme de laboratorio e implementos como un estetoscopio, guantes, jeringas y otros, de esta manera Wilmer podrá contar con los materiales necesarios para cursar adecuadamente sus estudios, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser un gran doctor.
texts.en:
Wilmer is a 21-year-old man. He is single and lives in the city of Ica with his parents and brothers. He is a very kind, hard-working and enthusiastic person and has a great desire to succeed. Thanks to his hard work and the support of his parents, Wilmer is studying medicine. He is in the second phase of his studies. He is a good student. In his free time, he likes to watch movies. From time to time, he cooks a delicious lomo saltado [strips of marinated sirloin and stirfried with vegetables] to share with his family.
Wilmer decided on his own to work as a waiter in a restaurant in the city. He works with great dedication and determination. He works every day for about eight hours and says that it is going well for him because he is fast and treats people well.
Wilmer is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to your help he will be able to buy his lab coat and supplies such as a stethoscope, gloves, and syringes. This way, Wilmer will have the necessary supplies for passing his studies. He will continue to work hard in order to achieve his dream of being a great doctor.

loans.use: to buy a lab coat and medical supplies.

loans.name: Saeeda

texts.en:
Ms. Saeeda is a 52-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. The man shown in the photo is Saeeda’s husband. They have gained 25 years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing a stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts for years. 

Saeeda is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. 

She is in her fifth loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: José Carlos

texts.es:
José tiene 62 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene una hija. Desde la edad de los 16 años se ha dedicado a trabajar en la agricultura; actividad que aprendió de sus abuelos. Antes solo se dedicaba a estudiar. Para comprar los insumos agrícolas debe desplazarse aproximadamente a dos horas de su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas, herbicidas, semilla de maicillo y maíz, pago de alquiler de la tierra y pago de mano de obra para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados. Al cultivar maíz, asegurara el alimento para su familia y con la siembra del maicillo alimentara sus vacas para que produzcan leche y se engorden para venderlas. Su sueño es brindarle el estudio a su hija para que sea una profesional.
texts.en:
José, 62, is in a relationship and has a daughter. He has worked in agriculture since he was 16, which he learned from his grandparents. Before that he studied. 

He needs to travel approximately two hours from his house to buy agricultural supplies. 

The loan from Fundación Campo will buy fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides, sorghum and corn seed, it will pay for the rent of the land and pay for the labor to cultivate the 7,000 square meters. 

By cultivating corn he ensures there will be food for his family. He will feed his cows the sorghum to produce milk and fatten them up to sell them. 

His dream is to give his daughter an education to be a professional.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides, sorghum and corn seed, it will pay for the rent of the land and pay for the labor to cultivate the 7,000 square meters.

loans.name: Manzoora

texts.en: Ms. Manzoora is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. For the past 20 years, she has been running a business of milk sales. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner at that point in time. With the passage of time, her sales and income increased. Now she has two buffaloes. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her son to college for further studies. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000 in order to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is in her second loan cycle with Kiva partner Kashf Foundation and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Roselina

texts.es:
Roselina es una mujer luchadora, emprendedora y joven de 23 años casada con un grado de educación de primaria completado cursado hasta el 6 grado por lo cual agradase el esfuerzo a sus padres por el apoyo brindado. Junto a su esposo tienen 2 hijos de los cuales el mayor está en el kínder y el último de 2 años. Fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron la elaboración de viveros y a cultivar café desde muy pequeña ya que ha sido y será medio de ingreso para su familia y hoy en día en su hogar. Su único apoyo es su esposo el cual se encarga de los negocios y de la distribución siendo ella la administradora. Ella también tiene un vivero de café el cual lo está empezando a preparar para su cultivo y otra parte para la venta. Su producto es comercializado con los intermediarios que llegan a la zona y que la caracterizan su producto como un producto de calidad e higiénico.
 
Hoy en día solicita ayuda para poder comprar fertilizantes, abono, plaguicidas para poder darle mantenimiento al cultivo de café y poder fortalecer su vivero que hoy en día tiene en proceso de crecimiento.

Sus planes a futuro es tener una amplia plantación de café la cual pueda seguirles dando bendiciones, sustento familiar y pueda ser trabajada de generación en generación y mantener sanas sus cosechas ya que es el único medio de ingreso para su familia y poder cubrir los estudios de sus hijos como hasta hoy en día.
texts.en:
Roselina is a young, resourceful and tenacious woman aged 23. She is married, and she has studied up to the 6th grade of primary school, thanks to the sacrificed made by her parents, to whom she deeply grateful. She and her husband have two children: the eldest attends kindergarten and the youngest is 2. Her parents have taught her how to make a plant nursery and grow coffee when she was very young, and this has been and will be her family’s source of income as well as her household’s. She can count on her husband’s support only: he takes care of the chores and coordinates the distribution process, while she manages the activity. She also owns a coffee vivarium, and she preparing part of it to be sowed and part of it to be sold. She sells her products to wholesalers coming to her community, who consider her products as hygienic and of good quality.
She is currently requesting help to buy fertilizers, manure and pest-control substances in order to provide maintenance to her coffee crops and to reinforce her vivarium, as it is still flourishing.
Her plans for the future include owing a vast coffee plantation that will keep on being profitable, thus providing an income for her family; she hopes her plantation can be handed down and used for generations; she also aims at keeping her crops healthy, as this is the only source of income for her family, as in this way she will be able to continue paying for her children’s education as she has done to today.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, manure and pest-control substances.

loans.name: Oshin

texts.es: Oshin, de 21 años,es soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres junto a sus hermanos, su madre y sus dos  sobrinos.Oshin se dedica a la venta de diversos cosméticos como perfumes, colonias aromáticas, cremas corporales, lociones, lápices para labios, rimel y otros accesorios femeninos como aretes y collares. Realiza las ventas por catálogos de diversas marcas que prefiere el público femenino. Toda su mercadería es enviada la fecha programada en grandes paquetes desde otra ciudad. A diario va en busca de clientes por las calles de su barrio y vende al contado o a crédito. Realiza este oficio hace 4 años. Trabaja sola y se siente muy satisfecha por lo bien que le va hasta ahora.Le gusta mucho tener este trabajo porque le permite disponer de su tiempo durante las horas que no está trabajando ya que puede realizar las labores de su hogar con mucha comodidad, además a aprendido a ganarse el respeto y la confianza de los clientes en base a su buen trato y su gran sonrisa. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 400 soles y está agradecida y contenta al saber que sigue contando con el apoyo financiero que necesita para avanzar con su negocio.El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería conformada por perfumes, cremas, aretes, collares y otros accesorios para continuar vendiendo.
texts.en:
Oshin is 21 years old, single, and lives at her parents’ house with her siblings, her mother, and two nephews. She decided to sell a variety of cosmetics such as perfumes, aromatic colognes, body crèmes, lotions, lip pencils, Rimmel mascara, as well as women’s accessories such as earrings and necklaces. All of her merchandise is shipped from another city in large boxes on a scheduled date. She travels through the streets of her neighborhood in search of customers and then sells her products for cash or on credit. Oshin has been in this line of work for four years. She works alone and is very pleased that she has been successful to this point. Oshin enjoys her work very much because it allows her the free time to take care of the household chores without feeling rushed. In addition, she has learned to gain the respect and trust of her customers by treating them well and offering them a huge smile.

Oshin is taking this opportunity to request 400 PEN. She is grateful and pleased to know that she continues to have the financial support she needs to advance her business. The amount she requested will be used to buy merchandise such as perfumes, crèmes, earrings, necklaces, and other accessories so that she can continue her sales.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, crèmes, earrings, necklaces, and other accessories.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel, tiene 37 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tienen 3 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Victoria, Yoro. Miguel siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, de maíz y frijoles y  lleva 7 años de dedicarse a cultivar café. Tiene su propia finca de café y la producción la vende en grano húmedo en el mercado local de la comunidad. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 15,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizantes, abonos y limpiar el cultivo. Su objetivo es mantener su finca en buenas condiciones para sacar buenas cosechas y de las ganancias piensa comprar más terreno para ampliar la siembra. También quiere que sus hijos terminen de estudiar y lograr un nivel de vida mejor.
texts.en: Miguel, age 37, lives with his partner. They have three children and live in a small town in the municipality of Victoria, Yoro. Miguel has always worked in agriculture, sowing corn and beans, and he started cultivating coffee seven years ago. He has his own coffee farm and sells his product in wet grain form at a local community market. He is requesting a loan of 15,000 lempiras for the purchase of fertilizer and manure, and to clean up the land. His goal is to keep his farm in good condition in order to obtain a good harvest. With his earnings, he plans to buy more land to expand his production. He also wants his children to finish studying and obtain a better living standard.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer, and to pay labourers to clean up the land.

loans.name: La Providence De Dilaire Group

texts.fr:
Miliane est la coordinatrice de son groupe La Providence de Dilaire. Elle habite dans la région de Dilaire dans Trou-du-Nord d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Elle a dirigé son commerce de vente de produits divers pendant les 8 dernières années. Elle est marie et elle a 5 enfants.

Miliane voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans la vetement, chaussures, cosmetiques, etc. Des autres membres du groupe ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre des produits divers comme cosmétiques, vêtements, chaussures et du charbon. Miliane espère qu'avec ce prêt peut faire croître votre entreprise.
texts.en:
Miliane is the coordinator of her group La Providence de Dilaire. She lives in the Dilaire region, in Trou-du-Nord, Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. 

Miliane would like to use this loan to invest in clothing, shoes, cosmetics, etc. to sell.  Other members of the group have need of a loan for businesses that sell such products as cosmetics, clothing, shoes, and charcoal. Miliane hopes that this loan will make her enterprise grow.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, clothing, and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Shama

texts.en: Ms. Shama is a 23-year-old lady and she has been in the business of making footballs for many years. Her father passed away 10 years ago so her mother started a business of stitching footballs. Shama joined her mother’s business and is now well known in her community for providing best quality footballs in different sizes. She earns enough to bear the expenses of her family members. For the improvement of her business, she contacted a Kashf Foundation business development officer for a loan of Rs. 25,000. The amount will be used to purchase rubber bladders and leather covers in large quantities in order to cater to more customers without delay. She is hopeful to increase her sales which ultimately will help in generating more cash. She dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase rubber bladders and leather covers in large quantities.

loans.name: Kishwar

texts.en:
Ms. Kishwar is a 25 year-old married woman and the mother of two sons. She started stitching work considering she can manage the circle of home well and can better take care of her sons. Her husband is employed with a low salary income that is insufficient to meet the needs of the family members. So three years ago Kishwar began stitching work in her house to contribute to the family income. Kishwar is an expert in stitching trousers and has made her mark with it. She purchases open cloth from the market and then makes trousers and sells them to the people of her vicinity. 

It’s her third year with Kiva partner Kashf Foundation.  She is currently requesting a loan of Rs. 20,000 in order to buy cloth, thread and zippers in large quantities. She expects to boost her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread and zippers in large quantities.

loans.name: Zikria

texts.en:
Ms. Zikria is a 53-year-old married woman. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. Her husband is also a tailor by profession. Zikria accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of their household with the educational needs of their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. 

At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. She has now requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 in order to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, zippers and lace in various colors. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, zippers and lace in various colors.

loans.name: Adjeley's Group

texts.en:
